loc_1.name: Ba Na Hills – Nui Chua Tourist Area
loc_1.description: Located at an altitude of 1,487m above sea level, Sun World Ba Na Hills is known as a "paradise on earth," boasting a wonderful climate and fascinating natural landscapes. Come to Sun World Ba Na Hills to experience four seasons in one day along with various festive activities, entertainment, and a diverse array of delicious cuisine.
loc_1.address: An Son Village, Hoa Ninh Commune, Hoa Vang District, Da Nang City, Vietnam
advise: Buy cable car tickets in advance to avoid long queues.
Bring warm clothes as the temperature in the mountains is 8-10°C lower than in the city.
Adhere to safety regulations when using the cable car and participating in activities.
Maintain cleanliness, do not litter.
Respect the architectural structures, do not write, draw, or stick stickers.
loc_1.long_description: Ba Na Hills - Nui Chua, often dubbed the "road to paradise," is located at an altitude of 1,487 meters above sea level and is famous for its mild climate and the unique experience of having four seasons in one day. Visitors here can travel by a world-record-holding cable car system, crossing majestic primeval forests to admire the panoramic view of nature from above. The most impressive highlight is the Golden Bridge, winding through the clouds and supported by gigantic hands, a masterpiece of architecture that has become a hallmark of Da Nang tourism. In addition, the resort features the French Village with its charming, romantic European beauty, along with the modern and vibrant indoor amusement park, Fantasy Park. The tranquil spiritual space at Linh Ung Pagoda or the colorful flower garden, Le Jardin D’Amour, are also attractive stops, creating an international-class resort and entertainment complex.

loc_2.name: Da Nang Cathedral
loc_2.description: The Cathedral or the Rooster Church is located right in the city center, attracting visitors with its ancient and unique European architecture. The Rooster Church embodies religious beauty and is an irresistible destination for those who love to take photos.
loc_2.address: 156 Trần Phú, Hải Châu 1, Hải Châu, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Dress modestly and appropriately when entering spiritual areas (avoid shorts and tank tops).
Keep silent, do not make noise, respect the sacred space.
No flash photography or inappropriate selfies in the worship area.
loc_2.long_description: The Da Nang Cathedral, affectionately known by locals as "Chicken Church" due to the gray rooster symbol on the top of the bell tower, is the only church built in Da Nang during the French colonial period. It features a strong Gothic architectural style with pointed arches and soaring lines. The church's façade is characterized by a distinctive pink color, creating a gentle yet solemn beauty in the bustling city center. Behind the church is the solemnly arranged grotto of Our Lady, which serves as an important place of worship for parishioners. This is an essential check-in spot for tourists visiting Da Nang, thanks to its classical architectural beauty and long history.

loc_3.name: Hội An Ancient Town
loc_3.description: Hội An Ancient Town is a famous city in Quảng Nam province, an ancient town that has preserved nearly intact over 1000 architectural relics from streets, houses, assembly halls, communal houses, pagodas, temples, clan churches, ancient wells… to traditional dishes and the soul of the local people. A trip to Hội An will captivate travelers with its timeless beauty, incredibly rustic and simple.
loc_3.address: Minh An Ward, Hoi An, Quang Nam, Vietnam
advise: Respect the ancient architecture, do not write, draw, or stick stickers.
Dress appropriately when entering ancient houses and assembly halls.
Maintain cleanliness, do not litter.
Respect the local culture and the indigenous people.
Bargain politely when shopping.
loc_3.long_description: Hội An Ancient Town is an ancient urban area located downstream of the Thu Bồn River, in Quảng Nam Province, about 30 km south of Đà Nẵng. Recognized by UNESCO as a World Cultural Heritage site, Hội An is famous for the peaceful beauty of its moss-covered tiled houses, distinctive yellow walls, and the vibrant lanterns that illuminate the night. It was once a bustling international trading port in the 17th-18th centuries, serving as a cultural crossroads between Vietnam, Japan, and China. Visitors to Hội An can explore the Japanese Covered Bridge, ancient guild halls, take a boat ride to release lanterns on the Hoài River, and enjoy renowned street food such as Cao Lầu and Mì Quảng. The atmosphere here is completely separate from the hustle and bustle of urban life, providing a deep sense of nostalgia.

loc_4.name: Han Market Da Nang
loc_4.description: Han Market in Da Nang is one of the oldest traditional markets in the city and continues to attract a large number of visitors for sightseeing, taking souvenir photos, and shopping.
loc_4.address: 119 Trần Phú, Hải Châu 1 Ward, Hải Châu District, Da Nang City, Vietnam
loc_4.advise: Please behave in a civilized and polite manner.
loc_4.long_description: Han Market is the most famous and oldest traditional market in Da Nang, located in a prime position adjacent to four main streets and near the Han River Bridge. It is considered a "shopping paradise" for tourists with a variety of goods ranging from clothing and footwear to souvenirs. Notably, Han Market is famous for its dried foods and Central Vietnam specialties such as fermented fish sauce, dried fish, sun-dried squid, and various candies. The bustling atmosphere here vividly reflects the commercial culture of the people of Da Nang. Tourists often visit Han Market to buy gifts and enjoy local snacks right at the food area inside the market.

loc_5.name: Hot Springs Park - Mount Than Tai
loc_5.description: Located in the Ba Na-Nui Chua Nature Reserve, Phu Tuc Village, Hoa Phu Commune, Hoa Vang District, Da Nang City, the Thần Tài Hot Spring Park can be considered a masterpiece bestowed by nature upon the capital of Central Vietnam, covering an area of over 160 hectares. Despite being in a coastal city, this place features a unique climate reminiscent of Ba Na, with four seasons in a day.
loc_5.address: Hoa Phu Ward, Hoa Vang District, Da Nang City, Vietnam
advise: Keep the environment clean, do not litter.
Protect the greenery, do not pick flowers or break branches.
Do not make noise, respect the common space.
Comply with the opening hours regulations.
Keep children safe while playing.
loc_5.long_description: Hot Springs Park - Núi Thần Tài is located in the Bà Nà Núi Chúa Nature Reserve and is an ideal wellness retreat. It features a natural hot spring water source originating from the sacred mountain, rich in minerals and beneficial for health. The resort is designed in a Japanese style, offering services such as Onsen baths, mud baths, tea baths, coffee baths, and modern steam baths. Additionally, visitors can enjoy the water park, explore the Long Tiên Cave, or experience boiling longevity eggs in hot mineral water. This is a wonderful destination to relax and recharge amidst the majestic natural scenery of the mountains and forests.

loc_6.name: Asia Park - Sun World Asia Park
loc_6.description: When it comes to the top entertainment spots in Da Nang, we cannot overlook Asia Park Danang. Located on an area of about 800 hectares, Asia Park Danang recreates 10 different cultures from Asia, offering you emotional travel and gaming experiences. It could be a thrilling moment with the adrenaline-pumping Singapore Sling ride, enjoying the views on Vietnam's most modern high-altitude train, or taking photos at the giant Sun Wheel.
loc_6.address: Hoa Cuong, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Maintain cleanliness, do not litter.
Protect the greenery, do not pick flowers or break branches.
No noise, respect the common space.
Comply with the opening hours regulations.
Keep children safe while playing.
loc_6.long_description: Sun World Asia Park is a large outdoor amusement park located right by the Han River. The park's iconic highlight is the Sun Wheel - one of the tallest Ferris wheels in the world, allowing visitors to enjoy panoramic views of Da Nang from above. The park is divided into various cultural areas, simulating the architectural features of 10 Asian countries such as Japan, South Korea, India, Thailand, and more. In addition, it boasts a modern thrill ride system and an indoor Family Entertainment Center (FEC) for families and children. Asia Park is a vibrant destination at night, frequently hosting unique festivals and cultural events.

loc_7.name: Ho Chi Minh Museum
loc_7.description: The Ho Chi Minh Museum in Da Nang officially opened on May 19, 1977, and is a place that displays artifacts related to the life and revolutionary career of Uncle Ho, as well as heroic evidence from the struggle to protect the Fatherland.
loc_7.address: 1 Duy Tân, Hoa Cuong Bac, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Maintain silence, do not create noise in the exhibition space.
Do not touch the artifacts or displayed artworks.
Do not use flash when taking photos (if photography is allowed).
Maintain cleanliness, do not eat or drink in the display area.
Manage your personal belongings independently, and do not bring bulky items.
loc_7.long_description: The Ho Chi Minh Museum branch of Military Region 5 is a place that preserves sacred artifacts about the life and revolutionary career of President Ho Chi Minh, especially his affection for the Central region. Located within a large campus alongside the Museum of Region 5, it displays thousands of valuable documents, artifacts, and historical images. The museum's architecture is modeled after Uncle Ho's stilt house in Hanoi, creating a sense of closeness and reverence. In addition to the indoor exhibition area, the outdoor section showcases various types of weapons and large military equipment such as aircraft, tanks, and artillery that participated in the wars. This is a significant address for educating patriotic traditions and an important historical site in Da Nang.

loc_8.name: Bàn Cờ Peak
loc_8.description: Bàn Cờ Peak is a famous tourist destination that attracts visitors not only for its simplicity, modesty, and rustic charm in the local culture, but also for the historical legends surrounding the place that fascinate many people.
loc_8.address: Son Tra Peninsula, Tho Quang, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the natural environment.
Comply with safety signs and designated pathways.
Do not pick flowers, break branches, or harm plants.
Be careful when moving on complex terrain.
Bring enough drinking water and necessary supplies.
loc_8.long_description: Bàn Cờ Peak is known as the "roof" of the Sơn Trà Peninsula, located at an altitude of about 700m above sea level. The name of this landmark is associated with the legend of two immortal beings playing chess on the mountain top, and there is still a statue of the Immortal sitting in contemplation beside a stone chessboard. The road to Bàn Cờ Peak is quite steep and winding, making it a favorite route for those who love adventure and exploring nature. From this position, visitors can gaze over the entire city of Đà Nẵng, Tiên Sa beach, and the distant Cù Lao Chàm. The scenery here is particularly mystical on foggy days or radiant in the light of dawn and dusk.

loc_9.name: Hoang Sa Exhibition Center
loc_9.description: The Hoang Sa Exhibition Center was established on August 8, 2017, and is a project of special significance, serving as a venue to display, introduce, and promote historical and legal documents that prove Vietnam's process of exploration, establishment, and protection of its sovereignty over the Hoang Sa archipelago in a genuine, continuous, and peaceful manner, in accordance with practical realities and international law.
loc_9.address: Hoang Sa Street, Tho Quang, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Maintain silence, do not create noise in the exhibition space.
Do not touch the artifacts or displayed artworks.
Do not use flash when taking photos (if photography is allowed).
Maintain cleanliness, do not eat or drink in the display area.
Manage your personal belongings yourself, and do not bring bulky items.
loc_9.opening_hours: 07:30 AM - 11:30 AM, 01:30 PM - 05:00 PM (Closed on Mondays)
loc_9.long_description: The Hoàng Sa Exhibition Center is a cultural and historical structure of great political significance, preserving and showcasing documents that prove Vietnam's sovereignty over the Hoàng Sa archipelago. The building is uniquely designed with the image of "the national sovereignty seal" firmly placed by the East Sea. Inside the museum, a rich collection of documents is displayed, including ancient maps, Han-Nom literature, and actual artifacts that affirm Vietnam's continuous establishment and enforcement of sovereignty over different periods. This is not only a tourist attraction but also a place to educate patriotism and the awareness of protecting maritime sovereignty for the younger generation and international visitors.

loc_10.name: Han River Bridge
loc_10.description: Put into operation in 2000, the Han River Bridge tourist destination in Da Nang is a source of pride for the city's residents. This is the first rotating bridge in Vietnam, awakening the economic, transportation, and tourism potential of the city.
loc_10.address: Han River Bridge, An Hai Bac, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with traffic safety rules, do not park indiscriminately.
Do not climb or sit on the bridge railing as it poses a danger.
Keep the environment clean, do not litter in the river.
Be mindful of personal belongings as this place is often crowded.
Do not obstruct traffic when taking photos.
loc_10.long_description: Han River Bridge is the first and only rotating bridge in Vietnam, and it symbolizes the vibrant life and aspirations of the city of Da Nang. The bridge was built with contributions from the local people, connecting the two main roads of Le Duan and Pham Van Dong. The most special feature of the bridge is its ability to rotate 90 degrees around its axis to allow large ships to pass through (currently mainly serving tourism on weekend nights). At night, Han River Bridge sparkles with lights reflecting on the water, creating a poetic scene. Strolling or taking a cruise to admire Han River Bridge is an enjoyable experience for all visitors.

loc_11.name: Da Nang Cham Sculpture Museum - Cham Museum
loc_11.description: The Da Nang Cham Sculpture Museum is the largest museum displaying Cham artifacts in Vietnam, under the Da Nang Museum.
loc_11.address: 02 September 2 Street, Binh Hien, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Keep quiet, do not make noise in the exhibition space.
Do not touch the Cham sculptures.
Do not use flash when taking photos.
Maintain cleanliness, do not eat or drink in the display area.
Respect the cultural and historical values of the artifacts.
loc_11.long_description: The Bảo Tàng Điêu Khắc Chăm Đà Nẵng is the largest museum in the world dedicated to preserving and displaying Cham sculpture art. The building was constructed during the French colonial period with Gothic architecture influenced by Cham temple styles, creating an ancient and solemn exhibition space. The museum currently houses thousands of artifacts made of sandstone, terracotta, and bronze, excavated from Cham Pa relics throughout Central and Central Highlands regions. The sculptures here, such as altars and statues of deities Shiva and Vishnu, reflect the pinnacle of carving art and the rich spiritual life of the ancient Cham Pa kingdom. This is a must-visit destination for those who love history, archaeology, and artistic culture.

loc_12.name: Da Nang Museum
loc_12.description: The Da Nang Museum was established in 1989 and was newly built at 24 Tran Phu (Thach Thang Ward, Hai Chau District)...
loc_12.address: 24 Trần Phú, Thạch Thang, Hải Châu, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Maintain silence, do not create noise in the exhibition space.
Do not touch the artifacts or displayed works of art.
Do not use flash when taking photos (if photography is allowed).
Maintain cleanliness, do not eat or drink in the display area.
Manage your personal belongings independently, and do not bring bulky items.
loc_12.long_description: The Da Nang Museum is located within the grounds of the National Special Monument Dien Hai Citadel, and it fully recreates the history of the formation and development of the city. With a modern exhibition space comprising three floors, the museum showcases over 2,500 valuable documents, images, and artifacts. The exhibition themes include natural history, society, revolutionary struggle history, war relics, and the cultural characteristics of the ethnic groups in Da Nang and Quang Nam. A striking highlight is the exhibition space featuring five sails symbolizing the coastal city reaching out to the ocean, located right in the main hall. The museum is an ideal place for visitors to gain a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of the land and people of Da Nang.

loc_13.name: Nguyen Hien Dinh Theater
loc_13.description: Nguyen Hien Dinh Tuong Theater is an attractive destination for many tourists, especially international visitors, thanks to its artistic performance program that is rich in the cultural nuances of Vietnamese folk art.
loc_13.address: 155 Phan Châu Trinh, Phước Ninh, Hải Châu, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with the rules and safety regulations of the amusement park.
Maintain general hygiene, do not litter.
Respect the queue, do not push in.
Take care to secure personal belongings.
Supervise children while participating in games.
loc_13.long_description: Nguyễn Hiển Dĩnh Tuồng Theater is a professional artistic unit that plays an important role in preserving and promoting the Tuồng (Hát Bội) art of Quảng. Named after a famous official and playwright of the Nguyễn dynasty, the theater gathers many talented and passionate artists and performers. Here, classic Tuồng plays, exemplary excerpts, and traditional art programs are regularly held to serve audiences both domestically and internationally. In particular, the theater has a program called "Hồn Việt," specially designed to introduce the essence of Tuồng culture to tourists. Visitors not only watch performances but also learn about the unique art of mask painting and Tuồng costumes.

loc_14.name: Fine Arts Museum
loc_14.description: The Museum of Fine Arts was established on July 29, 2014, and is one of the prominent museums in Da Nang, serving to preserve the artistic heritage values of the city and the Central Highlands region.
loc_14.address: 78 Le Duan, Thach Thang, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Keep quiet, do not make noise in the exhibition space.
Do not touch the artifacts or displayed artworks.
Do not use flash when taking photos (if photography is allowed).
Maintain cleanliness, do not eat or drink in the exhibition area.
Manage your personal belongings independently, and do not bring bulky items.
loc_14.long_description: The Da Nang Museum of Fine Arts is a place that preserves, honors, and showcases the artistic values of the Central Highlands region. The museum displays thousands of artworks made from various materials such as oil paint, lacquer, silk, wood sculpture, and graphics. The works here vividly reflect the life, people, and landscapes of the sunny and windy Central region, rich in cultural traditions. In addition to its permanent exhibition halls, the museum regularly organizes thematic exhibitions and author interactions. The artistic space here provides a relaxing atmosphere, making it an interesting destination for those who love beauty and creativity.

loc_15.name: APEC Park
loc_15.description: Apec Park was inaugurated on January 10, 2022, located in a prime position by the Han River. The design of the project reflects the desire to elevate Da Nang further, making it a dynamic, friendly, and peaceful city.
loc_15.address: September 2nd Street, Binh Hien, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Maintain cleanliness, do not litter.
Protect the greenery, do not pick flowers or break branches.
No loud noise, respect shared spaces.
Comply with the opening hours regulations.
Keep children safe while playing.
loc_15.long_description: APEC Park is located by the Han River, near the Dragon Bridge, and is an impressive architectural structure that was inaugurated and expanded in 2022. The highlight of the park is the gently curving kite-shaped dome area, symbolizing the soaring and far-reaching integration of Da Nang city. The park features a cool green space with lawns, trees, and harmoniously arranged architectural layers, creating a modern and spacious public area. It is an ideal spot for locals and tourists to stroll, relax, and organize outdoor cultural and artistic activities. At night, the artistic lighting system transforms APEC Park into a dazzling and colorful check-in point.

loc_16.name: Nam Sơn Pagoda
loc_16.description: Established in 1962, with its majestic and serene beauty that is no less poetic, Nam Son Pagoda has long been more than just a cultural and religious destination for the locals; it has also become an attractive tourist site for visitors.
loc_16.address: Nguyen Khai Trac Street, Cam Nam, Hoa Chau, Hoa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Dress modestly and appropriately when entering spiritual areas (avoid shorts and tank tops).
Keep silent, do not make noise, respect the sacred space.
Do not touch the Buddha statue or spiritual artifacts without permission.
Remove your shoes before entering the main shrine.
Do not take flash photos or inappropriate selfies in the worship area.
loc_16.long_description: Nam Son Pagoda, located in Hoa Vang District, is known as one of the most beautiful and peaceful pagodas in Da Nang. The pagoda stands out with its architecture that reflects the essence of ancient Vietnamese culture, harmoniously combining the beauty of reverence with the picturesque natural scenery. The spacious grounds of the pagoda feature many elements such as the main hall, the fish release pond, the Tam Tang bridge, and the Vong Nguyet pavilion, all meticulously arranged with attention to detail. The atmosphere at the pagoda is very tranquil, distinctly separated from the hustle and bustle of the city, providing a sense of peace for anyone who visits. This is a spiritual tourism destination that attracts many Buddhists and travelers to pay homage, enjoy the scenery, and seek balance in their souls.

loc_17.name: Helio Center
loc_17.description: Helio Center – The largest entertainment complex and night market in Da Nang. This place offers a variety of entertainment activities such as an indoor gaming area, a children's playground, a night market, and a cinema complex.
loc_17.address: 01 2nd September Street, Hoa Cuong Bac, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with the rules and safety regulations of the amusement park.
Maintain general hygiene, do not litter.
Respect the queue, do not push in.
Take care to secure personal belongings.
Supervise children while participating in games.
loc_17.long_description: Helio Center is the largest entertainment complex and night market in Da Nang, located right in the city center. This area includes Helio Kids (a play area for children), Helio Play (a vibrant gaming world), and especially the famous Helio Night Market. The Helio Night Market attracts visitors with its grand culinary space featuring hundreds of delicious dishes from seafood, grilled foods to street snacks. In addition to dining and shopping, there is also an outdoor music stage with bands performing every night, creating a lively festival atmosphere. Helio Center is the perfect nighttime entertainment destination for families and groups of young friends.

loc_18.name: Nam Ô Reef
loc_18.description: Nam Ô Reef - a place dubbed as the paradise of stones, possesses an alluring pristine beauty. Here, it vividly describes the simple rhythm of life of the fishing village people in the coastal area of Da Nang and offers a memorable travel experience.
loc_18.address: Nam Ô ancient fishing village, Hòa Hiệp Nam, Liên Chiểu, Da Nang, Vietnam.
advise: Do not litter, protect the natural environment.
Comply with safety signs and designated pathways.
Do not pick flowers, break branches, or harm plants.
Be careful when moving on complex terrain.
Bring enough drinking water and necessary supplies.
loc_18.long_description: Rạn Nam Ô is a coral reef located along the coast of Hòa Hiệp Nam ward, Liên Chiểu district, famous for its pristine and enchanting beauty. The special feature of Rạn Nam Ô is that in spring (around January-February), the rocks here are covered with a layer of lush green moss, soft as velvet, creating a scene reminiscent of a fairyland. When the tide goes out, the mossy rocks emerge amidst the clear blue sea, attracting many photographers and tourists to capture the moment. In addition to the mossy rocks, there is also a smooth golden sandy beach and a peaceful traditional fishing village. Rạn Nam Ô is an ideal destination for those who love outdoor travel, camping, and exploring the beauty of unspoiled nature.

loc_19.name: The thousand-year-old banyan tree
loc_19.description: Situated at an altitude of over 700m above sea level, this ancient tree stands majestically, with its enormous roots plunging into the ground and its lush, densely intertwined foliage. It is regarded as the "sacred lighthouse" residing in the Son Tra Peninsula.
loc_19.address: Son Tra Peninsula, Tho Quang, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the natural environment.
Comply with safety signs and designated pathways.
Do not pick flowers, break branches, or harm plants.
Be careful when moving on complex terrain.
Bring enough drinking water and necessary supplies.
loc_19.long_description: The thousand-year-old banyan tree (also known as the giant banyan tree) is located in the Son Tra Nature Reserve and is considered the "elder" of the mountains and forests here. The tree is estimated to be around 800 to 1,000 years old, with a trunk circumference of up to 10 meters and a system of 26 aerial roots that penetrate deep into the ground, creating a magnificent and unique shape. The expansive canopy covers an area, creating a cool and mysterious space, which is home to many rare species of flora and fauna, especially the brown-legged langur. This is an interesting stop on the journey to explore Son Tra, where visitors can admire the vigorous vitality of nature. The banyan tree was recognized as a Vietnam Heritage Tree in 2014.

loc_20.name: Son Thuy Beach
loc_20.description: This is one of the most beautiful beaches and a potential gem of the city, featuring fine white sand and wonderfully clear water.
loc_20.address: Vo Nguyen Giap Street, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the clean and beautiful marine environment.
Follow safety signs, do not swim in dangerous areas.
Do not bring sharp or dangerous objects to the beach.
Respect the personal space of others.
Take care to protect your personal belongings.
loc_20.long_description: Sơn Thủy Beach, located in Ngũ Hành Sơn District, is a beach that still retains many pristine and peaceful features compared to the bustling Mỹ Khê Beach. This beach boasts fine white sand, clear blue water, and a gentle slope, making it very suitable for swimming and relaxation. Due to not being overly exploited for tourism, Sơn Thủy offers a private and tranquil space, ideal for travelers looking to escape the crowds. Along the beach are high-end resorts, creating a harmonious blend of nature and luxurious services. Visitors here can leisurely stroll and enjoy the beautiful sunrise or sunset over the sea.

loc_21.name: Non Nuoc Beach
loc_21.description: Non Nuoc Beach was once ranked by Forbes (a leading American magazine) as one of the 6 most beautiful beaches in the world in 2005. Although it has been developed for tourism by the authorities for many years, Non Nuoc Beach still retains its original pristine beauty.
loc_21.address: located on the coast of Da Nang, Hoa Hai, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the clean and beautiful marine environment.
Follow safety signs, do not swim in dangerous areas.
Do not bring sharp or dangerous objects to the beach.
Respect the privacy of others.
Take good care of your personal belongings.
loc_21.long_description: Non Nuoc Beach stretches 5km at the foot of the Marble Mountains and has been voted by Forbes magazine as one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. This beach is famous for the enchanting beauty of its clear blue waters, fine white sand, and the sound of casuarina trees swaying in the wind. The location of the beach is very convenient, being close to the Marble Mountains and surrounded by many international 5-star resorts. Non Nuoc Beach has gentle waves and clean water, making it ideal for water sports activities such as surfing and beach volleyball. It is a paradise for travelers who want to enjoy a luxurious vacation while exploring the local stone carving culture.

loc_22.name: The Ecotourism Area located in Hòa Bắc commune.
loc_22.description: Hoa Bac Tourist Area is located upstream of the Cu De River, where the scenery is peaceful, combining both pristine beauty and charm. Surrounding the lush green rice fields is a winding hillside road.
loc_22.address: Hòa Bắc Commune, Hòa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the natural environment.
Comply with safety signs and designated pathways.
Do not pick flowers, break branches, or harm plants.
Be careful when moving on complex terrain.
Bring enough drinking water and necessary supplies.
loc_22.long_description: Hòa Bắc commune in Hòa Vang district is emerging as an attractive community-based eco-tourism destination, located in the buffer zone of Bạch Mã National Park and Bà Nà - Núi Chúa. This area boasts stunning natural landscapes with flowing rivers, lush primary forests, and vast sugarcane fields. The resorts here (such as Yên Retreat, Vũng Bọt...) focus on camping, picnicking by the stream, and exploring the culture of the Cơ Tu ethnic group. Visitors to Hòa Bắc will immerse themselves in the fresh nature, completely separated from the city's dust and enjoy local rustic dishes. This is an ideal location for the "healing" travel trend and sustainable nature exploration.

loc_23.name: Quan Thế Âm Pagoda
loc_23.description: Quan Am Pagoda is one of the famous sacred temples in Da Nang. With its picturesque scenery, this place offers visitors a sense of true peace and tranquility.
loc_23.address: 48 Su Van Hanh, Hoa Hai, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Dress modestly and appropriately when entering spiritual areas (avoid shorts and tank tops).
Maintain silence, avoid making noise, and respect the sacred space.
Do not touch the Buddha statue or spiritual artifacts without permission.
Remove your shoes before entering the main shrine.
Do not take flash photos or inappropriate selfies in the worship area.
loc_23.long_description: Quan Thế Âm Pagoda is located at the foot of Kim Sơn Mountain, within the scenic area of Ngũ Hành Sơn, and is one of the largest and most sacred temples in Da Nang. The temple is set in a vast area with picturesque landscapes, featuring a mysterious system of natural caves behind it, among which the Quan Âm Cave stands out. This place is famous for the Quan Thế Âm Festival (held on the 19th day of the second lunar month each year), a national-scale festival that attracts thousands of monks, Buddhists, and visitors from all over. The majestic architecture of the temple, combined with the magnificent mountain scenery, creates a serene and transcendent spiritual space. In addition to worshiping, visitors can also explore the Buddhist Culture Museum located right within the temple grounds.

loc_24.name: Nam Ô Fish Sauce Village
loc_24.description: Nam Ô fish sauce village is a traditional fish sauce craft village located at the foot of Hai Van Pass, which has existed for hundreds of years and has been recognized as a National Intangible Cultural Heritage.
loc_24.address: Hiep Hoa, Lien Chieu, Da Nang, Vietnam
loc_24.advise: Please behave in a civilized and polite manner.
loc_24.long_description: Nam Ô fish sauce village is located at the foot of Hai Van Pass, with a history of formation and development of over 400 years, famous for its rich and delicious traditional fish sauce. Nam Ô fish sauce is made entirely by hand from fresh anchovies caught right in the local sea and aged Ca Na salt. The meticulous fermentation process in jackfruit wood barrels lasts from 12 to 18 months, producing drops of fish sauce with a deep reddish-brown color, a sweet aftertaste, and rich natural protein. When visiting the village, tourists will witness the intricate production process firsthand and listen to stories about the craft of fish sauce making passed down through generations. The Nam Ô fish sauce brand has been recognized as a national intangible cultural heritage.

loc_25.name: Hai Van Pass
loc_25.description: Located between Huế and Đà Nẵng, Hai Van Pass is known as "the most magnificent mountain pass in the world" with its poetic landscapes, one side being mountains and the other a deep abyss, along with clouds hovering mid-air creating a mesmerizing scene reminiscent of a fairyland.
loc_25.address: Lang Co, Phu Loc, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam and Hoa Hiep Bac, Lien Chieu, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the natural environment.
Comply with safety signs and designated pathways.
Do not pick flowers, break branches, or harm plants.
Be careful when moving on complex terrain.
Bring enough drinking water and necessary supplies.
loc_25.long_description: My Khe Beach has been honored by Forbes magazine as one of the 6 most attractive beaches in the world and is a source of pride for Da Nang tourism. The beach features a long stretch of fine white sand, warm water year-round, gentle waves, and a high level of safety, making it ideal for all kinds of water activities. Along the coastline, there is a well-developed tourism infrastructure with numerous hotels, seafood restaurants, and vibrant beach bars. My Khe is not only beautiful during the day but also very romantic at night, providing a place for visitors to stroll along the beach and admire the Son Tra Peninsula and the statue of Lady Buddha from afar. This is a must-visit destination for any traveler coming to this livable city.

loc_26.name: My Khe Beach
loc_26.description: My Khe Beach was once voted by Forbes magazine as one of the 6 most beautiful beaches in the world. With its smooth white sand stretching out, clear blue water, and gentle waves, this is an ideal destination for travelers looking to swim, relax, and participate in water sports such as surfing and kayaking.
loc_26.address: Vo Nguyen Giap Street, Phuoc My, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the marine environment.
Follow safety signs, do not swim in dangerous areas.
Respect the personal space of others.
Take care to safeguard your personal belongings.
Do not bring sharp objects to the beach.
loc_26.long_description: Dragon Bridge is a unique architectural symbol and a source of pride for the people of Da Nang, spanning the Han River and connecting the international airport with tourist beaches. The bridge is designed to resemble a dragon from the Ly dynasty soaring towards the sea, reflecting the city's strong desire for development. The most attractive feature of Dragon Bridge is the spectacular fire and water performance that takes place at 21:00 on Saturdays, Sundays, and major holidays. The modern lighting system with thousands of LED lights that change colors flexibly makes the bridge sparkle brilliantly at night. This is a "legendary" check-in spot that every visitor to Da Nang must visit.

loc_27.name: Dragon Bridge
loc_27.description: Dragon Bridge is the most famous symbol of Da Nang, shaped like a dragon arching over the Han River. The special feature of the bridge is the fire and water performance at 21:00 on Saturday nights, Sundays, and holidays, attracting thousands of tourists. The bridge is 666 meters long and was inaugurated in 2013 to celebrate the 38th anniversary of Da Nang's Liberation.
loc_27.address: Dragon Bridge, Hải Châu, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with traffic safety rules.
Do not stop or park on the bridge to take photos.
Watch the fire-breathing dragon on weekends (9 PM - 9:15 PM on Saturday and Sunday).
Maintain cleanliness, do not litter in the river.
Be mindful of personal belongings as this place is often crowded.
loc_27.opening_hours: Open all day, fire and water show: 21:00 (Saturday, Sunday, and holidays)
loc_27.long_description: The Ngũ Hành Sơn (Marble Mountains) is a complex consisting of 5 limestone mountains rising amidst the sandy beach, named after the Five Elements theory: Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth. This place possesses a magical beauty that combines mysterious caves, ancient temples, and majestic nature. Visitors can explore Huyền Không Cave - the most beautiful open-air cave, or visit the ancient Tam Thai Pagoda and Linh Ứng Pagoda located halfway up the mountain. From Vọng Hải Đài or Vọng Giang Đài, you can gaze at the panoramic view of the sea and the winding Cổ Cò River. Ngũ Hành Sơn is not only a tourist attraction but also a symbol of the spiritual and historical heritage of the Quảng Nam - Đà Nẵng region.

loc_28.name: Marble Mountains
loc_28.description: Ngũ Hành Sơn is a cluster of 5 limestone and marble mountains named after the 5 elements: Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth. This place features many beautiful natural caves such as Huyền Không Cave, Âm Phủ Cave, and sacred temples like Linh Ứng Pagoda, as well as the scenic viewpoint Vọng Giang Đài. It is a famous landmark that combines nature and spirituality.
loc_28.address: 81 Huyền Trân Công Chúa, Hòa Hải, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Wear non-slip sports shoes as there are many steep stairs.
Dress appropriately when entering temples and caves.
Do not touch the stalactites, artifacts in the cave.
Keep the environment clean, do not litter.
Be careful when climbing, and follow safety signs.
loc_28.long_description: Linh Ung Pagoda at Bai But is located on the Son Tra Peninsula and is considered a Buddhist realm in the earthly world, famous for the tallest statue of the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara in Vietnam (67m). The statue stands with its back against the mountain, facing the East Sea, one hand forming the samadhi mudra and the other holding a vase of nectar, as if bestowing blessings and protecting fishermen. The pagoda complex features impressive architecture, blending traditional and modern elements, with a spacious and airy courtyard planted with many bonsai trees. From the pagoda gate, visitors can admire the panoramic view of the emerald Da Nang Bay and the beautiful crescent-shaped coastline. This is an important spiritual tourism destination that provides a sense of tranquility and absolute peace.

loc_29.name: Linh Ung Pagoda Bai But
loc_29.description: Linh Ung Pagoda Bai But is located on the Son Tra Peninsula, famous for its 67m tall statue of the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara - the tallest Buddha statue in Vietnam. From here, one can enjoy a panoramic view of Da Nang city and the vast sea. The pagoda was started in July 2004 and inaugurated on July 30, 2010, making it an attractive spiritual and tourist destination.
loc_29.address: Bai But, Son Tra Peninsula, Tho Quang, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Dress modestly and wear formal attire (avoid shorts and tank tops).
Remove your shoes before entering the shrine.
Keep silent, do not make noise in the temple area.
Do not take flash photos or inappropriate selfies with the Buddha statue.
Respect the ongoing spiritual rituals.
loc_29.long_description: Sơn Trà Peninsula is known as the "precious gem" or "green lung" of Da Nang, and it is the only primary forest in Vietnam located right in the heart of the city. With three sides bordering the sea and one side adjacent to the urban area, Sơn Trà boasts a remarkably rich ecosystem of flora and fauna, especially the Brown-legged Macaque - the queen of primate species. The coastal road that winds around the peninsula is one of the most beautiful trekking routes in Central Vietnam, leading to many famous landmarks such as Bàn Cờ Peak, the Thousand-Year-Old Banyan Tree, and Nghê Cape. In Sơn Trà, visitors can hike in the mountains to enjoy the clouds and scenery, as well as dive in the sea to explore coral reefs at pristine beaches.

loc_30.name: Son Tra Peninsula
loc_30.description: Sơn Trà Peninsula is dubbed the 'green lung' of Da Nang, with a vast area of over 4,400 ha of primary forest. This place features many attractions such as Linh Ung Pagoda, Ban Co Peak, Tien Sa Lighthouse, Nghe Cape, and is home to the rare brown-legged douc langur. The maximum elevation is 693m above sea level.
loc_30.address: Son Tra Peninsula, Tho Quang, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the natural environment.
Comply with safety signs and designated pathways.
Do not pick flowers, break branches, or harm plants.
Be careful when moving on complex terrain.
Bring enough drinking water and necessary supplies.
loc_30.long_description: Love Lock Bridge is located on the East bank of the Han River, right at the beginning of the Dragon Bridge, and is a romantic destination that attracts many couples and young people. The bridge is designed in an arc shape, featuring bright red heart-shaped lamp posts, creating a shimmering and magical scene at night. A special highlight is the bridge's railing, where couples hang padlocks engraved with their names to symbolize their strong and everlasting love. There is also a statue of the "Carp Turning into a Dragon" that spouts water, symbolizing luck and prosperity. With its open space and views overlooking the picturesque Han River, it is an ideal place for a stroll and to capture sweet memories in photographs.

loc_31.name: Love Lock Bridge
loc_31.description: The Love Bridge is a famous pedestrian bridge spanning the Han River, where couples lock love padlocks to mark their affection and wish for lasting happiness. This is a romantic check-in spot, especially beautiful in the evening when the twinkling lights reflect on the surface of the Han River.
loc_31.address: West Bank of Han River, near Han River Bridge, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with traffic safety rules, do not park indiscriminately.
Do not climb or sit on the bridge railing as it is dangerous.
Maintain cleanliness, do not litter in the river.
Be mindful of personal belongings as this place is often crowded.
Do not obstruct traffic when taking photos.
loc_31.long_description: Trần Thị Lý Bridge boasts a modern and unique beauty with its three-dimensional cable-stayed design and a 12-degree inclined tower towards the West, resembling a sail catching the wind reaching out to the vast sea. The bridge is located on the site of the old French railway bridge, which has now become an impressive architectural highlight spanning the Han River. The artistic color-changing lighting system makes the bridge stand out and appear soft against the night backdrop, contrasting sharply with the strong presence of the Dragon Bridge or the Rotating Bridge. At the foot of the bridge is a spacious and airy area where locals often gather to have fun, skate, and enjoy the breeze. Trần Thị Lý Bridge not only addresses traffic issues but also contributes to the collection of legendary bridges in Da Nang.

loc_32.name: Tran Thi Ly Bridge
loc_32.description: Tran Thi Ly Bridge features a unique sail-shaped design and is a modern architectural symbol of Da Nang. The 731m long cable-stayed bridge spans the Han River upstream and is particularly beautiful when illuminated at night with a color-changing LED lighting system, creating a romantic scene along the riverbank.
loc_32.address: Tran Thi Ly Bridge, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Adhere to traffic safety rules, do not park indiscriminately.
Do not climb or sit on the bridge railings as it poses a danger.
Keep the environment clean, do not litter in the river.
Be mindful of personal belongings as this place is often crowded.
Do not obstruct traffic when taking photos.
loc_32.long_description: Thuan Phuoc Bridge is the longest suspension bridge in Vietnam, located at the estuary where the Han River flows into Da Nang Bay. The bridge has a slender, graceful appearance but is incredibly sturdy, connecting two bustling coastal roads: Nguyen Tat Thanh and Hoang Sa - Truong Sa. From a distance, Thuan Phuoc Bridge looks like a silk ribbon stretching across the horizon, particularly enchanting at sunset or when the city lights up. The bridge is situated at a high elevation, offering a fantastic panoramic view of the Son Tra Peninsula, Tien Sa Port, and the entire city. However, due to its location at the estuary, the winds on the bridge can be quite strong, so motorbike riders passing through should pay attention to safety.

loc_33.name: Thuan Phuoc Bridge
loc_33.description: Thuan Phuoc Bridge is the longest cable-stayed bridge in Vietnam, with a length of 1,856m and a main span of 405m, connecting the coastal routes Nguyen Tat Thanh and Hoang Sa - Truong Sa. This is a stunning sunset viewing spot and a famous check-in photo location with a majestic view of the East Sea.
loc_33.address: Intersection of Nguyen Tat Thanh Street - Nhu Nguyet, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Adhere to traffic safety rules, do not park indiscriminately.
Do not climb or sit on the bridge railing as it poses a danger.
Maintain cleanliness, do not litter in the river.
Be mindful of personal belongings as this place is often crowded.
Do not obstruct traffic when taking photos.
loc_33.long_description: Pham Van Dong Beach is the most modern public beach in Da Nang, located at the end of Pham Van Dong Street, near Bien Dong Park. This beach is well-planned with significant investment, featuring fine white sand, clear blue water, and a full range of amenities such as parking, fresh water showers, and changing rooms. Thanks to its central location and beautiful scenery, it is frequently chosen as a venue for international cultural and sports events (Ironman, paragliding...). The surrounding area of the beach is very spacious with lush green coconut trees and a large square, attracting locals and tourists to swim and relax every day.

loc_34.name: Pham Van Dong Beach
loc_34.description: Pham Van Dong Beach is a modern beach with complete infrastructure, located along Pham Van Dong Street. The beach features fine white sand, clear blue water, and is less crowded than My Khe, making it suitable for families and those seeking tranquility. This area has many high-end resorts and seafood restaurants.
loc_34.address: Pham Van Dong Street, Phuoc My, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Do not litter, protect the clean and beautiful marine environment.
Follow the safety signs, do not swim in dangerous areas.
Do not bring sharp or dangerous objects to the beach.
Respect the personal space of others.
Take good care of your personal belongings.
loc_34.long_description: Vincom Plaza Đà Nẵng is located at the beginning of the Han River Bridge (East bank), and is one of the most bustling and modern shopping centers in the city. The building features luxurious architecture and houses hundreds of famous fashion, cosmetics, and accessory brands both domestically and internationally. In addition to the shopping area, Vincom also offers a diverse regional food court, a modern CGV cinema, and an ice skating rink (which may change its function depending on the time). This is an all-in-one destination that meets the needs for entertainment, shopping, and dining for both locals and tourists. Its prime location allows visitors to easily combine a visit to the Han River Bridge after shopping.

loc_35.name: Vincom Plaza Da Nang
loc_35.description: Vincom Plaza Da Nang is the largest and most modern shopping center in the city, covering an area of 24,700m2, featuring many famous domestic and international brands, the Funny Kids entertainment area, CGV cinema, a diverse food court, and VinMart supermarket. This is an ideal destination for shopping and entertainment.
loc_35.address: 910A Ngo Quyen, An Hai Bac, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with the regulations of the shopping center.
Maintain order, do not create noise.
Do not bring pets into the restricted area.
Take care to secure your personal belongings.
Respect the staff and other customers.
loc_35.long_description: The Golden Bridge is an iconic architectural structure located in the Sun World Ba Na Hills tourist area, which created a global media sensation upon its launch. The 150-meter-long bridge gracefully curves like a golden silk ribbon suspended in the sky, supported by enormous, ancient moss-covered hands. From the bridge, visitors can gaze at the vast stretches of pristine forests and the city of Da Nang peeking through the clouds. The Golden Bridge has been honored by TIME magazine as one of the "Top 100 Greatest Places in the World" and has become a reason why many international tourists choose to visit Vietnam. The experience of walking on clouds at the Golden Bridge is an unforgettable moment in life.

loc_36.name: Golden Bridge
loc_36.description: Golden Bridge is a 150m long pedestrian bridge at the Ba Na Hills resort, globally famous for its unique design supported by giant hands. The bridge is located at an altitude of 1,414m above sea level and was voted by Time as one of the 100 greatest places in the world in 2018. This is a super hot check-in spot that attracts millions of tourists.
loc_36.address: Sun World Ba Na Hills, Hoa Ninh, Hoa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with the regulations of the Ba Na Hills tourist area.
Queue politely when taking photos, do not push or shove.
Do not climb on the supporting hand of the bridge.
Keep cleanliness, do not litter.
Safety precautions when moving on the bridge.
loc_36.opening_hours: 08:00 - 22:00 (according to the opening hours of Bà Nà Hills)
loc_36.long_description: Non Nước stone carving village is located at the foot of the Ngũ Hành Sơn mountain, and it is a traditional craft village with a history of over 300 years, recognized as a national intangible cultural heritage. Here, visitors will be immersed in a world of stone with thousands of exquisite sculptures ranging from small items like jewelry to large ones like Buddha statues and symbolic figures. The artisans in the village have breathed life into the lifeless blocks of marble, creating vibrant, soft, and artistic works. Visitors can witness the intricate crafting process and shop for meaningful souvenirs that carry the cultural imprint of Đà Nẵng. The craft village is a testament to the talent and perseverance of the people of Quảng.

loc_37.name: Non Nuoc Stone Carving Village
loc_37.description: Non Nuoc Stone Carving Village is a traditional craft village over 300 years old, specializing in stone carving in Da Nang. This place is famous for its exquisite marble stone sculptures such as Buddha statues, dragon statues, worship items, and various works of art. Visitors can tour the production workshops and shop for unique stone carving products.
loc_37.address: Huyen Tran Cong Chua Street, Hoa Hai, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang, Vietnam
loc_37.advise: Please behave in a civilized and polite manner.
loc_37.long_description: Binh Dong Beach Park is located at the end of Pham Van Dong Street, adjacent to My Khe Beach, and is known as the "Peace Park" with the image of thousands of doves soaring in the sky. Every early morning or late afternoon, visitors can come here to feed the birds and take romantic photos as if they were in Europe. This is also the center for various festival activities and vibrant beach tourism events in the city, such as the Summer Festival and outdoor music programs. The park has a large, airy space with shady coconut trees, making it an ideal place for locals to exercise and for tourists to take leisurely strolls by the sea.

loc_38.name: East Sea Park
loc_38.description: East Sea Park is a large public park located along the coastline of Da Nang, situated on Vo Nguyen Giap Street. It features a cool green space, a children's playground, walking paths, outdoor exercise areas, and serves as a venue for various events and festivals such as the Enjoy Danang Festival and Tiger Crystal Rave. The park is adjacent to My Khe Beach and Pham Van Dong.
loc_38.address: Vo Nguyen Giap Street, Phuoc My, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Maintain cleanliness, do not litter.
Protect the greenery, do not pick flowers or break branches.
No noise, respect the common space.
Comply with the opening hours regulations.
Keep children safe while playing.
loc_38.long_description: The 3D Art in Paradise Museum in Da Nang is a member of the global Art in Paradise Group and is the largest 3D illusion art museum in Vietnam. With an area of thousands of square meters, the museum showcases hundreds of large-scale 3D paintings directly painted on the walls and floors by Korean artists. The art here requires viewer interaction, turning visitors into the main characters in the lifelike illusion paintings. The museum is divided into 9 diverse themed areas: Ocean, Jungle, Classic, Egypt, Illusion... This is a fantastic indoor entertainment venue, especially suitable for families with young children or groups of young friends who love creative photography.

loc_39.name: 3D Art in Paradise Museum
loc_39.description: The 3D Art in Paradise Museum in Da Nang is the first and only 3D art museum in Da Nang, showcasing over 130 vibrant 3D illusion artworks. Visitors can interact and take photos with the unique 3D paintings, creating stunning social media-worthy images. This is a paradise for check-ins for young people and families.
loc_39.address: Lot C2-10, Tran Nhan Tong Street, Tho Quang, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Maintain silence, do not create noise in the exhibition space.
Do not touch the artifacts or displayed works of art.
Do not use flash when taking photos (if photography is allowed).
Maintain cleanliness, do not eat or drink in the display area.
Manage your personal belongings independently, and do not bring bulky items.
loc_39.long_description: Hải Vân Quan, also known as "the most magnificent gate in the world," is located at the top of the Hải Vân Pass, serving as a natural and historical boundary between Thừa Thiên Huế and Đà Nẵng. This is an important military monument built during the Trần dynasty and significantly restored during the Nguyễn dynasty, playing a crucial role as a gateway on the North-South legendary road. After recent restoration, Hải Vân Quan has regained its majestic ancient beauty with its stone walls and moss-covered gates amidst the windy clouds. From this vantage point, visitors can enjoy a spectacular panoramic view: on one side is the peaceful Lăng Cô Bay (Huế), and on the other is the modern city of Đà Nẵng. This location attracts many history and photography enthusiasts.

loc_40.name: Hai Van Pass
loc_40.description: Hai Van Quan is a historical gate located at the top of Hai Van Pass at an altitude of 490m, known as 'The Most Majestic Gate in the World'. This is a special national monument, built during the Tran Dynasty, serving as a natural boundary between Da Nang and Thua Thien Hue. From here, one can admire the panoramic view of the sea and majestic mountains, especially beautiful when there are clouds.
loc_40.address: Hai Van Pass, the boundary between Da Nang and Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
loc_40.advise: Please behave in a civilized and polite manner.
loc_40.long_description: FPT University Da Nang is located in the FPT City urban area (Ngu Hanh Son District), notable for its unique and modern green architecture. The university's Alpha building features an eye-catching geometric design with staggered square facades, covered by greenery, creating a learning environment that is close to nature and energy-efficient. The spacious campus is fully equipped with amenities such as a football field, a sports hall, and comfortable dormitories that meet international standards. In addition to providing a high-quality learning environment in information technology, FPT Da Nang is also a popular check-in spot for young people, thanks to its artistic and modern photo opportunities.

loc_41.name: FPT University Da Nang
loc_41.description: FPT University Da Nang is a branch of FPT University in Da Nang, one of the leading private universities in Vietnam specializing in information technology and business. The school has modern facilities, an international learning environment, and numerous partnerships with foreign universities. The spacious campus and beautiful architecture are a favorite check-in spot for students.
loc_41.address: 137 Nguyễn Thị Thập, Hòa Minh, Liên Chiểu, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_41.long_description: Duy Tan University is the first and largest private university in Central Vietnam, located at multiple campuses right in the center of Da Nang city. The university's facilities are well-invested and equipped with modern teaching equipment, advanced laboratories, and a rich library. The university is renowned for its multi-disciplinary training quality, especially in Information Technology, Tourism, and Medicine, attracting thousands of students from across the country. The architecture of Duy Tan's buildings features a modern and youthful style, reflecting a dynamic and creative learning environment. Duy Tan University plays an important role in training high-quality human resources for the city and the region.

loc_42.name: Duy Tan University
loc_42.description: Duy Tan University is the largest private university in Central Vietnam, established in 1994. The university has achieved many international accolades, ranking among the top 482 universities in the world according to the QS World University Rankings 2026. The main campus at 254 Nguyen Van Linh features modern architecture with a 12-story building that was once the tallest in Da Nang.

loc_42.long_description: Lotte Mart Đà Nẵng is part of the Lotte Group (South Korea), located in Hải Châu District, near the Sun World Asia Park amusement area and Tiên Sơn Sports Center. This is one of the largest and most popular shopping centers in Đà Nẵng, catering to a diverse shopping demand from food, household goods to fashion and electronics. The highlight of Lotte Mart is the supermarket area with many high-quality imported Korean products and a rich food court. Additionally, on the top floor, there is a Lotte Cinema and a modern entertainment and bowling area. Lotte Mart is a familiar stop for Korean tourists and local residents on weekends.

loc_43.name: Lotte Mart Da Nang
loc_43.description: Lotte Mart Da Nang is a large supermarket belonging to the South Korean Lotte Group, covering an area of 24,700m2, opened in 2012. It offers a wide range of products from food, fashion, electronics to household goods. The 5th and 6th floors house the modern Lotte Cinema. This is a familiar shopping and entertainment spot for locals and tourists.
loc_43.address: 06 Nai Nam, Hoa Cuong Bac, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_43.long_description: GO! Đà Nẵng (formerly Big C Đà Nẵng) is a bustling shopping center and hypermarket located at the intersection of Hùng Vương - Ông Ích Khiêm, the prime central location of the city. With a large floor area, it offers tens of thousands of items at stable prices, making it a key shopping destination for the people of Đà Nẵng. The ground floor features fashion, jewelry, and accessory stalls, while the upper floor houses a supermarket with fresh food and a variety of household goods. The food court and CGV cinema here are always busy with customers coming and going. Thanks to its proximity to Cồn Market and the airport, GO! Đà Nẵng is very convenient for tourists to stop by and buy local specialties as gifts before leaving the city.

loc_44.name: GO! Da Nang (Big C)
loc_44.description: GO! Da Nang (formerly Big C) is a large supermarket belonging to the Central Retail system, located in the Vinh Trung Plaza building. The supermarket offers a full range of consumer goods, fresh food, fashion, and electronics. The building also features a CGV cinema, a children's play area, and many dining restaurants.
loc_44.address: 255-257 Hung Vuong, Vinh Trung, Thanh Khe, Da Nang, Vietnam
advise: Comply with the regulations of the shopping center.

loc_44.long_description: Indochina Riverside Mall is located on Bach Dang Street, right by the picturesque Han River, and is a complex of shopping, office, and luxury apartment spaces. With its luxurious and modern design, it is home to various fashion, cosmetics, and high-end restaurant brands (such as Pizza 4P's, Highlands Coffee...). The highlight of the building is the Food Court on the second floor, which offers a panoramic view of the Han River and Dragon Bridge, providing a wonderful dining experience. The atmosphere at Indochina Riverside is quieter and more upscale compared to regular supermarkets, making it suitable for business meetings or a relaxing time.

loc_45.name: Indochina Riverside Mall
loc_45.description: Indochina Riverside Mall is a high-end shopping center located by the Han River, boasting a prime location with a stunning river view. This place features a concentration of luxury fashion brands, upscale restaurants, a cinema, and an entertainment area. Notably, there is a dining area on the upper floor that offers a scenic view of the Han River and the famous bridges.
loc_45.address: 74 Bach Dang, Hai Chau, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_45.long_description: Vietnam-Korea University of Information Technology and Communication (VKU) is the only public university in the Central Highlands region specializing in training in information technology, communication, and digital economy. The university is located in Da Nang University Village (Ngu Hanh Son District) and symbolizes the friendly cooperative relationship between Vietnam and South Korea. VKU's facilities have been heavily invested in by the South Korean government, featuring smart lecture halls, modern computer labs, and a spacious, clean, and beautiful campus. The architecture of the university is modern and open, creating an ideal learning environment for students passionate about technology. VKU is gradually asserting its position as a cradle for high-quality digital workforce training in the region.

loc_46.name: Vietnam-Korea University of Information Technology and Communication (VKU)
loc_46.description: Vietnam-Korea University of Information Technology and Communication (VKU) is a member of the University of Danang, established through cooperation between Vietnam and South Korea. VKU specializes in training high-quality information technology human resources with an international foundation, offering many joint programs with South Korean universities. The campus is modern, located in the Danang University Urban Area, featuring advanced facilities, high-tech labs, and a creative learning environment.
loc_46.address: 470 Tran Dai Nghia, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_46.long_description: The University of Danang (UD) is a key national regional university, comprising several member universities (Polytechnic, Economics, Pedagogy, Foreign Languages, etc.). The main headquarters (The University of Danang Office) is located at 41 Le Duan, a building with a solemn public architectural style. The University of Danang plays a crucial role in the higher education system of Vietnam, providing a diverse workforce for the socio-economic development of Central Vietnam. With a rich history and large training scale, the University of Danang is not only a place for study but also a prestigious scientific research center. The member universities are scattered throughout the city, creating a vibrant academic atmosphere for Danang.

loc_47.name: Da Nang University
loc_47.description: Da Nang University is a key national regional university, established in 1994, comprising several member schools such as Polytechnic, Economics, Pedagogy, Foreign Languages, and VKU. This is the largest training and scientific research center in the Central - Central Highlands region.

loc_47.long_description: APEC Sculpture Garden is located on the west bank of the Han River, near the Cham Sculpture Museum. It is a cultural project inaugurated to celebrate the APEC Leaders' Week 2017 in Da Nang. The garden displays artistic sculptures donated by APEC member economies, reflecting the unique cultural identity of each country. Each statue carries a meaningful message about cooperation, peace, and prosperous development in the Asia-Pacific region. The sculpture garden is harmoniously arranged with greenery and lawns, creating a unique outdoor art museum. This is an interesting attraction that helps visitors gain a deeper understanding of cultural diplomacy and Da Nang's international integration.

loc_48.name: APEC Sculpture Garden
loc_48.description: The APEC Sculpture Garden is a park featuring 21 statues representing the 21 member economies of APEC. Highlighted by the structure 'The Flying Kite', this is a new check-in spot attracting tourists in Da Nang, located right by the Han River.
loc_48.address: Bạch Đằng, Hải Châu, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_48.long_description: Bảy Mẫu Coconut Forest, located in Cam Thanh commune, Hoi An (near the border with Da Nang), is likened to the "Mekong Delta" in the heart of Central Vietnam. This eco-tourism area is distinguished by its vast green nipa palm groves lining both sides of the river, providing a cool and peaceful atmosphere. The most unique experience here is riding a basket boat (thúng chai) through the small canals, watching fishermen skillfully perform spinning basket boat dances, and trying your hand at throwing nets to catch fish. Visitors are also gifted small, charming toys made from coconut leaves and can enjoy sweet, fresh coconut water. Bảy Mẫu Coconut Forest offers refreshing laughter and an unforgettable experience of rustic river culture.

loc_49.name: Bay Mau Coconut Forest
loc_49.description: Bảy Mẫu Coconut Forest is a pristine mangrove forest covering about 7 hectares near Hội An. Visitors can experience riding basket boats through the coconut forest, watch water puppet performances, and enjoy local cuisine.
loc_49.address: Group 2, Can Nhan hamlet, Cam Thanh commune, Hoi An city, Quang Nam province, Vietnam
advise: Bring a hat and sunscreen because the weather is hot.

loc_49.long_description: Xuân Thiều Beach, also known as "Red Beach," is located in Liên Chiểu District, facing Da Nang Bay. The name Red Beach comes from the phenomenon of the sun reflecting brilliant red light on the surface of the sea at sunrise and sunset, creating a magnificent scene. Unlike the bustling Mỹ Khê, Xuân Thiều Beach offers a tranquil, pristine beauty that is less crowded, making it ideal for those seeking a peaceful retreat. The sand here is clean, and the water is gentle due to the protection of the Sơn Trà Peninsula and Hải Vân Pass. Currently, this area is being developed with the Mikazuki Japanese-style resort project, promising to become a new attractive destination.

loc_50.name: Xuân Thiều Beach
loc_50.description: Xuân Thiều Beach is a picturesque beach located in the Xuân Thiều tourist area, famous for its clear blue waters and fine white sand. This is where the Mikazuki resort is situated, making it an ideal vacation spot for families.
loc_50.address: Xuân Thiều Tourist Area, Hòa Hiệp Nam Ward, Liên Chiểu District, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_50.long_description: Tien Sa Peninsula is located to the north of Son Tra Peninsula, associated with the legend of fairies descending to bathe in the poetic sea. This area plays an important role as a deep-water port (Tien Sa Port) receiving international cruise ships, as well as a diverse natural reserve. Tien Sa boasts beautiful beaches, clear waters, and a rich forest ecosystem, home to many rare animal species. Here, there is the Tien Sa Eco-Resort, offering secluded relaxation services and outdoor activities. With its advantageous location by the mountains and facing the water, Tien Sa is an ideal destination for camping, team building, and immersing oneself in the wild nature.

loc_51.name: Tien Sa Peninsula
loc_51.description: The Tiên Sa Peninsula is located on the Sơn Trà Peninsula, famous for the nearly 130-year-old Tiên Sa Lighthouse - an ancient architectural structure and a stunning photo spot with a panoramic view of Da Nang city.
loc_51.address: Son Tra Peninsula, Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_51.long_description: Thanh Bình Beach is located on Nguyen Tat Thanh Street, embracing the curve of Da Nang Bay. Unlike the bustling beauty of My Khe Beach, Thanh Bình Beach offers a tranquil, serene beauty with fewer large waves due to being sheltered by Son Tra Peninsula and Hai Van Pass. This is a favorite spot for locals to swim in the morning, exercise, and fly kites in the afternoon. The beach features a long, flat, and safe sandy shore, making it very suitable for family recreational activities. Currently, this area is being planned for development with many modern urban projects encroaching on the sea.

loc_52.name: Thanh Binh Beach
loc_52.description: Thanh Binh Beach is located along Ong Ich Khiem Street, a quiet beach with clear blue water and fine white sand. This is an ideal destination for those seeking tranquility in the heart of the city.
loc_52.address: Ong Ich Khiem Street, Hai Chau Ward, Hai Chau District, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_52.long_description: Bac My An Beach is located in the Bac My An ward of Ngu Hanh Son district, famous for its fine white sand and clear blue water year-round. This beach is home to many international 5-star resorts such as Furama and Pullman, creating a luxurious vacation atmosphere. However, there are also clean public bathing areas available for locals and tourists to enjoy freely. The sunrise at Bac My An Beach is incredibly vibrant, making it an ideal time for a stroll and to observe the rhythm of life as fishermen cast their nets near the shore. With minimal temperature variation, visitors can swim here almost year-round.

loc_53.name: Bac My An Beach
loc_53.description: Bac My An Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Da Nang, with fine white sand and clear blue water. It also has many delicious seafood restaurants and is a favorite destination for tourists.
loc_53.address: Bac My An, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_53.long_description: Nguyen Van Troi Bridge is the oldest bridge spanning the Han River, built in the 1960s with a rare Poni steel arch design. After the new Tran Thi Ly Bridge was constructed parallel to it, Nguyen Van Troi Bridge was preserved as a pedestrian bridge and serves as a "historical witness" of the city. The bridge stands out with its bright yellow color, becoming a unique vintage check-in spot and an ideal place to enjoy the peaceful scenery of the Han River without the dust of traffic. In the afternoon, it attracts many young people who come to enjoy the breeze, take photos, and admire the brightly lit Sun Wheel in the distance. The bridge also features a unique lift system in the middle span, which, although no longer in regular operation, remains an interesting technical detail.

loc_54.name: Nguyen Van Troi Bridge
loc_54.description: Nguyen Van Troi Bridge is the oldest pedestrian bridge in Da Nang, spanning the Han River and connecting Hai Chau District and Son Tra District. This is a favorite check-in spot for young people, featuring unique architecture and beautiful views of the Han River.
loc_54.address: Nguyen Van Troi Bridge, connecting Hai Chau and Son Tra, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_54.long_description: Tien Son Bridge is one of the vital bridges of Da Nang, located in the southern part of the city, connecting Hai Chau District and Ngu Hanh Son District. Although it does not possess the dazzling beauty of the Dragon Bridge or Han River Bridge, Tien Son Bridge plays an important role in transporting goods from Tien Sa Port to other provinces (within the East-West Economic Corridor). The bridge features a sturdy reinforced concrete structure, elevated, providing a clear view towards Tran Thi Ly Bridge and the scenic area of Ngu Hanh Son. For the locals, this is a crucial daily transportation route. At the foot of the bridge is a green park area, where people often go fishing and relax.

loc_55.name: Tien Son Bridge
loc_55.description: Tien Son Bridge is a modern bridge spanning the Han River, connecting Hai Chau District with Ngu Hanh Son District. The bridge features beautiful architecture and is an ideal viewpoint for the Han River.
loc_55.address: Tien Son Bridge, connecting Hai Chau and Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_55.long_description: The Military History Exhibition House of Military Region 5 (commonly known as the Military Museum of Military Region 5) is a place that recreates the resilient revolutionary spirit of the military and people in the South Central Coast - Central Highlands region. The museum consists of two main areas: an outdoor exhibition area and an indoor exhibition area. The outdoor area displays heavy weapons such as aircraft, tanks, and self-propelled artillery, which are war trophies or equipment used in the two resistance wars against the French and Americans. The indoor area preserves thousands of artifacts and emotional memorabilia about the military-civilian relationship and the unique military art of Vietnam. This is a significant location for educating the youth about patriotic traditions.

loc_56.name: Military History Exhibition House of Military Region 5 (Military Museum of Military Region 5)
loc_56.description: The Military Museum of Military Region 5 is a military museum displaying thousands of valuable artifacts and documents about the history of the resistance against the French and Americans by the military and people of the Central Highlands. This is an important landmark for educating about revolutionary traditions.
loc_56.address: 03 Duy Tan, Hoa Thuan Dong Ward, Hai Chau District, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_56.long_description: Cồn Dầu Parish Church is located in Hòa Xuân Ward, Cẩm Lệ District, and is a beautiful and historic religious architectural structure of the local Catholic community. The church is designed in a French architectural style combined with Vietnamese cultural elements, featuring a soaring bell tower and elegant paint colors. The church grounds are spacious, shaded by green trees, and include a pond that creates a peaceful and serene landscape. This is an important center for religious activities for the local Catholic community, especially lively during Christmas and Easter celebrations. The ancient beauty of the church attracts many visitors for sightseeing and taking commemorative photos.

loc_57.name: Con Dau Church
loc_57.description: Con Dau Church is a historic Catholic church in Da Nang, located in the Con Dau parish. The church features simple yet solemn architecture and serves as a place of worship for the local Catholic community.
loc_57.address: Con Dau Parish, Hoa Thuan Tay Ward, Hai Chau District, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_57.long_description: 29/3 Park is considered the largest "green lung" located right in the center of Da Nang city, opposite Nguyen Kim electronics supermarket. With a vast area that includes a central lake and rich vegetation, the park is a familiar place for recreation, entertainment, and health training for the locals. It frequently hosts spring flower fairs, consumer goods fairs, and cultural and artistic activities of the city. The park also features a small playground with games for children and a mini zoo. The spacious and cool atmosphere of 29/3 Park is an ideal escape from the heat on hot summer days.

loc_58.name: 29/3 Park
loc_58.description: 29/3 Park is the largest park in Da Nang, regarded as the 'green lung' in the heart of the city with a large lake and dense greenery. It is an ideal place for exercising, strolling, and relaxing.

loc_58.long_description: Thanh Niên Park, located in the Khuê Trung ward of Cẩm Lệ district, is an important community space serving the relaxation needs of residents in the southern part of the city. The park features a large artificial lake that keeps the air cool and fresh. The walking paths along the lake are paved with clean tiles, and the outdoor exercise equipment attracts many people for jogging every morning and evening. This is also a popular location for organizing camping activities and team-building events for youth, true to its name. The quiet atmosphere here is perfect for those looking for a peaceful corner to read or fish.

loc_59.name: Thanh Niên Park

loc_59.long_description: Huyen Khong Cave is the most beautiful and sacred cave located in the Thuy Son mountain of the Ngũ Hành Sơn scenic area. This is an open-air cave with a round dome that opens to the sky, allowing natural light to shine down, creating a mystical and shimmering atmosphere whenever the sun rises. Inside the cave, there is a statue of Buddha Shakyamuni on a high rock wall and a shrine to the Lady of the Forest and the Lady of the Jade, creating a unique blend of beliefs. The cave walls are stained with incense smoke and moss, bearing the marks of time and history (this place once served as a first aid station for wounded soldiers during the war). Entering Huyen Khong Cave, visitors feel as if they have stepped into a serene fairyland, completely separated from the outside world.

loc_60.name: Huyen Khong Cave
loc_60.description: Huyen Khong Cave is one of the most beautiful caves in Ngũ Hành Sơn, famous for the natural light filtering through the stone crevices, creating a mystical and shimmering scene. This is a must-visit check-in spot when coming to Da Nang.
loc_60.address: 81 Huyền Trân Công Chúa Street, Hòa Hải Ward, Ngũ Hành Sơn District, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_60.long_description: The Động Âm Phủ is located at the foot of Thủy Sơn (Ngũ Hành Sơn), and is a long and complex cave that reflects the concepts of yin and yang and the law of cause and effect in Buddhism. Inside the cave, there are miniature scenes simulating the levels of hell, where individuals are judged for their good and bad deeds during their lifetime. The atmosphere inside the cave is dark and mysterious, combined with dim lighting that creates a chilling yet morally instructive feeling. At the end of the cave is a pathway leading to "Thiên Thai Giới," symbolizing liberation and the pursuit of virtue. Visiting Động Âm Phủ is an intriguing journey of reflection on the philosophy of life and the spiritual culture of the Vietnamese people.

loc_61.name: The Hell Cave
loc_61.description: The Am Phu Cave is a unique cave located in Ngũ Hành Sơn, divided into two sections: the ascent to heaven and the descent to the underworld. This place is steeped in many mystical legends and is an attractive tourist destination.
loc_61.address: Ngũ Hành Sơn, Hòa Hải Ward, Ngũ Hành Sơn District, Da Nang, Vietnam
