loc_61.long_description: Mikazuki Water Park 365 is the first indoor and outdoor hot water park in Japanese style in Da Nang, located by Da Nang Bay. The highlight of the amusement area is the spacious indoor section with a year-round hot water system, allowing visitors to enjoy regardless of the weather. Here, there are thrilling dragon water slides, a lazy wave pool, and a Japanese-style Onsen for relaxing hot mineral baths. Outdoors, there is a giant Mount Fuji model and the longest lazy river in Vietnam winding around the resort. Mikazuki offers a complete cultural and entertainment experience of the Land of the Rising Sun right in the coastal city.

loc_62.name: Mikazuki Water Park
loc_62.description: Mikazuki Water Park 365 is the first Japanese-style water park in Da Nang, featuring both indoor and outdoor areas. It is a paradise of entertainment with many exciting water games for all ages.
loc_62.address: Xuân Thiều Tourist Area, Nguyễn Tất Thành Street, Hòa Hiệp Nam Ward, Liên Chiểu District, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_62.long_description: Hòa Phú Thành Tourist Area is located in Hòa Vang District, famous for being the first destination in Vietnam to offer adventure sports rafting with rubber boats. The natural rapids stretch 3 kilometers through rocky areas, providing an exhilarating experience for thrill-seekers. In addition to rafting, visitors can also experience Zipline rides across the forest and the crystal-clear lake. The tourist area also offers fish massage services, hot spring baths, and overnight camping amidst the pristine mountain scenery. This is an ideal weekend getaway for groups of young friends and families looking to refresh themselves, immerse in nature, and challenge themselves.

loc_63.name: Hòa Phú Thành Tourist Area
loc_63.description: Hòa Phú Thành Tourist Area is famous for its adventurous waterfall sliding, ziplining, and thrilling games amidst the natural mountainous landscape. This is an ideal destination for those who love exploration and challenging themselves.

loc_63.long_description: Dong A University is one of the large and prestigious private universities in the Central region, located on Xô Viết Nghệ Tĩnh Street. The university boasts modern and spacious facilities, including high-rise buildings, an electronic library, and standard practice rooms. Dong A University offers a diverse range of programs, from economics, engineering, and health to languages, with a strong emphasis on practical application. The university places special importance on international cooperation, sending students for internships and work in Japan, Taiwan, Germany, and more. The learning environment here is dynamic and youthful, with many vibrant extracurricular activities for students.

loc_64.description: Dong A University is a multi-disciplinary private university that offers a variety of majors ranging from economics and information technology to tourism. The university has modern facilities and a high-quality teaching staff.

The school is located near the Tran Thi Ly Bridge and the Han River, in a beautiful and convenient position. With a history spanning nearly 50 years, the university has trained many generations of talented entrepreneurs and managers for the country. The campus is spacious, shaded by green trees, and features modern lecture halls upgraded to meet the needs of learning and research. Students at the University of Economics are known for their dynamism, creativity, and strong student union activities.

loc_65.long_description: The University of Education (UED) under the University of Danang, located in Lien Chieu District, is a cradle for training high-quality teachers and bachelor's degree holders in science for the Central Highlands region. The school has a large campus with a well-invested system of lecture halls, laboratories, and dormitories. In addition to teacher training, the university also offers programs in natural sciences, social sciences and humanities, journalism, and psychology. The campus has a serious educational atmosphere but is also very poetic, with many old trees and stone benches throughout. This is a place that nurtures the dreams of future "boat rowers."

loc_66.long_description: Danang University of Science and Technology (DUT) is the leading technical university in Central Vietnam and a member of Danang University. Located in Lien Chieu District, the university has a large campus and modern facilities equipped with advanced machinery and technology for scientific research. Notably, the Smart Building of the university is a unique architectural highlight and a source of pride for the students of the Faculty of Engineering. The university is renowned for its creative robocon activities, high-tech research, and providing quality engineers to major corporations. The learning environment here emphasizes critical thinking, logic, and practical application.

loc_67.name: University of Danang - University of Science and Technology
loc_67.description: The University of Danang - University of Science and Technology is a member of Danang University, specializing in training in engineering and technology fields. The school has modern facilities and high-quality training.

loc_67.long_description: The University of Foreign Languages (UFLS), part of Da Nang University, located in Cam Le District, is the most prestigious center for language and international cultural training in the region. The school offers in-depth training in many languages such as English, French, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Thai, and Russian, serving as a bridge for cultural exchange and international integration. The campus is modern and spacious, frequently hosting vibrant multicultural exchange activities. Students at the University of Foreign Languages stand out for their confidence, dynamism, and fluency in foreign language communication. The school is the top choice for young people who love languages and wish to work in an international environment.

loc_68.name: University of Foreign Languages - University of Danang

loc_68.long_description: Da Nang University of Architecture (DAU) is a private university specializing in the fields of Architecture, Construction, Fine Arts Design, and Urban Planning. The main campus is located in the center of Hai Chau District, designed with a unique architectural style and an open space that inspires creativity. The university is a gathering place for students passionate about art and engineering, renowned for impressive and highly applicable design projects. The learning environment here is very "artistic," free, and liberal, encouraging students to express their individuality. The university makes a significant contribution to the urban landscape of the city through its young architect workforce.

loc_69.name: Da Nang University of Architecture
loc_69.description: Da Nang University of Architecture is a private university specializing in training in architecture, construction, and design. The university has modern facilities and an application-oriented training program.

loc_69.long_description: Chợ Cồn is known as the "Food Paradise" of Da Nang, located right at the bustling intersection of Hùng Vương - Ông Ích Khiêm. This is the largest wholesale market in the city, a busy trading hub for thousands of vendors with a wide variety of goods ranging from clothing and footwear to household items. However, the biggest attraction of Chợ Cồn is the food court, featuring countless local delicacies such as snails, bánh bèo, bánh xèo, mì quảng, and chè, all at very affordable prices. Tourists visiting Da Nang must stop by Chợ Cồn to experience the authentic "street food" culture and buy various dried specialties like rimmed squid and beef fish as souvenirs.

loc_70.name: Con Market
loc_70.description: Con Market is the oldest traditional market in Da Nang, famous for its diverse and rich street food. This is a culinary paradise that should not be missed when visiting Da Nang.
loc_70.address: Ong Ich Khiem Street, Hai Chau 1 Ward, Hai Chau District, Da Nang, Vietnam

loc_70.long_description: Hai Van Pass is one of the most beautiful and majestic coastal mountain roads in the world, once honored by the Top Gear program as "one of the most beautiful coastal roads on the planet." The winding road hugs the mountainside, with sheer cliffs on one side and the deep blue sea on the other, surrounded by white clouds year-round. Conquering Hai Van Pass by motorbike is an exhilarating experience, allowing travelers to fully appreciate the beauty of nature. At the top of the pass is the moss-covered Hai Van Gate, where visitors can stop to enjoy the scenery and take photos. Although there is the Hai Van Tunnel, the pass remains an unmissable destination for adventurers.

loc_71.name: Hai Van Pass
loc_71.description: Hai Van Pass is one of the most beautiful mountain passes in Vietnam, located on National Route 1A, the boundary between Da Nang and Thua Thien Hue. From the top of the pass, one can enjoy a panoramic view of the majestic sea and mountains.
loc_71.address: National Route 1A, boundary of Da Nang - Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
advise: Be careful when traveling on the mountain pass.
Adhere to traffic safety rules.

Maintain cleanliness, do not litter.

loc_71.long_description: Bãi Đá Đen (also known as Bãi Đá Obama) is located in the northern part of Sơn Trà peninsula, and is a pristine tourist destination with unique black stones stacked on top of each other. It features crystal-clear waters where you can see the bottom, gentle waves, and a rich coral ecosystem close to the shore. Bãi Đá Đen is an ideal spot for picnicking, overnight camping, fishing, and self-guided snorkeling. While it doesn't have the fine sand like Mỹ Khê, the rugged and untouched beauty of the rocky beaches here has a unique appeal for nature lovers. The path down to the beach is a bit steep and difficult to navigate, but the peaceful scenery here is well worth the effort.

loc_72.name: Black Stone Beach (Son Tra)
loc_72.description: Black Stone Beach (also known as Obama Stone Beach) is a natural rocky beach located on the Son Tra Peninsula, famous for its large black stones and pristine sea views. This is a favorite check-in spot for young people.

loc_72.long_description: Mũi Nghê is the place that welcomes the first rays of sunrise in Da Nang, located in the Southeast of the Sơn Trà peninsula. It is named this way because the rocky promontory extending into the sea resembles a sea lion (Nghê) with its head facing the ocean. Mũi Nghê is famous for its clear natural lake surrounded by steep cliffs, likened to an "infinity pool" in nature. The road to Mũi Nghê is quite treacherous, requiring visitors to trek through the forest and climb over sharp rocky outcrops. This is a destination reserved for those who are passionate about trekking and exploring hidden beauties with few footprints.

loc_73.long_description: Bãi Bụt is nestled at the foot of Linh Ứng Pagoda on the Sơn Trà Peninsula, offering a wonderful combination of mountainous landscapes and the sea. According to legend, this is the place where the Goddess of Mercy, Quán Thế Âm, manifested to rescue fishermen in distress, hence it is called "The Buddha Realm in the Mortal World." The beach here retains its pristine charm with white sand, turquoise waters, and beautiful coral reefs. At Bãi Bụt, there are services for renting resting huts, life jackets, and snorkeling gear for visitors to enjoy all day. The quiet, cool space under the lush green trees makes it an ideal weekend picnic spot for families.

loc_77.long_description: Tra Que Vegetable Village, located in Cam Ha, Hoi An (about 25km from Da Nang), is a traditional vegetable-growing village famous for its high-quality aromatic herbs. When visiting the vegetable village, tourists can immerse themselves in the experience of being real farmers: wearing brown robes, conical hats, tilling the soil, planting vegetables, and watering them. loc_86.long_description: My Son Sanctuary (located in Duy Xuyen District, Quang Nam) is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, about 70km from Da Nang. This complex consists of many Cham temples situated in a secluded valley, which was once the site of rituals conducted by the Champa dynasty over many centuries. The Cham towers here were built using baked bricks with a mysterious technique (without the use of binding agents) and intricately carved with images of the god Shiva and Apsara dancers. Although ravaged by time and war, the tranquil, ancient, and mysterious beauty of My Son still leaves a strong impression. Visitors can also enjoy the captivating Cham dance at the foot of the ancient towers.

loc_88.name: Furama – Ariyana International Tourism Complex
loc_88.description: The Furama International Tourism Complex – Ariyana Da Nang is located by My Khe Beach – one of the six most beautiful beaches in the world as voted by Forbes. Furama Resort Da Nang is not only a favorite accommodation spot for many travelers but also a gathering place for culturally rich experiences. Inside the Furama Resort Da Nang, FROM A BEACH RESORT ICON TO AN INTERNATIONAL TOURISM COMPLEX, officially opened in 1997, the Furama Resort & Villas Da Nang has made its mark as Vietnam's first 5-star beach resort, putting Vietnam on the map of luxurious beach resort tourism worldwide. The Lagoon Forest, cultivated by the resort since 1997, has now become the "green lung" in the heart of the resort. Nearly 30 years since its establishment and development, the resort has expanded and evolved into the Furama International Tourism Complex – Ariyana Da Nang, a leading destination for relaxation and conferences, harmoniously combining natural beauty, luxurious accommodation services, and modern conference infrastructure. Over 30 years of establishment and development, the Furama International Tourism Complex – Ariyana Da Nang has always been a favorite destination for many movie stars and international artists. (Photo: South Korean actress Seo Ye Ji taken at Furama Resort Da Nang) Here, guests can enjoy a unique coastal relaxation experience at the first culinary and heritage resort in Vietnam – Furama Resort & Villas Da Nang. At the same time, the complex also boasts an advanced conference system, including the International Convention Palace (ICP) and the Ariyana International Convention Center Da Nang – which had the honor of hosting APEC 2017, affirming its leading position in the region. A HERITAGE LIVING SPACE, REDEFINING LUXURIOUS RELAXATION Compared to the gateway connecting three UNESCO World Heritage Sites – Hoi An, My Son, and Hue, the resort features 198 rooms and suites along with 65 private pool villas, all designed in a harmonious style blending traditional Vietnamese elements with classic French architecture. This is the ideal choice for those seeking a unique, elegant, and sophisticated vacation. Furama Villas Da Nang, marked by the creative imprint of Denton Corker & Marshall (Australia), draws inspiration from indigenous Champa culture, combined with the elegant Indochine spirit. The red-tiled roofs shaded by coconut trees, the long breezy corridors, and the dark wooden columns with handcrafted details evoke a vibrant heritage. The architecture here not only possesses timeless beauty but also opens up a storytelling space – where the past and present intersect in every detail. The bedroom design is rich in heritage with inspiring Indochine and Champa architecture. From the balcony of Furama Villas Da Nang, the interior space created by HBA Hong Kong offers a sophisticated blend of natural materials like wood, stone, and ceramics with a gentle modern style. Soft lanterns, ceramic patterns, and designs inspired by ocean waves and Champa culture are harmoniously arranged, evoking a luxurious and intimate "Vietnamese soul." Every detail is an invitation to listen to the story of Central Vietnam's heritage, not just to admire but to feel with all the senses. A CULINARY STORY CONNECTING As a pioneering resort in luxury beach tourism in Vietnam and a brand associated with unique heritage & cuisine, Furama Resort Da Nang understands that the most important mission in tourism is to promote the image and culture of Vietnam to the world. Authentic tourism must provide learning experiences, and perhaps cuisine is the bridge to explore, understand, and preserve local and global cultural values. And perhaps, the "valuable" aspect of a vacation lies in that experience, not merely in the luxurious room category. Therefore, each restaurant in the resort is designed as a "cultural stage," where food, space, and local ingredients tell the heritage story of each region. The 09 dining spaces within the resort are likened to "cultural stages" where Vietnam's heritage is narrated through flavors. By meticulously recreating the ambiance of each region, Furama Resort Da Nang has transformed the culinary experience into a journey from tradition to the present, from local identity to international flavors. A corner of "miniature Northwest" in the heart of the resort at Taya House restaurant – where the peaceful wooden stilt house of Muong Khhu nestles against the hillside. The five-room wooden house from Kinh Bac has been meticulously restored, offering a unique cultural culinary experience for guests. Lamb ribs served inside the Steak House The Fan surprise many diners. V-Senses Cafe – Vietnamese Heritage House, also known as a restaurant that recreates the cuisine of the capital with a variety of traditional dishes. (Photo: Sturgeon noodle soup currently served at V-Senses Cafe) INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE & EXHIBITION CENTER – THE LEADING MICE DESTINATION IN THE REGION Beyond leisure tourism, the Furama International Tourism Complex – Ariyana Da Nang is also known as the MICE tourism center of the region. With a total area of over 12,000m², the complex houses the Furama International Convention Palace (ICP) and the Ariyana International Convention Center Da Nang – a facility honored on the world conference map when it successfully hosted the APEC 2017 Leaders' Week. The 50th Anniversary of ASEAN – New Zealand Dialogue Partnership seminar at the International Convention Palace, Furama Resort Da Nang Beach Lounge at the Ariyana International Convention Center Da Nang. Designed to international standards, the conference system here can accommodate everything from high-level meetings and specialized seminars to trade exhibitions and large-scale cultural and artistic events. Flexible spaces, modern equipment, and a professional operational team provide comprehensive solutions for all event organization needs. DA NANG CITY TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_89.name: My Son Sanctuary
loc_89.description:
The My Son Sanctuary (also known as the Holy Land of My Son) is a complex of ancient Cham Pa temple ruins located in a secluded valley in My Son village, Thu Bon commune, Da Nang city. This site preserves over 70 architectural structures built over many centuries (from the 4th to the 13th century) with distinctive historical, cultural, architectural, and artistic values. The My Son Sanctuary is likened to a priceless museum of Cham Pa architecture and sculpture, vividly reflecting the remnants of the brilliant Champa civilization.

CULTURAL HISTORY
My Son was established in the 4th century during the reign of King Bhadravarman, when the My Son valley was chosen as the holy city – an important religious and spiritual center of the ancient Champa Kingdom. Located to the west of the capital Simhapura (Tra Kieu) and near the ancient port town of Hoi An, this sanctuary is nestled among majestic mountains and forests, closely associated with a sacred stream flowing into the Thu Bon River. From the very beginning, My Son became the site where Cham kings built temples to perform rituals, offer sacrifices to deities, establish the legitimacy of their reign, and commemorate their victories. The temples here primarily worship the god Shiva under the symbol of Linga – the supreme patron deity of the Champa kingdom. For nearly a millennium, My Son was continuously restored and expanded by various Champa dynasties. The first wooden temple was destroyed by fire in the 6th century but was restored by King Sambhuvarman in the 7th century; thereafter, each Cham king upon ascending the throne would either construct new temples or renovate the old ones that had fallen into disrepair. Thus, the My Son Sanctuary increasingly developed, becoming the most important religious center of the entire kingdom. There was a period when My Son faded into obscurity (8th–9th century) as the dynasty moved its capital and established a new sanctuary in Nha Trang (Po Nagar), but by the early 10th century, the worship of Shiva was revived, and My Son was restored with a series of new temples built. By the 11th century, wars with neighboring regions severely damaged the My Son temples, but the Cham king later ordered repairs and restoration of many structures. Construction and restoration at My Son continued until the 13th century – King Jaya Paramesvaravarman II (1234) is considered the last king to have contributed to the restoration of this sanctuary. After the 13th century, historical records no longer mention the construction of temples at My Son, marking the end of nearly a millennium of continuous development of the sanctuary. Throughout this long journey, My Son has marked the brilliant development of Champa culture and art, preserving within it many unique architectural styles through various historical periods.

ARCHITECTURAL ART
In terms of planning, My Son's architecture is unique and rare in the form of a sanctuary complex consisting of multiple clusters of towers. The temples are arranged in groups, with each group typically having a main temple (Kalan) at the center and surrounding subsidiary towers, enclosed by thick brick walls. The main entrance of most main towers faces east (towards the sun god); some larger main towers also have additional side entrances facing north. In front of the main temple, there is usually a small gate tower (Gopura) with two interconnecting doors (one facing east, one leading into the main temple), followed by a long house (Mandapa) – with a tiled roof and spacious area – used for welcoming pilgrims, offering gifts, and organizing ritual dances dedicated to the deities. Surrounding the main temple are subsidiary towers and smaller architectural structures, creating a harmonious whole in terms of rituals and the sacred space of the Cham people. The My Son temples are all official religious architectural works, continuously built by Cham kings from the 4th to the 13th century. Therefore, each temple embodies the most refined and representative elements of contemporary Cham architectural art. Most of the identified architectural styles of Champa are present at My Son, and the temples here have established the foundational criteria for classifying Cham artistic styles. In other words, My Son is a living museum of Cham architecture, containing unique sculptures and decorative motifs that reflect the pinnacle of the intellect and craftsmanship of the ancient Cham people.

NATURAL LANDSCAPE
The My Son Sanctuary is located amidst a pristine and majestic natural landscape, surrounded by dense mountains and forests, creating a profoundly spiritual atmosphere. Prominently to the south of the valley is the sacred Mahaparvata mountain (approximately 730m high), mentioned in inscriptions from the 4th century. According to the symbolic beliefs of the Cham people, this mountain is likened to a giant Linga of the god Shiva, while the My Son valley represents Yoni – the combination that creates the pair of cosmic symbols of sexual organs right within the heart of the heritage. A sacred stream flows through the valley, connecting to the Thu Bon River (Sanskrit: Mahadani – the embodiment of the goddess Ganga, wife of Shiva), providing fresh water year-round for purification rituals during Hindu festivals. The forest ecosystem in the My Son conservation area is also very diverse, preserving many precious species of flora and fauna such as various types of rosewood, ebony, red oak, cajeput, and wildlife like pheasants, flying lizards, wild boars, and large deer. The harmonious natural landscape with the cultural and spiritual space adds to the mysterious and sacred beauty of My Son, highlighting the value of the site amid the Central Highlands.

OUTSTANDING VALUES
With its rich history and unique artistry, My Son is a typical testament to the ancient Champa civilization. The temples here reflect profound cultural exchanges: initially influenced by pure Hinduism, later combining with indigenous beliefs, and ultimately integrating into a distinct Champa identity. In terms of architecture and sculpture, My Son gathers the most representative essences of Cham art over nearly a millennium, creating an invaluable heritage complex of global significance. Many scholars evaluate that My Son can be compared to other famous temple complexes in the region such as Angkor Wat (Cambodia), Bagan (Myanmar), or Borobudur (Indonesia) in both scale and cultural artistic value. Thanks to these outstanding global values, My Son has been recognized by the world, becoming a source of pride for Vietnam's heritage on the global cultural map.

TICKET PRICES
According to information from the My Son Heritage Management Board, the entrance fee to the heritage site (including admission and service fees) is currently applied as follows: 
International visitors: 150,000 VND/person/visit (including admission and service fees). 
Vietnamese visitors: 100,000 VND/person/visit (including admission and service fees).

IDEAL TIME TO VISIT AND SOME NOTES
My Son is located in a tropical monsoon climate with two distinct seasons. The rainy season (from around September to January of the following year) often has heavy rains, slippery roads, and the valley may flood, making it difficult for sightseeing. In contrast, the dry season (from February to August) has less rain, is drier, and is more convenient for visitors. Among these, the period from February to April is considered the most ideal time to visit My Son, when the weather is pleasantly cool and the mountainous landscape is lush and green in spring, providing visitors with a complete sightseeing experience. Additionally, visitors should go early in the morning to avoid the harsh midday sun in summer and enjoy the fresh air, admiring the mystical My Son in the morning light.

NOTES FOR VISITORS
When visiting the My Son heritage site, visitors should pay attention to some regulations and behaviors to protect the site and preserve the sacred cultural space: 
- Comply with the regulations of the Management Board; pay attention to directional signs and follow the rules at the heritage site. 
- Behave civilly and politely: maintain general order, speak softly, and be friendly with everyone, showing respect for the heritage. 
- Wear appropriate clothing: dress neatly, respectfully, and solemnly when entering the temple area (avoid inappropriate or offensive attire). 
- Do not harm the heritage: absolutely do not touch, climb, or carve on brick walls, stone inscriptions, trees, or any architecture within the temple area. 
- Maintain cleanliness and the landscape: be environmentally conscious, do not litter; preserve cultural and architectural works and the natural landscape of the heritage. 
- Do not perform superstitious rituals: do not arbitrarily organize offerings, sacrifices, or activities contrary to local customs at the heritage site. 
Following these notes will help visitors have a meaningful and safe visit while contributing to the protection of this valuable cultural heritage of humanity – the My Son Sanctuary, so that the value of the site can be passed down to future generations. In recognition of these outstanding values, on December 4, 1999, My Son was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List.

References: 
1. My Son World Heritage Management Board

loc_89.long_description: VinWonders Nam Hội An is a colorful entertainment and cultural experience complex by Vingroup, located about 40 km from Da Nang. The unique feature of this amusement park is the combination of modern thrill rides and spaces that celebrate traditional cultural values. The highlight is the River Safari - the first park in Vietnam dedicated to the care and conservation of semi-wild animals on the river, where visitors can take a boat ride to see rare animal species. Additionally, the Folk Culture Island with its craft villages and live shows is also a major attraction for families and children.

loc_90.name: Memory Island Hoi An
loc_90.description:
Hoi An Memory Island includes distinctive subdivisions: Hoi An Memories Resort & Spa, Shophouse, the Impression Hoi An Cultural Theme Park, and the world-class performance show Hoi An Memories. Hoi An Memory Island is a tourism – resort – cultural complex adjacent to and an inseparable part of the ancient town of Hoi An, pioneering the trend of cultural tourism in Vietnam. Hoi An Memory Island creates a green tourism space, along with local tourism aimed at a sustainable cultural tourism ecosystem. The Hoi An Memories show – recreating 400 years of Hoi An's ups and downs, features 5 impressive performances by nearly 500 professional actors on a 25,000m2 stage in the middle of the Hoai River. The first cultural theme park in Vietnam – Impression Hoi An, utilizes diversity in architecture and art, reflecting the life of a bustling international port city. Hoi An Memories Resort & Spa – the first to create a new definition of the art of resort services, was honored by WTA as “Asia’s Number 1 Entertainment Resort.” In 2022, Hoi An Memory Island was recognized by the World Travel Award – the “Oscar of the global tourism industry” – as the “Top Entertainment Destination in the World.” 

LOCATION
Nestled along the poetic Hoai River, Hoi An Memory Island is close to the ancient town, making the exploration journey of visitors more convenient. From here, visitors can easily reach the ancient town of Hoi An in a 10-minute walk or a 5-minute bike ride. Notably, by car, it takes only 40 minutes to reach Da Nang Airport and 15 minutes to An Bang and Cua Dai beaches. With a super-connected location to famous tourist spots, Hoi An Memory Island is a destination that travelers cannot miss when visiting Hoi An.

VISION – MISSION OF HOI AN MEMORY ISLAND
With core values of happiness – experience – creativity – unity – convenience, Hoi An Memory Island is built with the key mission of becoming a pioneer in infusing cultural and historical values into the field of entertainment, with the aim of preserving invaluable assets (cultural and historical) for the Vietnamese people, promoting Vietnamese culture and tourism, and contributing to building a cultural tourism industry in Vietnam. Hoi An Memory Island consists of 3 distinctive subdivisions: Hoi An Memories Resort & Spa, Impression Hoi An Cultural Theme Park, and the world-class performance show Hoi An Memories.

HOI AN MEMORIES RESORT & SPA
Hoi An Memories Resort and Spa is located on an island in the heart of the enchanting ancient town of Hoi An, harmonizing with the old yellow walls, the brightly lit streets adorned with shimmering lanterns, and the cultural and historical values of this world heritage site. Surrounded by the charming and peaceful Hoai River, Hoi An Memories Resort & Spa features 102 river-view rooms and villas. From here, guests can easily access the ancient town of Hoi An and listen to the rhythm of life in this heritage land through its architecture, landscapes, and unique cultural experiences. Blending traditional and modern architecture, Hoi An Memories Resort & Spa is an artistic masterpiece that reflects the quintessence of Hoi An heritage. The resort stands out with a series of rooms styled in Eastern aesthetics, combined with open and airy spaces. Every design detail is meticulously crafted, providing a luxurious and relaxing retreat for guests.

IMPRESSIVE HOI AN CULTURAL THEME PARK
Hoi An Impression Theme Park is a unique cultural and entertainment destination in Vietnam, located in Con Hen, adjacent to the ancient town of Hoi An. Covering an area of 25 hectares, the park recreates the architectural, cultural, and trading activities of Hoi An residents through various historical periods. The most prominent highlight is the Hoi An Memories live show – a large-scale outdoor program featuring over 500 performers. The performance starts at 8:00 PM, taking the audience back in time to explore the glorious history of Hoi An through spectacular performing arts. Additionally, the park skillfully reconstructs many ancient architectural works over 200 years old based on historical documents and old drawings. The structures reflect the architectural styles of Cham, French, and Vietnamese, including the Cham Rong House, French Church, and Vietnamese Ancient House, among many others. Furthermore, it is dubbed a culinary paradise, gathering countless delicious specialties from various regions of Vietnam and the world, prepared from fresh ingredients. Exploring Hoi An Impression Theme Park, visitors will have the opportunity to delve into cultural depth, enjoy art, and experience cuisine in a special space. This is a must-visit spot when coming to Hoi An, connecting the past and present, providing memorable experiences.

WORLD-CLASS SHOW – HOI AN IMPRESSION
Recreating 400 years of Hoi An's ups and downs, the Hoi An Memories show has been recognized globally and has won numerous prestigious awards: 
- Vietnam Guinness Record: The live art program with the most performers (Love stories and historical tales spanning 400 years of this cultural crossroads, connecting Vietnam to the legendary maritime silk road, will be narrated through the performances of 500 actors.)
- According to Reuters: Rated as “the most beautiful in the world” and “the most visually stunning.”
- The Guide Awards 2019: The best live art program with cultural and historical value in Vietnam.
- Leading Historical Spectacle Show 2019 awarded for the elaborate and meaningful live performance program.
- Screened at Times Square, New York, USA, and reported by Reuters along with over 220 media agencies from the USA, Japan, South Korea, India, China, and Singapore.
- Tripadvisor Traveller’s Choice 2020 for impressive destinations worldwide.

DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_91.name: Hoiana Resort & Golf
loc_91.description:
Where the golden sand meets the blue waves of the East Sea, where the pure beauty of Central Vietnam blends with the essence of luxury living, Hoiana Resort & Golf emerges as a new symbol of coastal relaxation. Just a 15-minute drive from the ancient town of Hội An – a UNESCO World Heritage Site – Hoiana stretches over 4km of pristine coastline, offering a perfectly integrated world of relaxation that combines entertainment, culture, and international-class services. 

HOIANA RESORT & GOLF – THE SOURCE FOR ENDLESS EXPLORATION JOURNEYS

Hoiana Resort & Golf – The Best Integrated Resort in the Asia-Pacific

Four Luxurious Hotels Gather in One Destination

At Hoiana Resort & Golf, each hotel tells its own story, providing a unique experience for every style of vacation. Hoiana Hotel & Suites impresses with 141 spacious, luxurious suites filled with elegance. Floor-to-ceiling windows open up to endless views of the sea, golf course, or the stunning lake. Every exquisite interior detail combined with personal butler service elevates every moment of your stay. 

Hoiana Hotel & Suites – Sky Pool Room

New World Hoiana Beach Resort offers 330 rooms and suites that exude tranquility, combining sustainable design with Vietnamese charm. Organic bedding, coconut fiber mattresses, and organic cotton sheets ensure a restful sleep. Each room faces the sea, allowing breezes and light to flood in, transforming it into a peaceful retreat to recharge your energy. 

New World Hoiana Beach Resort – Premier Ocean View Suite

New World Hoiana Hotel is a blend of Eastern vitality and refined modernity. The spacious balcony is the perfect spot to watch the sunrise over the East Sea, relax with a good book, or sip a cocktail at sunset. 

New World Hoiana Hotel – Deluxe Ocean View Room

Hoiana Residences is a serene living space with 270 luxurious apartments overlooking lush gardens or the vast sea. Each apartment is equipped with a fully functional kitchen, suitable for long stays. Guests can enjoy a swimming pool, gym, and exclusive dining, along with convenient access to shopping, entertainment, and top-class golf facilities. 

Hoiana Residences – Three-Bedroom Suite

World-Class Golf Course

Part of the Hoiana Resort & Golf complex, Hoiana Shores Golf Club has proudly received prestigious titles including top 100 golf courses in the world for two years, 2022 and 2023, by Golf World TOP 100, top 100 golf courses in Asia-Pacific for two years, 2022 and 2024, by Golf Travel, and the best golf course in Vietnam in 2020 by Golf Digest. As the first golf course in Vietnam designed by the legendary Robert Trent Jones Jr., Hoiana Shores Golf Club is located on the stunning pristine beach of Da Nang, with breathtaking views of Cu Lao Cham peninsula, offering an exceptional 18-hole links golf experience with exciting challenges. The golf course features a 6,000m² clubhouse, including gourmet dining areas, modern function rooms, a high-end golf shop, and luxurious changing rooms. Hoiana Shores Golf Club is the first and only links golf course in Vietnam.

A Family-Friendly Paradise

Hoiana is a destination that harmonizes every pace of life – vibrant for explorers, serene for those seeking rest. Kids will be enchanted by the expansive kids' club, creative classes, and nature-inspired play areas. Wellness enthusiasts can retreat to Downtime Renew to experience Vietnamese therapeutic treatments combined with modern technology. The system of swimming pools, gym, daily sports and entertainment programs, along with a private 4km beach, will provide moments of excitement and relaxation. 

Family Cyclo

Kayaking

Hoiana Pickleball Court

A Culinary Journey Around the Globe at 20 Restaurants and Bars

With 20 restaurants, bars, and lounges, guests can embark on a culinary journey around the world without leaving the resort. Savor the finesse of Vietnamese cuisine, indulge in freshly caught seafood, enjoy the warm allure of classic Hong Kong Cha Chaan Teng dishes, be captivated by the spicy and rich flavors of Sichuan hot pot, or delight in the authentic Italian taste of pizza and pasta – along with creatively transformed international dishes. Each dining space at Hoiana is not just a place to enjoy food, but also an unforgettable experience. 

San Xi Lou Restaurant – Hong Kong Cuisine

Sichuan Grill – Steakhouse

Entertainment

As the sun sets, Hoiana comes alive with new energy. Enjoy cocktails at Quang Nam House, feel the sea breeze at Nox Beach Club, or try your luck with vibrant gaming experiences. Whether you seek a lively night or a romantic moment under the starry sky, Hoiana has the perfect answer.

Quang Nam House – Executive Bar & Lounge

Gateway to Explore Central Vietnam's Heritage

From Hoiana, guests can easily explore nearby heritage sites and wonders: the lantern-lit ancient town of Hội An, the sacred My Son Sanctuary, the majestic Marble Mountains, or the countryside roads shaded by bamboo and lush rice fields.

Elevate Your Events

Hoiana is the ideal choice for any event – from dream weddings, significant anniversaries to international conferences and corporate gatherings. Spaces like the luxurious Grand Ballroom, the light-filled Green House, or the romantic outdoor Beach Lawn provide the perfect backdrop. Combined with top-notch accommodations, exquisite dining, and a variety of entertainment activities, Hoiana transforms every event into a memorable moment.

Beach Wedding

Wedding in the Green Space

Green House – Event Set Up

Entertainment Complex – Launching This November

This November, Hoiana will launch a new entertainment complex on the LG and G floors of Hoiana Residences – a fun destination for all ages. Challenge yourself in the Game Zone, hone your skills with Virtual Golf, or sing your heart out in luxurious KTV rooms. This will be a place filled with laughter, connection, and memorable moments.

Entertainment Complex

Awards and Honors

The prestigious awards that Hoiana has received not only affirm its elite status but also motivate us to continue creating experiences that exceed expectations. 

Best Integrated Resort in Asia-Pacific 2025 by Travel + Leisure Luxury Awards

Top Integrated Resort in the World 2024 by World Travel Awards

Top Integrated Resort in Asia 2024 by World Travel Awards

Best Integrated Resort in Asia 2023 & 2024 by Travel + Leisure Luxury Awards

Top 100 Golf Courses in Asia 2023 & 2024 by Golf Travel Korea & Golf Travel China

Best Luxury Beach Resort in Quang Nam 2024 by Luxury Lifestyle Awards

Best Beach Integrated Resort 2024 – Heritage Fashion by Travel Best Choice

Best Integrated Golf Course 2024 by Vietnam Golf & Leisure Awards

Best Resort for Golfers 2024 by Vietnam Golf & Leisure Awards

Whether it's a moment of tranquility in a relaxing spa, an exhilarating challenge on the seaside golf course, the joyful laughter of a family vacation, or the fresh vibes from an unprecedented experience, Hoiana Resort & Golf is not just a stopover – it is a vibrant world waiting for you to explore.

loc_91.long_description: Phu Ninh Lake (located in Quang Nam province) is likened to the "Emerald Pearl" of Central Vietnam and is the second largest artificial reservoir in Vietnam. The Phu Ninh Ecotourism Area boasts picturesque landscapes with a vast, expansive lake surrounded by lush protective forests and 30 large and small islands. Visitors can take a boat to explore the lake, enjoy hot mineral baths, go fishing, camp, or relax in bungalows by the lake. The atmosphere in Phu Ninh is incredibly fresh and cool, making it an ideal destination for outdoor excursions to escape the city's dust and seek the tranquility of nature.

loc_92.name: VinWonders Nam Hội An
loc_92.description:
VinWonders Nam Hội An is a top-tier amusement and entertainment park in Central Vietnam, featuring 5 large zones and numerous thrilling rides. With an area of 50 hectares, VinWonders Nam Hội An offers a MULTI-SENSORY EXPERIENCE WHEN TRAVELING TO DA NANG – HOI AN. 

INTRODUCTION TO VINWONDERS NAM HOI AN  
Address: Võ Chí Công Street, Thăng An, Da Nang  
Operating hours: 09:00 – 19:00 | Daily  

Located by the Bình Minh beach, just about 15 minutes from the ancient town of Hội An and 1 hour from the center of Da Nang, VinWonders Nam Hội An is a premier amusement and entertainment park in Central Vietnam with 5 expansive zones and many adventurous games. Here, visitors can immerse themselves in the vibrant atmosphere of modern rides while also experiencing a unique cultural journey and exploring the wild nature right in the heart of the coastal city.

WHAT TO EXPERIENCE AT VINWONDERS NAM HOI AN?  
1. River Safari – The first and only river animal conservation park in Vietnam  
Time: 09:30 – 16:30 | Daily  

If you have ever dreamed of sitting on a boat in the jungle, observing the natural habitat of wild animals that you have only seen on Discovery, then River Safari – VinWonders Nam Hội An is a must-visit destination. This is the first and only semi-wild animal conservation park in Vietnam, using boats as the main means of sightseeing. River Safari is not only home to over 2000 individuals of more than 100 rare species but also a vibrant natural conservation space designed to allow animals to develop as naturally as possible. Visitors can observe the world of animals on the river.

Not only does River Safari attract visitors with its lively wild animal world, but it is also "going viral" on social media thanks to a special character – Cao Việt Hoàng (born in 2006), a part-time tour guide with a handsome appearance, a bright smile, and a charming, friendly leading style. Depending on the boat tour experience package, guests will have the opportunity to interact and make friends with adorable animal companions like Deer and Elephants. Besides the river exploration journey, River Safari offers many other exciting stops for you to enjoy and get acquainted with the wild animal world.

Happy Zoo: A must-visit for families with small explorers, this is the happy garden of friendly animals like the "diplomat" capybara, raccoon, deer, sheep, ostrich, etc. Here, visitors can feed the animals, pet them, take pictures, and learn more about their living habits through information boards.

Bird World: Home to nearly 200 individuals of rare, colorful birds.  
Bird Show: An impressive show featuring more than 20 species of animals from friendly ground dwellers to high-flying idols like: Pink-winged hawks, South American Macaws, Lories, pelicans, etc. The show is held daily at two time slots: 9:45 – 10:15 & 14:00 – 14:30. The performance "Wild Wings."

2. Water Park  
Time: 10:00 – 18:00 | Daily  

In the heart of the Central sun and wind, VinWonders Nam Hội An water park is the ideal and exhilarating "cooling off" spot for guests. With a modern slide system, a gigantic swimming pool, and a water play area specifically for young children, this place is a water entertainment paradise suitable for all ages.

Key highlights not to be missed: Designed with 12 rides, including thrilling experiences like giant whirlwinds that take you on an adventure, free-falling into a large funnel, "spinning" and plunging into refreshing water. The children's water play area: designed specifically for kids with mini slides, water jets, slides, water dumping buckets from above, etc., all fun and completely safe. The relaxation & utility area: to meet the comfortable play needs of guests, we have added sun loungers, umbrellas, resting huts, as well as providing changing rooms, lockers, and a clean and complete dining area.

3. Outdoor Games – Challenge your limits, stir up the spirit of adventure  
Time: 09:00 – 18:30 | Daily  

The Outdoor Games area at VinWonders Nam Hội An is a paradise for thrill-seekers, where you can satisfy your passion for speed, height, and challenge yourself with a series of modern, safe, and exhilarating games. From children, adventurous youth to entire families – everyone will find suitable games here! If the family has many children, you can choose to play: The childhood Ferris wheel, dancing cups, etc. For young thrill-seekers, there are: Desert whirlwinds, roller coasters, or the forgotten valley (through cliffs up to 785m long, visitors will experience continuous spins like a mesmerizing maze that only the bravest hearts can conquer).

4. Folk Culture Island – A heritage land in the heart of Hội An  
Time: 09:00 – 17:30 | Daily  

Amidst the modern amusement space and wild nature at VinWonders Nam Hội An, the Folk Culture Island stands out as a memory zone, taking visitors back in time to the traditional cultural values of the Vietnamese people. The Folk Culture Island vividly recreates the cultural space from North to South, from the plains to the mountains, from ancient architecture to characteristic craft villages. This is a place where you can not only observe but also live in Vietnamese culture in the most authentic and intimate way. Moreover, when visiting the culture island, you can also personally experience unique traditional craft villages, immersing yourself with artisans living in each nostalgic craft story.

SUGGESTED ITINERARY FOR VISITING VINWONDERS NAM HOI AN  
Time | Location

Enjoy the impressive "Wild Wings" bird show

TICKET PRICES AND BOOKING METHODS  
Book tickets through the official website of VinWonders Nam Hội An: https://link.vinpearl.com/3SDpELU

loc_92.long_description: Da Nang Downtown is the vibrant new face of Sun World Asia Park (from 2024), positioned as a bustling entertainment, shopping, and festival complex right in the city center. In addition to famous attractions like the Sun Wheel, it currently attracts visitors with the night market "Vui Phết" (Vui-Fest Bazaar), featuring hundreds of food and fashion stalls and a lively craft beer space. Notably, the multi-experience show "Symphony of River" combines artistic fireworks with adventurous Jetski and Flyboard performances on the river, providing dazzling light-filled nights. Da Nang Downtown is a "sleepless" destination, embodying the youthful and modern spirit of Da Nang at night.

loc_93.name: Cu Lao Cham Biosphere Reserve – Hoi An
loc_93.description: The Cu Lao Cham World Biosphere Reserve – Hoi An has the mission of conserving and developing coastal and marine resources for the Central Coast region of Vietnam. CU LAO CHAM WORLD BIOSPHERE RESERVE – HOI AN On May 26, 2009, at Jeju Island, South Korea, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) recognized Cu Lao Cham – Hoi An as a world biosphere reserve*. The biosphere is a part of the Earth formed by three closely interconnected spheres: the lithosphere, atmosphere, and hydrosphere, which contain living matter and the products created by them. The upper limit of the biosphere is the thickest part of the ozone layer (about 25 km), the lower limit is the deepest part of the ocean floor (about 11 km), and the lower limit of the weathered crust. The Cu Lao Cham World Biosphere Reserve – Hoi An has a total area of 33,737 hectares, including the entire land area of Hoi An city and the sea area defined from the boundary points of the Cu Lao Cham Marine Protected Area connected to the boundary points on land in Hoi An, with three functional zones: core zone, buffer zone, and transition zone. Core Zone: Includes all the islands and functional areas (strictly protected area, ecological restoration area, development area, and rational exploitation area) within the Cu Lao Cham Marine Protected Area. The core zone covers an area of 11,560 hectares and primarily performs the conservation function of the Cu Lao Cham – Hoi An World Biosphere Reserve through the activities of the Marine Protected Area and the Cu Lao Cham special-use forest conservation force. Buffer Zone: Includes the sea surrounding the core zone along with the entire system of rivers, canals, natural ponds, natural wetlands, and beaches belonging to Hoi An city, covering an area of 20,660 hectares. This area concentrates important ecosystems that interact closely with the core zone, including: sea, rivers, wetlands, mangrove forests, tidal flats, beaches, sand dunes, river mouths, etc. The buffer zone plays a very important role in controlling water quality before it reaches the sea and in the ecological linkage between the mainland and the ocean. Transition Zone: This is the remaining part of Hoi An city, covering an area of 1,517 hectares, prominently featuring the Hoi An Ancient Town – a World Cultural Heritage site, and traditional craft villages that reflect the interaction between humans and nature. HIGHLIGHTED ATTRACTIONS Beaches at Cu Lao Cham: Cu Lao Cham has many beautiful beaches such as Ong Beach, Chong Beach, Lang Beach, and Xep Beach. Among them, Ong Beach is a favorite stop for tourists, where there are restaurants, fresh water bathing services, and a starting point for water sports activities such as snorkeling. Lang Beach and Huong Beach are quiet beaches, ideal for relaxation and leisure. In addition to the stunning beaches, Cu Lao Cham also boasts many other attractive destinations for those who wish to delve deeper into the culture, history, and nature of the island. Visitors can visit Tan Hiep Market, where you will find local specialties, or explore the Cu Lao Cham Marine Conservation Center to learn about the rich biodiversity of the area. One of the other interesting attractions is the Heritage Banyan Tree, a natural symbol associated with the history and culture of the island. Additionally, Cu Lao Cham is notable for its historical relics, valuable artistic architecture, and traditional crafts classified as national relics, including 02 archaeological sites: Ong Beach site; Lang Beach site, 05 historical relics: Tien Hien Tomb, Xom Cam Well, Yen Craft Ancestor Temple, Ong Ngu Tomb, Co Hon Tomb (Am Linh Temple); 01 architectural relic: Hai Tang Pagoda, and 02 traditional crafts recognized as intangible cultural heritage in the National Intangible Cultural Heritage List: Thanh Chau – Hoi An bird nest harvesting and Ngô Đồng hammock weaving in Cu Lao Cham. TRANSPORTATION To reach Cu Lao Cham, visitors can choose to travel by speedboat or wooden boat, depending on personal preferences and requirements. Speedboats are the most popular and fastest means of transport, with a travel time of only about 15-20 minutes from Cua Dai Port (Hoi An) or other boat docks. This means of transport is favored by many tourists due to its convenience and speed. Wooden boats are also an alternative, but the travel time will be longer, about 90 minutes. Wooden boats mainly serve local residents and group trips. * In addition to the ticket prices for speedboats or wooden boats, visitors should note some fees such as the entrance fee to Cu Lao Cham of 70,000 VND/person and environmental and security protection fees of 20,000 VND/person. Children under 12 months are free, while children from 1 to under 8 years old receive a 50% discount on adult ticket prices. SUGGESTED ITINERARY IDEAL TIME: Cu Lao Cham is known for its stunning natural scenery, from pristine white sandy beaches to lush primary forests and rich marine ecosystems. The ideal time to visit Cu Lao Cham is from March to August, when the weather is stable, the sea is calm, and the sky is clear. Boats operate vigorously during this time, making it easy for tourists to travel to the island; however, from September to February of the following year, although Cu Lao Cham still welcomes visitors, this is the rainy and stormy season in the Central region. At this time, high waves and unstable weather can affect transportation, especially for boats. However, if you want to experience the pristine beauty of the island during this time, be prepared for possible interrupted trips and ensure to monitor weather forecasts for the best preparation. Tourist services such as speedboats or boats may not operate continuously due to rough sea conditions. Other notes: Visitors to Cu Lao Cham need to comply with the following regulations: Adhere to specific regulations at destinations; Do not bring plastic bags when visiting Cu Lao Cham; Wear life jackets when swimming, snorkeling, and when on boats; Do not hunt wild animals; Do not step on, exploit corals, and marine species in strictly protected areas; Only use eco-labeled stone crabs; Dress modestly when visiting cultural and religious relics. Cu Lao Cham, with its natural beauty and rich ecosystem, deserves to be one of the attractive tourist destinations in Central Vietnam. It not only attracts visitors with its beautiful beaches and exciting experiences but also with the unique culture of the island's community. A visit to Cu Lao Cham will surely bring unforgettable memories to every traveler. References: 1. Da Nang City Electronic Information Portal: danang.gov.vn; 2. Hoi An Cultural Heritage Management Center: hoianheritage.net; 3. Cu Lao Cham Marine Protected Area Management Board: culaochammpa.com.vn DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_93.long_description: Thành Điện Hải is a Special National Monument, located right by the Han River (formerly a seaport), and is the most important military fortress of the Nguyen dynasty in Da Nang. The fortress was built with bricks in the Western Vauban architectural style and played a crucial role in the resistance against the French-Spanish coalition (1858-1860) under the command of the renowned general Nguyen Tri Phuong. Currently, the site has been restored, enhancing the system of city walls and moats, and placing ancient cannons majestically facing the river. This place stands as a heroic testament to the patriotism and courageous spirit of the people of Da Nang during the early days of national defense.

loc_94.name: Phu Ninh Lake Scenic Area
loc_94.description:
Phu Ninh Lake is a scenic spot that showcases a unique beauty in each season, and visitors can explore it year-round. The period from May to August each year is considered the ideal tourist season to visit Phu Ninh Lake. 

HIGHLIGHTED POINTS  
The ecological value and natural landscape of Phu Ninh Lake is a large artificial reservoir located in Phu Ninh Commune, Da Nang, about 70 km from the center of Da Nang city. Phu Ninh Lake is blessed with a poetic landscape, featuring a vast expanse of emerald waters that embrace more than 30 large and small islands in the heart of the lake. The rich cluster of islands – notably Turtle Island, Monkey Island, Su Island, and Island 61 – covered in greenery creates a picturesque scene. Surrounding the lake are rolling hills and dense forests, casting reflections on the calm water surface. The lakeside vegetation includes many tropical species such as casuarina, eucalyptus, and Caribbean pine, interspersed with colorful flowers, creating a landscape that is both majestic and naturally poetic. The climate in the lake area is fresh and cool, particularly pleasant even during summer days, providing a relaxing feeling for visitors amidst the charming mountains and rivers. The ecosystem of Phu Ninh Lake is diverse and rich in conservation value. The vegetation here is also abundant with hundreds of precious timber and medicinal plant species being preserved. With its stunning scenery and unique resources, Phu Ninh Lake has been developed into an attractive ecological tourism area, offering a full range of entertainment, recreation, and relaxation services for visitors. In 2009, due to its special historical and scenic values, Phu Ninh Lake was classified by the Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism as a National Historical Site – Scenic Area. This title not only affirms the importance of Phu Ninh Lake in the treasure of Vietnam's natural heritage but also lays the groundwork for the locality to focus on investing in sustainable tourism development here. 

IDEAL TIME  
Phu Ninh Lake showcases a unique beauty in each season, and visitors can explore it year-round. However, the period from May to August each year is considered the ideal tourist season to visit the scenic area. 

DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

It is best to visit in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and crowds.
loc_94.long_description: Dong Duong Buddhist Monastery (Thang Binh District, Quang Nam) was once the largest center of Buddhism in the Champa Kingdom and the Southeast Asian region in the 9th century. Although it is now just a ruin due to the ravages of time and war, the remaining brick walls, foundations, and the tower gate (Tien Gate) still exude a majestic and mysterious beauty. The Dong Duong artistic style is considered unique and the most impressive in Cham sculpture, characterized by its powerful and intense beauty. This is a Special National Monument, attracting researchers and archaeology enthusiasts eager to learn about a once-flourishing civilization that has vanished.

loc_95.name: Da Nang Downtown
loc_95.description: Starting from June 2024, Asia Park will officially rebrand as Da Nang Downtown, aiming to become the most attractive shopping and entertainment hub in the center of the Han River city. DA NANG DOWNTOWN – THE "ENTERTAINMENT DISTRICT" THAT NEVER SLEEPS IN DA NANG New identity, new emotions With a complete overhaul of its brand identity, including logo, signage, and name change to Da Nang Downtown, Asia Park will undergo a spectacular transformation this summer with entirely new entertainment, leisure, and shopping experiences, especially evening activities. The Da Nang Downtown brand identity is designed to be youthful and modern, featuring pop art colors that evoke famous entertainment capitals around the world such as Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Sao Paulo, and the rise of Hollywood in the mid-20th century. The impressive appearance and new experiences promise to bring many emotions to visitors coming to Da Nang Downtown. Inspired by contemporary art and the vibrant atmosphere of modern cities, the logo features an accent on the letter O alongside bright color stripes, representing the sun and continuous movement, breaking through creative thinking to provide visitors with fresh emotions. The new, more colorful, and dynamic look marks the beginning of new breakthroughs for Da Nang Downtown, promising to bring a fresh breeze of life to tourism and entertainment in the heart of the Han River city. Charming drag queen artists in the "Xúng xính" show at Vui Phết Night Market, Phu Quoc (illustrative photo) “We believe that with the new brand identity and unique experiences, Da Nang Downtown will take visitors from one surprise to another and provide a memorable summer in the coastal city of Da Nang. Especially, the evening experiences and shows will contribute to enhancing Da Nang's night tourism appeal to visitors, making Da Nang a sleepless destination,” said Ms. Phùng Phạm Thanh Thúy, director of Da Nang Downtown, expressing high hopes. Da Nang's "new entertainment district" In addition to the existing signature experiences of the park, such as the Sun Wheel – one of the top 10 tallest Ferris wheels in the world, miniature models of Asian tourist icons, or 18 light to extreme thrill rides, Da Nang Downtown this summer will welcome visitors with exciting experiential spaces making their debut in Da Nang, transforming the area into an entertainment district bustling from day to night with the slogan “New street by the river, lively market.” Arriving in June 2024 is a world-class international art show complex making its first appearance in Da Nang. This includes the pinnacle art show “Symphony of River,” featuring a new type of fireworks performance never seen before in Vietnam, the Àu Ơ Da Nang puppet theater with traditional puppet shows, and lively street performances throughout the day, turning Da Nang Downtown into a sleepless town, a vibrant and bustling nightlife hotspot in Central Vietnam. Making its debut in Da Nang with the theme “Symphony of River – The Echo of the River,” the extreme sports art show Jetski & Flyboards combined with music, lights, and skilled water dance performances along with fireworks will give visitors a chance to witness Hollywood blockbuster scenes come to life. The Symphony of River is expected to take place at Da Nang Downtown with two performances, day and night, starting from June 10. The Jetski & Flyboards show is considered a “specialty” at Da Nang Downtown this summer. The show is directed by Tuấn Lê, the creator of the performances Làng Tôi, À Ố… and H2O – a unit with 30 years of experience organizing over 3,500 Jetski events, fireworks, and 2,100 Flyboard shows worldwide. Notably, H20 has previously been featured in blockbuster films such as James Bond, Mission Impossible, Bay Watch… In addition to the Jetski & Flyboards performances, this will also be the first time in Vietnam that the essence of global circus and magic performances will converge. A series of top international artists will participate, including: Maestro Voronin – the legendary comedic magician, the king of “dinner shows” in America; Maxim Voronin – the youngest circus magic prodigy and director of Cirque Tour; Crystal Ladies – the famous twin stars of Cirque De Soleil who went viral on social media when they appeared on The Ellen Show; Lena Koehn, a leading star in the Diabolo discipline; Oleg Izossimov – known as the “Prince of the Balance” holding unbeatable world records; and Olga Moreva – the queen of aerial silk dance… A series of “vedette” artists from Cirque Du Soleil will gather in the WOW Kingdom show at Sun World Ba Na Hills (illustrative photo). Alongside its modern colors, Da Nang Downtown still retains a strong traditional essence with the “Rối Việt” show expected to launch from June 1 at the brand new Àu Ơ Da Nang theater with a capacity of 600 seats. The show will lead the audience into the beauty of Vietnam's landscape and people vividly through the rich symbolic language of the two forms of puppetry: water puppetry and traditional puppetry. The beautiful shapes of the “characters” in the “Rối Việt” show taking place at Sun World Hòn Thơm (illustrative photo). The heart of Da Nang Downtown will be the Vui Phết Da Nang Night Market (VUI-Fest) – a brand new nighttime entertainment and tourism hotspot in the coastal city. The Vui Phết Night Market offers a vibrant shopping, culinary, and entertainment space for both domestic and international visitors, featuring 200 colorful food stalls from Asia and Europe, regional dried specialties, souvenirs, handmade items, along with lively and cheerful street performances unique to the market. The popular Vui Phết Night Market model in Phu Quoc promises to extend visitors' experiences at Da Nang Downtown this summer (illustrative photo). This can be seen as a spectacular transformation of Asia Park into the new brand Da Nang Downtown, promising to make the center of Da Nang burst with excitement this summer. Da Nang Downtown will open a new gateway at 2/9 Street (29/3 Square) and offer free admission to all visitors. A new entertainment complex with a dynamic rhythm both day and night, where the art of the world and Vietnam converge and flourish, awaits you in the Han River city, a destination that always holds new surprises every summer. DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_95.long_description: 24/3 Square is located in the center of Tam Kỳ city (Quang Nam province) and is a key cultural project named after the day of Quang Nam province's liberation. The square features a large, open space designed in a modern style with a majestic Victory Monument at its center, surrounded by lawns, fountains, and greenery. It is the venue for major political events and festivals of the province and serves as a community space for daily recreation and entertainment for the people of Tam Kỳ. In the evening, the square becomes vibrant and lively, highlighting the urban landscape of Quang Nam's provincial city.

loc_96.name: Dien Hai Fortress
loc_96.description:
Dien Hai Fortress (also known as Dien Hai Citadel or Fort de l'Ouest) is located in the center of the city, on the west bank of the Han River, now belonging to Hai Chau Ward, Da Nang City (formerly Thach Thang Ward, Hai Chau District, Da Nang City). In the 19th century, Da Nang was the gateway to the imperial city of Hue and the most important seaport in Central Vietnam. However, as early as the 16th century, Da Nang port had attracted the attention of Western merchant ships. Therefore, according to the regulations of the Hue court, Da Nang port was the only gateway for trade with the outside world, both to control foreign ships and to prevent foreign interference in the capital. Given the strategic importance of Da Nang's trading port, when he ascended the throne in 1802, King Gia Long (Nguyen Dynasty) organized the defense of this area by constructing many fortifications on the Son Tra Peninsula and along both banks of the Han River. Besides Dien Hai Fortress, An Hai, Trấn Dương Thất Bảo, and other fortifications such as My Thi, Hai Chau, Lien Tri, Phuoc Ninh, Hoa Khue were built, but the most significant was Dien Hai Fortress.

STRUCTURE OF DIEN HAI FORTRESS AS DESCRIBED IN DOCUMENTS
Dien Hai Fortress is located on the left bank of the Han River's west side, hence the French called it Fort de l'Ouest. Initially, it was built of earth by King Gia Long in 1813, thus it was called Bao Dien Hai, located near the sea and prone to damage. By 1823, King Minh Mang ordered it to be rebuilt with bricks, hence it was named Dien Hai Fortress and moved further inland, situated in the Trém area of Thach Thang village (as it is today) for safety, with Thai Tuong Nguyen Van Thanh in charge of construction. The fortress was built in the Vauban style, designed by French engineer Olivier Puymanel (who had previously collaborated with Ba Da Loc to assist Gia Long). It has a square shape with four protruding corners, a height of over 5m, a perimeter of 556m, deep moats over 3m, and two gates: one facing east towards the Han River and one facing south (the main gate). The fortress has two layers of walls, separated by a deep moat, with the outer wall being taller than the inner wall. Inside the outer wall, there were residences for generals and soldiers, as well as gunpowder storage, ammunition and weapon storage, food storage, a cannon foundry, and a repair workshop for damaged guns, along with a royal pavilion. During this period, Dien Hai Fortress was one of the most important defensive structures in Da Nang, alongside An Hai fortress on the opposite bank of the Han River, controlling the entry and exit of ships at Da Nang's seaport.

DIEN HAI FORTRESS AFTER LIBERATION IN 1975 UNTIL 2004
On February 4, 1976, Quang Nam - Da Nang Province decided to establish Quang Nam - Da Nang Pharmaceutical Enterprise based on the merger of three pharmaceutical workshops: Quang Da, Quang Nam, and Area V located at Dien Hai Fortress. Officially operational on April 10, 1976, the enterprise made preliminary renovations to suit the initial production conditions of the unit, while the western wall was severely eroded due to encroachment by nearby houses. By 1977, to develop pharmaceutical production to meet increasing demand and export some products to the Soviet Union and Eastern European socialist countries, Quang Nam - Da Nang Pharmaceutical Enterprise began to renovate the unit: constructing several single-story buildings at the front as an administrative area and finished goods warehouse, while also building a system of iron frame warehouses from Czechoslovakia on the west side of the vacant land outside the fortress. In 1985, the enterprise expanded production and removed two iron frame buildings on either side to construct two new three-story buildings, while also renovating the old buildings left by the French. On November 10, 2004, the Da Nang People's Committee approved a master plan to restore the Dien Hai Fortress site and its landscape components to serve visitors and tourists. The Central Pharmaceutical Enterprise 5 relocated to another location in Thanh Khe Ward.

CURRENT STATUS OF DIEN HAI FORTRESS
After 2004, Da Nang City decided to invest in the restoration and enhancement of Dien Hai Fortress with funding from the national cultural target program and the city, reconstructing the entire protruding wall on the northwest side, restoring the walls on the north and east sides, and reconstructing the gate and moat on the south side. Additionally, the Da Nang Museum was constructed on Dien Hai Fortress, with 172.5 m2 of collapsed wall being rebuilt and 1,800 m3 of earth being dredged from filled moats. During the construction process, several remaining cannons were discovered. In 2010, the Da Nang Museum officially opened to welcome visitors. The museum has also displayed the cannons found at Dien Hai Fortress in front of the museum. Over the years, the southern wall and gate, as well as the eastern wall and part of the northern wall, have been restored, while the western wall and moat adjacent to the residential area have not yet been restored. Recently, the Da Nang People's Committee has initiated the relocation of households on the west side of Dien Hai Fortress to restore the original condition of the site, aiming to fully restore and enhance the entire Dien Hai Fortress site in the coming years. With its special values, the historical site of Dien Hai Fortress has been classified as a special national relic by the Prime Minister in Decision No. 2082/QĐ-TTg dated December 25, 2017. 

References: Cultural Heritage Department - Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism: https://dsvh.gov.vn DA NANG CITY TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER
