loc_96.long_description: The Quần thể Tượng đài Mẹ Việt Nam Anh hùng is located at Núi Cấm (Tam Kỳ, Quảng Nam) and is a national cultural site dedicated to honoring the significant contributions of Vietnamese mothers in the defense of the homeland. The statue is modeled after Mẹ Nguyễn Thị Thứ (a mother who lost 9 sons), carved from a massive granite block in the shape of an arch, resembling a mother embracing her children. Inside the statue is a museum displaying touching artifacts and documents about the lives of Vietnamese Heroic Mothers across the country. The structure exudes a grand, sacred beauty and evokes strong emotions in anyone who visits.

loc_97.name: The archaeological site and artistic architecture of Dong Duong Buddhist Monastery.
loc_97.description:
The archaeological site and artistic architecture of Dong Duong Buddhist Monastery (Dong Duong Monastery Ruins) is located in Dong Duong village, Binh Dinh Bac commune, Thang Binh district, Quang Nam province, now part of Dong Duong commune, Da Nang city. The book "Dai Nam Nhat Thong Chi" from the Nguyen dynasty states, “Le Duong district has two towers in Dong Duong village. These two towers are about fifteen trượng apart, one is four trượng high, built of brick, with an octagonal shape on top and a square base, each side measuring one trượng. Four trượng away, there is an old foundation…”. Dong Duong Monastery became widely known only when French scientists published their research and excavation results. According to the inscription found at Dong Duong, in 875, King Indravarman II commissioned the construction of a Buddhist monastery and a temple dedicated to the Bodhisattva who protected the dynasty, Laskmindra Lokesvara Svabhyada. The Mahayana Buddhist nature is clearly reflected in the content of the inscriptions as well as the sculptures at Dong Duong. During the reign of Indravarman II, the capital of the Champa kingdom was moved from the Panduranga region back to the Amaravati region, renamed Indrapura. Some researchers believe that the site of the Indrapura capital is the area of Dong Duong village today. The capital was situated entirely within the Dong Duong field, approximately 2 km² (according to interpretations by French researchers, Dong Duong means "sacred field." The term "Duong" is a phonetic variation of "Yan" - heaven, sacred in Cham language). It is a rectangular valley surrounded on three sides by high hills and mountains. To the north is the Ly Ly river, the gateway to the outside world, which is very discreetly arranged. The inscription also records the king's devotion, stating that in 875, “Due to his faith in Buddhism, the king had a monastery (Vihara) and a temple for Laksmindra Lokesvara Svabhayada constructed. The inscription also mentions the pure land (svargapura) or “liberation city” (moksapura), where the Buddha resides (Buddhapada). The king emphasized that those who commit crimes must suffer punishment in hell. After the construction was completed, the king also donated many lands, money, slaves, and many other things to Lokesvara. The king instructed that after his death, he would be renamed Paramabuddhaloka. All these events prove that King Indravarman II identified with the Buddha in the form of a Bodhisattva. The Champa Buddhism during this period followed the Mahayana tradition. Dong Duong Monastery was a famous Buddhist center not only of the ancient Champa kingdom but also of the entire Southeast Asia during the medieval period. It is considered a Buddhist sanctuary due to the massive scale of the remaining architectural relics and its cultural influence on the surrounding areas. The site has been heavily damaged by nature and war; today, only a section of the tower wall, commonly referred to by locals as the Bright Tower, remains, along with the foundations of architectural structures and some architectural decorations. In 1901, French researcher L. Finot conducted excavations at the monastery and subsequently published his findings on the Dong Duong relics, introducing 229 artifacts discovered, the most notable being a bronze Buddha statue – over 1 meter tall, regarded as a perfect and beautiful piece of art among the best in Southeast Asia. The Dong Duong bronze Buddha statue is currently housed at the Ho Chi Minh City Museum of History, recognized by the government as a "national treasure" in Decision No. 1426/QĐ-TTg, signed by Deputy Prime Minister Nguyen Thien Nhan on October 1, 2012, acknowledging 30 national treasures in the first batch. In 1902, H. Parmentier conducted large-scale excavations, attracting researchers to assess it as one of the important relics of Champa, and Dong Duong Monastery was truly recognized for its scale and significance when scientists published their research results. At that time, H. Parmentier discovered the main architecture of this sanctuary along with many valuable sculptures. According to his description, the entire main temple area and the surrounding towers were distributed along an axis from west to east, approximately 1,300 meters long. Additionally, a system of brick foundations of a monk's quarters and lecture halls connected over a vast perimeter was discovered, with tiles found that suggest a construction structure including a main hall for worship, a monk's quarters for monks to reside and study, and lecture halls for teachings. It can be said that this is an ideal closed model of a monastery for training monks. In September 1996, the Vietnam Archaeological Institute, the National University of Hanoi, and the Quang Nam – Da Nang Museum collaborated to survey Dong Duong village. Archaeologists found that, besides the architectural remnants of the monastery, there were not many traces of human habitation during the Champa kingdom period in Dong Duong village. The climate in Dong Duong village is very harsh, with barren land, and the layer of arable soil is only about 40 – 50 cm thick, with some areas only 20 cm thick, beneath which is a layer of laterite, making it not a convenient place to build a capital. It can be said that Dong Duong is purely a Buddhist sanctuary of the Champa kingdom, while the capital Indrapura must be a larger area, located outside the Dong Duong Monastery complex. The Dong Duong relics are a large architectural complex of a monastery (vihara) comprising many temple-tower combinations. The monastery is a large architectural ensemble enclosed within a rectangular outer wall, with a long side running in the main east-west direction measuring approximately 155m x 326m. The remaining foundation traces indicate that this is a quite large and high outer wall. The outer wall contains three architectural clusters aligned east-west and three large artificial lakes. There are two lakes in the northeast corner and one in the southeast corner. Today, one has been filled in to make farmland. Additionally, the southeast corner of the outer wall has traces of a long building. The outer wall has two gates, east and west. Currently, the gate remains very faint. Inside the outer wall is the inner wall. The inner wall encloses the central temple, which includes the main tower. The inner wall also has a special tower called the Well Tower, located in the southwest corner of the inner wall, which is now buried. + The main temple area is located in a rectangular area, 326m long and 155m wide, surrounded by brick walls. From the main temple area, there is a long path of about 760m leading east to a rectangular valley. The main temple area consists of three architectural groups extending along the east-west axis, separated by walls built of brick. + The eastern group only has the foundation traces of a long house, which researchers believe to be a Buddhist monastery (Vihara). This long house has a rectangular floor plan with two parallel rows of columns running east-west, each row having 8 brick columns, with a wooden frame roof and tiled covering. In this area, there is a large sandstone altar, intricately carved with many human figures and delicate patterns. + The middle group only has traces of wall bases and steps of a long house along the east-west axis. This house has relatively thin brick walls, with entrances at both ends, and many windows on the two walls, covered with tiles. Here, there are four large Dvarapala statues, about 2m tall, which researchers believe are impressive works in Cham sculpture art. The Dong Duong altar is currently displayed at the Da Nang Cham Sculpture Museum. This altar was found at the main tower area to the west, believed to be dedicated to the Bodhisattva Lakshmindra Lokeshvara – the main deity of the monastery. + The western group includes the main temples and surrounding auxiliary towers, which belong to the traditional tower type of Cham architecture; with a quadrilateral floor plan, the entrance facing east, and a fairly long front porch, with wall pillars decorated with dense and twisted leaf patterns, resembling a deep cow track, which is a characteristic pattern of the Dong Duong style. Around the base of the tower, there are decorations of elephant heads and miniature towers interspersed. Inside the temple, there is a large sandstone altar, carved with patterns resembling deep cow tracks, scenes of court life, and some excerpts about the life of Buddha Shakyamuni. During the discovery and excavation of the Dong Duong Monastery ruins, archaeologists found many valuable artifacts such as stone Dvarapala statues, stone Buddha statues, stone Siva statues, a bronze Buddha statue (national treasure – housed at the Ho Chi Minh City Museum of History), bronze goddess statues, etc. Most of the sculptures from Dong Duong are displayed at the Cham Museum in Da Nang. The sculptures at Dong Duong formed a famous artistic style from the mid-9th century to the end of the 9th century, known as the Dong Duong style. Dong Duong is a unique Buddhist relic of the Champa kingdom, not only representing Vietnam's cultural heritage but also a rare Buddhist site in the world during ancient and medieval times. Through the remaining artifacts, it reflects the peak era of a monarchy while elevating Cham sculpture art to its pinnacle. From a religious perspective, Dong Duong makes a distinctive contribution to the Buddhist art of humanity, exemplary in its display, in the meaning of statues, reliefs, composition, and is also among the rarest of ancient Buddhist relics remaining today in Vietnam and Southeast Asia. The relics and artifacts at the Dong Duong site showcase the characteristics of a developmental stage of Cham architectural and sculptural art, which scholars have referred to as the Dong Duong artistic style – "one of the most distinct styles of Cham sculpture art." In terms of architecture, researchers have pointed out the basic characteristics of the Dong Duong style, stating, "... few styles have a clearer personality than the Dong Duong style. It is in this style that the uniqueness and strangeness of Cham art are most clearly expressed." Regarding sculpture in architecture, the sculptures of this style are entirely unique. According to researchers, there are three major characteristics to identify the Dong Duong style: the human statues strongly reflect the ethnic characteristics of the Cham people, with thick lips bordered, thick mustaches sometimes obscuring the lips, making the upper lip thicker and longer than the lower lip. The nose is flat and wide. The eyebrows are high and connected. The decorative patterns are often deep leaf motifs that intertwine, creating a distinctive style. Large flowers represent leaf shapes decorating the edges of hats and jewelry; round earrings with large flowers sometimes use snake heads as decorations on jewelry and belts. From the results of research and excavations, it can be affirmed that the Dong Duong artistic style is also present in numerous sculptural architectures in the provinces of Quang Binh, Quang Tri, Thua Thien – Hue, Quang Nam, Quang Ngai, Khanh Hoa… or many different inscriptions in various regions recording this period, such as Ròn Stele (Quang Binh); Nhan Biều Stele (Quang Tri); Phu Luong, Lai Trung Stele (Thua Thien – Hue); Bang An, Bo Mung; Ban Lanh; An Thai; Lac Thanh, Hoa Que (Quang Nam); Chau Sa (Quang Ngai)… demonstrating that the Indrapura dynasty was a prosperous period, developing in many fields across various regions of the Cham people. The characteristics mentioned above are used as criteria to determine the dating and sculptural works of the Cham belonging to the Indrapura period (9th – 10th century). The spread of this artistic period was quite extensive across the territory of the ancient Champa kingdom. The Dong Duong artistic style marks a phase in the development of architecture and art in Vietnam. With its particularly representative values, the archaeological site and artistic architecture of Dong Duong Buddhist Monastery (now part of Dong Duong commune, Da Nang city) has been classified by the Prime Minister as a special national relic (in Decision No. 2499/QĐ-TTg dated December 22, 2016). 

References: 
1. Cultural Heritage Department – Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism: dsvh.gov.vn 
2. Vietnam Record Holders Association and Vietnam Records Organization (VIETKINGS)

loc_97.long_description: The Sa Huỳnh Culture Museum is located in the ancient town of Hội An and is home to the richest and most unique collection of artifacts related to the ancient inhabitants of the Sa Huỳnh culture (approximately 2000 years ago). The museum displays over 200 original artifacts, including burial jars, precious jewelry, iron production tools, and ceramics excavated from sites in Hội An. Through these artifacts, visitors can envision the rich spiritual life, unique burial customs, and extensive trade relationships of the ancient Sa Huỳnh inhabitants. This is a valuable sightseeing spot that helps visitors gain a deeper understanding of the historical depth of the Hội An region before it became an international trading port.

loc_98.name: March 24 Square
loc_98.description: Named after the event of the liberation of Quang Nam province on March 24, 1975, 24/3 Square is a vibrant cultural and community space closely connected to the lives of local residents. Located in the center of Tam Ky city, Quang Nam province (formerly), now in Ban Thach ward, Da Nang city (new), 24/3 Square covers an area of nearly 4.7 hectares, including main components: the main square, pedestrian walkway area, victory monument area – water fountain, service and restroom area, garden area, and a variety of trees. In addition to creating an architectural landscape and recreational space for the people, 24/3 Square also serves as a venue for political, cultural, and social events. It frequently hosts large-scale events, cultural festivals, tourism, sports, arts, and entertainment. Especially during the Tet holiday, 24/3 Square is adorned with vibrant decorations such as flower boats, yellow apricot blossoms, zodiac mascots, golden dragons, and areas for displaying spring newspapers and calligraphy. Each decoration theme carries a fresh message, inspiring the spirit of entrepreneurship, hope, and aspirations for a peaceful and prosperous new year. The square is also a familiar meeting point for local residents in their daily lives. Every morning or evening, the area is filled with laughter, the footsteps of people exercising, playing sports, strolling, or enjoying the sunset. As night falls, the space becomes sparkling with lights, food stalls, sidewalk cafes, and the cheerful voices of families and groups of young friends gathering to relax after a long day of work. Today, 24/3 Square has become an unmissable stop on the journey to explore the southern part of the city. Here, visitors can participate in unique recreational activities such as roller skating, bumper car driving, or simply sitting back with a refreshing drink, enjoying familiar snacks at small shops around to experience the everyday life of local residents. During Tet or various events and festivals, tourists can immerse themselves in a unique atmosphere with both traditional and modern entertainment programs, admire dazzling fireworks in the sky, or freely shop for local specialties, OCOP products, and abundant agricultural products. All experiences at 24/3 Square will help visitors gain a deeper understanding of the beauty of traditional culture, the friendly spirit, and hospitality of the local people. DA NANG CITY TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER
loc_98.address: Tan Thanh, Tam Ky City, Quang Nam, Vietnam
advise: Bring water and sunscreen when sightseeing.
Check the weather before you go for the best experience.

loc_98.long_description: The City Memorial (commonly known as the 2/9 Monument) is located on 2 September Street, opposite the Helio amusement area. It is a tribute to the heroes and martyrs who sacrificed their lives for independence and freedom. The structure features a unique architecture with three towers rising high and converging, symbolizing unity and strength (a tripod), with a sacred flame at the base. The 29-3 Square surrounding the memorial is very spacious and serves as a venue for rallies, parades, and fireworks displays in the city. It is an architectural symbol with profound political and historical significance, as well as solemnity for Da Nang.

loc_99.name: The Vietnam Hero Mother Statue Complex
loc_99.description:
The Vietnam Mother Hero Monument Complex is a national cultural work, a sacred symbol that commemorates the great contributions of the Vietnam Mother Heroes during the wars of resistance. Covering an area of over 16 hectares, the Vietnam Mother Hero Monument Complex is located on Mount Cam, Quang Phu Ward, Da Nang City. The project was selected from the sketch of artist Dinh Gia Thang, designed based on the portrait of Mother Nguyen Thi Thu – a mother with 9 sons, 1 son-in-law, and 2 grandsons, all of whom were martyrs in the two wars of resistance. In addition to its outstanding cultural and historical values, this place is also a large-scale sculpture with high artistic value, recognized as a typical architectural work of Da Nang City and the entire country.

MAIN COMPONENTS
Main monument: The entire monument is made from solid granite blocks, with a total weight of stone and concrete reaching about 20,000 tons. The architecture of the monument takes the shape of a high mountain in the center, gradually lowering on both sides, evoking the idea that “Mother is an endless source, the soul of the nation.” In the center of the monument is a bust of Mother Thu, over 18 meters tall; the two sides of the monument curve outward as if embracing and protecting her children, with the walls depicting the faint silhouettes of children gathered around Mother, symbolizing a peaceful and united country, where descendants from the North, Central, and South gather around their beloved Mother.

Vietnam Mother Hero Memorial House: Designed within the main monument, the Vietnam Mother Hero Memorial House has an exhibition space of about 950 m², where nearly 50,000 Vietnam Mother Heroes from across the country are commemorated. Here, visitors can view documentary images, biographies, and artifacts related to the lives and contributions of Vietnamese mothers during the war. Some typical artifacts on display include a copper pot used for cooking rice to supply the troops, a weaving loom from wartime, and a flower vase for worship… realistically depicting the silent sacrifices and noble spirit of the mothers.

Tien Mon Square: In front of the monument is a large square that serves as a ceremonial ground, organized in a traditional ritual space with an entrance gate, main axis, and solemn ceremony area. Along the path leading to the monument, there are 30 stone light clusters (and grass carpets) symbolizing 30 years of prolonged resistance, as well as 30 years of waiting for news of husbands and children from the heroic mothers. This square is often used for solemn incense offerings during major commemorative occasions.

Water lake and landscape: In front of the Mother Statue is a large lake with an area of nearly 1,000 m² designed in a semi-circular shape. The monument resembles a mountain rising high in the center and gradually sloping down on both sides. The walls feature the faces of children representing descendants from all regions of the North, Central, and South gathering around their beloved mother, always looking towards her with love, as she seems to open her arms to welcome and embrace her children.

Eight legendary pillars: Considered the symbolic gate of the monument, standing 11.2 meters tall and 1.65 meters in diameter, intricately carved with many images. The number 8 signifies prosperity, abundance, and beautiful reunions, corresponding to the eight golden words that Uncle Ho bestowed upon Vietnamese women: “heroic – indomitable – loyal – resourceful.”

OUTSTANDING VALUES OF THE COMPLEX
The Vietnam Mother Hero Monument Complex is a “red address,” a place where people across the country turn to express gratitude for the indomitable sacrifices of the nation. The project contributes to educating the younger generation about patriotism, national pride, and the noble tradition of “drinking water, remembering its source” of the Vietnamese people. The stories and artifacts in the museum provide vivid historical lessons, awakening gratitude and national spirit among visitors, especially the younger generation. During commemorative holidays, national and city cultural events are often held here, featuring incense offerings to honor the martyrs and Vietnam Mother Heroes. Additionally, this place has been chosen to host many significant national and city events with large-scale artistic programs, becoming a highlight not only in cultural tourism but also in the spiritual and political life of the local people.

EXPERIENCE ACTIVITIES
Along with other popular tourist destinations in the southern part of the city, the Vietnam Mother Hero Monument Complex has become an unmissable destination on the journey back to the roots. At the Monument Complex, visitors can not only explore the architectural works but also have meaningful experiences, listening to touching stories about the silent sacrifices of the mothers for the Fatherland. Strolling around the spacious square in front of the monument to enjoy the airy space with thousands of precious trees sent from various provinces and cities, or visiting the stone garden behind the monument, where poems praising the Vietnam Mother Hero are inscribed… If visiting during major holidays, tourists have the opportunity to immerse themselves in the solemn atmosphere of tribute ceremonies held at the monument. Special artistic programs will provide visitors with a deeper insight into the history and patriotism of the Vietnamese people. Additionally, visitors can also visit nearby tourist attractions such as: the Martyrs’ Cemetery in Quang Phu Ward, Ky Anh Tunnels, Van Thanh – Confucius Temple, Khuong My Tower, Tam Thanh Beach, Ho Tam Thanh Village, Phu Ninh Lake….

loc_99.long_description: Lune Center for the Performing Arts Hoi An is famous for its unique bamboo dome theater design, inspired by the image of a crescent moon, located right at the picturesque confluence of the Hoai River. This is the venue for renowned performances of "Vietnamese Bamboo Circus" such as "À Ố Show," "Teh Dar," and "Palao." Lune Center is not only a place to enjoy top-notch art but also an impressive architectural work that honors the beauty of traditional materials in a contemporary space.

loc_100.name: Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum Hội An
loc_100.description:
Located right in the ancient town of Hội An, the Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum is a unique stop for those who love history and wish to explore the roots of Vietnamese culture. The Sa Huỳnh Museum is a landmark in Quảng Ngãi, and the Sa Huỳnh culture is the common name for the entire cultural heritage in Central Vietnam. This culture spans from Quảng Bình to Ninh Thuận, Bình Thuận and dates back from the 2nd century BC to the 2nd century AD, approximately 2000 years of history. Archaeological discoveries in Hội An such as: Hậu Xá I, Hậu Xá II, An Bàng, Cẩm Phô, Trảng Sỏi, Lăng Bà, Thanh Chiếm, Bãi Ông – Cù Lao Chàm… have shown that the Sa Huỳnh residents once lived, fished, farmed, and engaged in vibrant trade with neighboring regions as well as many cultures outside the area. From these archaeological sites, hundreds of artifacts have been found, revealing a vivid picture of a community with a high level of spiritual, aesthetic, and social organization. To preserve and showcase this valuable collection, the Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum was established in 1994 and has become one of the first specialized museums on archaeology in Central Vietnam. 

The Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum impresses with its two-story architecture that bears a strong French influence, both elegant and harmoniously blended into the ancient urban space. It currently houses and displays over 1,000 original artifacts, vividly reflecting the material and spiritual life of the Sa Huỳnh residents. The displayed artifacts are diverse, including everyday items such as pots, dishes, and teapots; as well as agricultural tools associated with ancient farming, fishing, and trading such as hoes, sickles, and knives. Notably, the museum also preserves coins from the Ngũ Thù and Vương Mãn periods of the Han Dynasty (China), demonstrating the early economic and cultural exchanges between the Sa Huỳnh residents and neighboring areas. Additionally, the collection of jewelry from the Sa Huỳnh residents showcases refined aesthetic standards and skilled craftsmanship, made from stone, agate, and various precious minerals. The most prominent pieces include three-pronged earrings, hoop earrings, and unique beaded jewelry. Sa Huỳnh ceramics are an important highlight of the museum, featuring a variety of forms from pots, bowls, and plates to teapots decorated with intricate embossed and engraved patterns, reflecting the rich aesthetic taste and spiritual life of the ancient residents. Particularly, the jar tombs – a distinctive burial form of the Sa Huỳnh people – are displayed here in various shapes: oval, egg-shaped, cylindrical, with or without lids. Through this, viewers can observe clear signs of social stratification at that time – indicative of the formation of social classes and primitive management institutions. All the artifacts displayed at the Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum are not only compelling evidence of a brilliant historical period but also contribute to clarifying the ancient civilization in Hội An in particular and Central Vietnam in general – a place where cultural, artistic, and intellectual values of our ancestors have converged and crystallized for thousands of years.

**Essential Information**  
Address: 149 Trần Phú, Hội An Ward, Da Nang City  
Opening hours: 07:00 – 21:00 (closed on the 10th of each month)  
Ticket price: Included in the ticket for visiting the ancient town (Ticket price for the ancient town: Price for Vietnamese visitors: 80,000 VND/person. Price for international visitors: 120,000 VND/person)

loc_100.long_description: The Hội An Traditional Art Performance House (66 Bạch Đằng) is an interesting cultural stop on the journey to explore the ancient town. Here, daily performances of folk music take place, showcasing unique art forms from the Central region such as Hát Bội, Bài Chòi, traditional instrument ensembles, and Cham dances, as well as folk dances. The compact and cozy theater space allows the audience to interact closely with the artists. In particular, visitors can also try their hand at playing Bài Chòi - an interesting heritage folk game. This is a place that preserves and introduces the essence of Quảng Nam's folk art to international tourists.

loc_101.name: Da Nang City Memorial and March 29 Square
loc_101.description: The Da Nang City Memorial is a place that honors the heroes and martyrs who fell in the great war of the nation. This site is often a stop for tourists visiting Da Nang on their journey to explore the culture and history of this land. A PLACE TO REMEMBER THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THOSE WHO CAME BEFORE Our country – A nation that throughout its history has always been associated with the cause of building and defending the country, has witnessed a generation of people willing to sacrifice their personal interests for the common good of the nation. During that prolonged resistance period, those who fell before were succeeded by those who rose up; countless Vietnamese people have laid down their lives on this land. Blood and bones have soaked into every inch of the homeland from North to South. A PLACE FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS TO EXPRESS GRATITUDE TO THOSE WHO CAME BEFORE The peace we enjoy today is the result of the sacrifices made by an entire generation. In keeping with this tradition, in the heroic land of Da Nang – the birthplace of brave and resilient children – 27 cemeteries and memorials have been established, among which the City Memorial for Heroes and Martyrs is one of the most prominent works. The City Memorial for Heroes and Martyrs is familiar to the people of Da Nang by the name 2/9 Monument. When traveling to Da Nang, the city’s memorial for heroes and martyrs, also known as the 2-9 Monument, is an architectural site with historical significance that you should visit. Not only is it beautifully designed and rich in humanity, but bowing to light an incense stick at the memorial is also a way for Vietnamese people to express their gratitude to the previous generation. The architecture of the 2-9 Monument The 2/9 Monument is situated in a beautiful location. Behind it flows the poetic Han River, creating a cool, quiet, and solemn space. In front is a long road named 2/9 – a brilliant milestone of the Vietnamese nation. The area in front of the monument is very spacious and often hosts major events of the city. The 2-9 Monument is a synthesis of ideas from architect Pham Sy Chuc and sculptor Pham Van Hang, along with the late painter and sculptor Do Toan. The monument's main structure consists of three wings forming a tripod that converges and rises high, creating a solid and imposing stance amidst the sky and earth. The creative points in the architecture and design of the monument are not only reflected in the lines of the base and body of the statue but also in the integrated functional structure of the pedestal. Beneath the soaring architecture of the statue, a solemn space is constructed to hold incense burners, wreaths, and to commemorate the heroes and martyrs. In the center, on the conical ceiling, images of soldiers holding guns, sacrificing themselves for the country, are shaped by hundreds of thousands of unique ceramic pieces. The phrase “The Fatherland remembers” is placed vertically in the middle of the monument's body, adding dignity and grandeur to the structure while expressing deep gratitude to the generations of ancestors who bravely sacrificed in wars against foreign invaders, bringing peace and independence to the nation. In August 2024, the Da Nang City People's Committee will hold a ceremony to inaugurate the upgraded and restored City Memorial and to renovate and expand the 29/3 Square. The project to upgrade and restore the city memorial and to renovate and expand the 29-3 Square has a total investment of over 212 billion VND from the city budget and socialization; it was started in 2022 and is divided into two phases. In phase 1, the city memorial will be upgraded, a new relief will be created, and the landscape, foundation, and lighting system will be improved. Phase 2 will involve constructing the technical infrastructure around the memorial and the square, highlighted by an artistic water fountain. This project is a heartfelt tribute from the people, soldiers, and officials of the city to remember the contributions of the heroes and martyrs who sacrificed in the struggle to build and protect the city. DA NANG CITY TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_101.long_description: The Non Nước Stone Carving Memory Museum is located at the foot of the Ngũ Hành Sơn mountain, honoring and preserving the history of the Non Nước stone craft village, which is over 300 years old. The exhibition space is intricately designed with hundreds of exquisite stone sculptures from various periods, along with the primitive tools used by ancient craftsmen. The museum recreates the life, hardships, and talents of artisans in their journey to transform lifeless stones into works of art. This is a meaningful cultural destination that helps visitors understand the value of traditional crafts and the passion of the people of Quảng.

loc_102.name: Lune Performing Arts Center Hoi An
loc_102.description: If you are looking for a unique experience of Vietnamese culture, the Lune Performing Arts Center in Hoi An is definitely a destination you cannot miss. HOI AN LUNE CENTER – WHERE ART RESOUNDS BETWEEN TWO RIVERS Located at the confluence of the Hoai River and the Thu Bon River, the Hoi An Lune Center – Lune Performing Arts Center in Hoi An is like an artistic gem amidst the tranquil space of the ancient town of Faifo. The theater features a unique bamboo dome architecture, inspired by the symbol of the full moon – the moon rising, blending into the vast sky and water of the heritage region. The performance space is designed in a spherical shape with a diameter of 24.5m, a peak height of 13m, a floor area of 470m2 with a round stage and 299 seats arranged in a semi-circular layout – set up in a gradually rising tier. Every sunset, when the last rays of sunlight gild the waves and the myriad of enchanting lanterns are lit, the sounds of gongs, T’rưng instruments, flutes, and elephant drums resonate from the auditorium, opening up a spectacular journey to explore and honor traditional values as well as the community spirit of the villages, blending with the wild yet heroic energy of the Central Highlands through the bamboo circus show Teh Dar. Teh Dar means “to go in a circle” in the K’ho language, signifying the preservation of beautiful and diverse ethnic cultural traits, as the artists continuously inspire the circle of life of the tribes, allowing cultures to keep evolving. The performance is an inspiring combination of bamboo circus and bold acrobatics, dancing, and juggling set to live indigenous music, having toured many countries around the world and proudly captivating both Vietnamese and international audiences with its unique storytelling and rich cultural essence. The confluence of rivers adds strength to the continuity of life and natural forms. The Hoi An Lune Center can also be seen as a gathering place, not only celebrating the beauty and talent of people in circus arts but also becoming a bridge to bring Vietnamese culture closer to audiences worldwide. Performance schedule: 18:00 every day of the week, except Monday and Friday. Ticket prices: There are 3 ticket categories aah! [A]700,000 VND ooh! [O]1,150,000 VND wow! [W]1,600,000 VND CONTACT INFORMATION Lune Performing Arts Center Website: www.luneproduction.com Call Center/Zalo: +84 845 18 11 88 Email: reservation@luneproduction.com Address: 1A Nguyen Phuc Chu, Hoi An Ancient Town, Da Nang City. loc_102.long_description: The Áo Dài Show is a unique cultural performance that honors the beauty of the traditional Vietnamese áo dài through various historical periods. The show combines a fashion display of royal áo dài, as well as áo dài from the past and present, with intricately choreographed traditional dance and music performances. Visitors attending the show not only enjoy the stunning collections but also learn about the Nguyễn dynasty culture and the traditional wedding customs of the Vietnamese people. This is a gentle, sophisticated cultural experience that is very appealing to international tourists wanting to learn about Vietnam's national attire.

loc_103.name: Hoi An Traditional Art Performance House
loc_103.description: Located by the poetic Thu Bon River, at 66 Bach Dang, Hoi An Ward, Da Nang City, the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center is a distinctive, professional cultural art space rich in identity. AN ART SPACE IN THE HEART OF THE ANCIENT TOWN The traditional art performance center was established in 1996, situated in a two-story ancient house facing the Thu Bon River. The first floor is used to display various types of masks and traditional musical instruments, allowing visitors to explore and participate in mask painting if desired during performances. The second floor of the house is professionally invested to serve the performance programs. The Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center has been established for nearly 30 years, with artistic programs that have brought much aesthetic enjoyment to a large number of domestic and international tourists, significantly contributing to the preservation of traditional cultural and artistic values in the locality. CULTURAL COLORS THROUGH EACH PERFORMANCE With a team of skilled staff, creative musicians, and choreographers, the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center has staged and performed programs rich in regional cultural identity. Notable performances include Ho Hat Bai Choi, Quang Nam folk songs, Central Vietnam folk songs, folk dances, and traditional instrumental ensembles. The highlight of the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center is the performances that strongly reflect the cultural imprint of Hoi An in particular and Central Vietnam in general. Visitors can enjoy Bai Choi singing – a form of folk music combined with fun folk games that express community spirit; listen to folk melodies accompanied by the sound of the monochord, bamboo flute, and heartfelt singing; admire folk dances and traditional instrumental ensembles such as water dance, offering dance, gongs, drums, and ethnic instruments presented vividly, allowing the audience to easily immerse themselves in the artistic space. Additionally, Hat Boi (also known as Hat Tuong) – a unique traditional theater form rich in emotion – also leaves a deep impression on viewers. A MEETING POINT FOR CULTURE AND ART At the performance center, visitors not only enjoy the art but also feel the enduring vitality of Vietnamese culture. With daily performances at times such as 10:15, 15:15, and 16:15, the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center has evoked many emotions for a large number of domestic and international tourists, helping them gain a deeper understanding of the spiritual life of the local people, and serving as a highlight in the journey to explore the Ancient Town of Hoi An – a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Moreover, visitors here have the opportunity to explore the first-floor exhibition area with masks, traditional musical instruments, participate in Tuong mask painting, experience activities teaching various musical instruments, folk singing, coconut leaf folding, calligraphy, ceramic face painting, making lanterns, and more. The Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center is not only a place to preserve traditional artistic values but also a "bridge" connecting the past and present, between local people and tourists from all directions. Each performance, each note, and each song here tells a story about the soul, love, and cultural identity of Hoi An. IMPORTANT INFORMATION Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center Address: 66 Bach Dang Street, Hoi An Ward Contact: Hoi An World Heritage Cultural Conservation Center – Address: 10B Tran Hung Dao Street, Hoi An Ward, Da Nang City – Phone: +84-235-3861327 – Email: trungtamvhtthoian@gmail.com – Website: http://www.hoianworldheritage.org.vn DA NANG CITY TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_103.long_description: Đồng Đình Museum (Memory Garden) is nestled on the slopes of the Sơn Trà peninsula, a private museum rich in art and ecology. The museum space consists of ancient wooden houses interspersed among a lush natural garden, alongside the sound of a babbling stream. Here, collections of ancient ceramics, traditional household items, and artworks by the owner - Outstanding Artist Đoàn Huy Giao - are displayed. Đồng Đình Museum offers a sense of tranquility, nostalgia, and depth, making it an ideal place for those seeking a quiet moment amidst nature and art.

loc_104.name: Non Nuoc Stone Sculpture Memory Museum - Marble Mountains
loc_104.description: The Non Nuoc Stone Carving Memory Museum - Marble Mountains was established with the mission of preserving an important part of memory and introducing to everyone about the Non Nuoc stone carving village through various stages. Address: R1-R12 Trường Sa, Hoà Hải, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng. The stone carving profession is located at the foot of the mountain, closely linked to the Marble Mountains like a shadow; therefore, the museum also plays a small role in preserving and developing both tangible and intangible culture at the Marble Mountains scenic area. The Non Nuoc Stone Carving Memory Museum - Marble Mountains officially began operations on 24/04/2023. The museum spans over 2000 m2, located at the foot of Thuy Son mountain, at the corner of Huyen Tran Cong Chua and Trường Sa streets, making it very convenient for tourists visiting the heritage and scenic journey in Central Vietnam such as Hue - Hoi An - My Son - Son Tra - Marble Mountains… The museum features a dual space, with an interior of over 700m2 housing hundreds of artifacts, tools for traditional craftsmanship, and valuable products in many aspects. The exterior offers a spacious and cool environment where visitors can stop for refreshments, enjoying the mountains and sea from the “Trăng Nước Xưa” coffee corner. At the museum, visitors can reminisce and experience vividly the enduring legacy of a unique craft village among the best in Vietnam. Here, visitors can also learn about the tradition of formation and development of the craft village, as well as the recognized contributions. While visiting the museum, guests will gain certain knowledge about various types of stone materials, and can compare ancient and modern crafting methods, whether handmade or using CNC technology, distinguishing between products made from natural stone or artificial stone. Moreover, by visiting the museum, guests contribute to preserving the essence of the past and inspire current and future generations to strive for material wealth without impoverishing the soul, together building a life oriented towards “Truth - Goodness - Beauty.” According to baotangdieukhacnonnuoc.vn

loc_105.name: Áo Dài Show Da Nang
loc_105.description:
The "Áo Dài Show" program is a storytelling experience about the history and traditional culture from ancient times to the present, showcasing the Vietnamese dynasties through various historical periods. It connects the royal court to the folk culture, blending traditional and modern cultures, aiming to provide visitors with a deeper understanding of the formation and development of the Vietnamese nation and its people, as well as the evolution of the traditional Áo Dài, which has existed for nearly 300 years. The Áo Dài has been recognized as the national costume of Vietnam since the Nguyễn Dynasty. The program is presented through images of the Royal Court – Nguyễn Dynasty Palace, 100 years of traditional Vietnamese Áo Dài, traditional weddings, scenes of Vietnamese schoolgirls in white Áo Dài, and the Áo Dài Show. The Vietnamese Traditional Culture program "Áo Dài Show" in Da Nang city will always be a highlight of cultural tourism. The "Áo Dài Show" promises to offer visitors impressive and unforgettable experiences of traditional Vietnamese cultural values. 

THE "ÁO DÀI SHOW" PROGRAM LASTS 60 MINUTES 
SHOWTIME DAILY: 01 PERFORMANCE: 19:45 
TICKET PRICE: 400,000 VND/TICKET 
ADDRESS: NGŨ HÀNH SƠN CULTURAL CENTER, 1A TRẦN VĂN ĐÁN, KHUYÊN MỸ WARD, NGŨ HÀNH SƠN DISTRICT, DA NANG CITY, VIETNAM 
CAPACITY: 400 SEATS 

PROGRAM SECTIONS OF THE "ÁO DÀI SHOW" 
1. Introduction: History of Vietnamese Dynasties 
An introduction to Vietnam through the historical periods of nation-building via images and narration by the MC. 
2. Performance: Royal Court Colors 
"Royal Court Colors" is the opening act of the show, introducing the audience to the splendid beauty of the Royal Court – Nguyễn Dynasty Palace during the last royal festival of Vietnam. The performance aims to convey to visitors a vivid and impressive image of the royal beauty depicted in the costumes of Kings, Queens, and officials of the Nguyễn Dynasty during the feudal era – where the traditional Áo Dài of Vietnam was formed. The act also features traditional court dances. 
- Fan Dance 
- Offering Wine Dance 
- Chầu Văn Singing + Cup Dance 

3. Performance: 300 Years of Traditional Áo Dài – Scene of the Old Market 
The Old Market scene will take visitors on a journey to explore the rustic, gentle, and simple aspects of cultural life through the ages. The Old Áo Dài performance recreates the Old Market of the Vietnamese people in simple yet elegant Áo Dài costumes from the late 18th century to the early 20th century. 

4. Performance: Traditional Vietnamese Wedding 
The Nhật Bình dress and Ngũ Thân Áo Dài are the predecessors of today's Áo Dài, symbolizing the traditional cultural attire of the Vietnamese people. The Áo Dài has always been the formal attire chosen by brides, grooms, and Vietnamese families for happy wedding ceremonies in the past. The "Traditional Wedding" performance vividly depicts an ancient wedding, honoring the customs and cultural beauty of the Vietnamese people. 

5. Performance: Lotus Dance / Lantern Dance 
This performance is inspired by the beauty of Vietnam's national flower, a symbol of purity, simplicity, and elegance, expressed through traditional and contemporary dance language, bringing unforgettable emotions to the audience with sweet melodies and the graceful movements of dancers resembling fragrant lotus flowers. 

6. Performance: Vietnamese Schoolgirl Áo Dài 
The "White Áo Dài of schoolgirls" is a famous uniform of Đồng Khánh female students in the capital region – the last imperial city of Vietnam. The graceful, delicate, and elegant schoolgirls in pure white Áo Dài have been immortalized in sweet and tender verses: “How lovely are the two wonderful pieces, The back and front form the words of the nation.” 

7. Performance: Áo Dài Show 
Áo Dài… the traditional attire of the Vietnamese people. 
Áo Dài… carrying culture through the ages. 
Áo Dài is a cultural bridge connecting generations. 
Áo Dài Show… a place to honor Vietnamese traditional culture. 
(Showcasing collections of Áo Dài from famous Vietnamese designers) 

***** 
At the end of the program, guests will have the opportunity to take photos capturing beautiful cultural moments with the performers and models.

In the evening, Nami Beach Club often hosts lively music programs, creating a cheerful and relaxing atmosphere. This is a fresh destination in the Northwest area of Da Nang.

loc_106.name: Dong Dinh Museum
loc_106.description: Dong Dinh Museum is one of the three private museums nationwide that has been licensed to operate and is located in the Son Tra National Forbidden Forest, displaying ancient ceramic artifacts dating from 100 to 2,500 years old. Address: Near Linh Ung Pagoda, Tho Quang Ward, Son Tra District, Da Nang City. Opening hours: 08:00 AM – 05:00 PM. Overview: The ancient ceramic artifacts have been authenticated and belong to the cultures of Dai Viet, Sa Huynh, Champa, Chinese culture, and other regional cultures at Dong Dinh Museum. Exploration: The exhibition includes two traditional wooden houses: one is the traditional house of Mr. Le Tuat, who is considered the father of pottery in Quang Nam, and the other is the wooden house of Mr. Nguyen Nhan, which simulates a wooden house built in the 1930s. There is also a modern architectural house that utilizes the ecological space of the forest, built on a gentle hill. The most common feature that Dong Dinh Museum offers visitors is a cultural and artistic space harmoniously combined with an ecological environment, providing visitors with a sense of both enrichment and relaxation after busy days in everyday life. The cafe offers a variety of coffee, cocktails, and snacks in a cozy, elegant atmosphere. This is an ideal place for both daytime business meetings and relaxing with friends in the evening. loc_107.name: F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar
loc_107.description: Located on the 29th floor of the gold-plated Wyndham Danang Golden Bay hotel, the F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar restaurant naturally becomes the highest European cuisine restaurant in Da Nang. With its luxurious design and romantic atmosphere, F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar is the ideal place for those who wish to experience a fine dining feast at a unique height with family, business partners, or for a romantic date. EXPERIENCE HIGH-END EUROPEAN CUISINE AT THE F29 GOLDEN BEEF & SKY BAR WITH A UNIQUE VIEW FROM ABOVE From the height of the 29th floor, F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar is surrounded by transparent glass, welcoming natural light and providing an open space with a stunning 360-degree view. From here, you can admire the beautiful city of Da Nang, the lush Son Tra mountain, the poetic My Khe beach, or the moment when the whole city transforms with shimmering lights at night. The highest European restaurant in Da Nang – F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar Located on the top floor of the Wyndham Danang Golden Bay hotel, the restaurant proudly offers diners a sophisticated and unique European dining experience in a fine dining style, promising to satisfy even the most discerning food lovers. The panoramic view of Da Nang from F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar LUXURIOUS AND CHARMING SPACE At F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar, the space is designed with a dominant black tone, accented by the green and red of high-end furnishings, providing diners with a sense of luxury and class from every angle. Additionally, the restaurant features two private spaces with a capacity of 10-20 guests, making it an ideal stop for important occasions with loved ones or partners. The specially luxurious design of the restaurant The luxurious Lounge area Not only offering high-end dining experiences in the restaurant area, the elegantly designed indoor bar or the spacious outdoor sky bar of F29 Golden Beef will be a perfect spot to enjoy the sunset from above and savor specially crafted drinks. The bar of the restaurant EXPERIENCE TOP-NOTCH EUROPEAN CUISINE The main kitchen of F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar is designed in an open space, allowing diners to observe the cooking process firsthand. In the restaurant's kitchen, dishes are prepared with the freshest ingredients, by the passionate hands of the chef, with meticulous preparation and thoughtful presentation bringing distinctive culinary flavors. The luxurious space along with the completely open kitchen offers a unique experience With a diverse and rich menu focusing on steak and seafood, diners can completely choose their own story with the ala carte menu or the golden set menu designed for a day to indulge in the chef's arrangements. Notably, the restaurant's famous gold-plated beef delights food enthusiasts. The combination of premium beef flavor and the shimmering gold coating creates a luxurious blend, turning the dish into a work of art. Accompanied by an impressive drink menu with a variety of interesting creative cocktails, it promises you a perfect evening. The famous gold-plated beef at the restaurant The restaurant truly is a culinary destination for discerning diners, an "oasis" amidst the clouds with breathtaking views led by top chefs, premium service, and exquisite quality. F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar Opening hours: 14:00 – 24:00 Address: 29th floor, Wyndham Danang Golden Bay hotel Phone number: 0236 3878 999 DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

With a luxurious open space design, guests can enjoy the captivating beauty of My Khe beach and the endless horizon from here. The restaurant specializes in South American cuisine and unique cocktails, offering a novel taste experience. At night, the atmosphere at CIELA becomes vibrant with DJ music and sparkling lights, making it an ideal place to enjoy upscale nightlife in Da Nang.

loc_108.name: Nami Beach Club
loc_108.description: Just 10 minutes from the center of Da Nang, Nami Beach Club is a beautiful entertainment space within the Japanese-style resort complex – Da Nang Mikazuki Japanese Resorts & Spa. NAMI BEACH CLUB: A TOP DESTINATION TO ENJOY LUXURY BY THE BEACH Featuring a luxurious outdoor pool, a restaurant, along with banquet halls and conference rooms next to Da Nang Bay, this is the ideal destination to indulge in luxury and relaxation by the sea. REDEFINING EXPERIENCE AND LIFESTYLE In a massive pool with cabanas, sun loungers, sofas, and seating next to the bar, what could be better than enjoying exquisite cocktails, delicious dishes, and immersing yourself in a vibrant musical atmosphere? Furthermore, don’t forget to savor the pizzas made fresh on-site and baked in a unique wood-fired oven, ensuring a fresh and authentic flavor that will meet the expectations of even the most discerning guests. NAMI RESTAURANT: THE MOVEMENT OF EASTERN CUISINE Inspired by “waves” (Nami in Japanese means “waves”), the rhythm of the sea, and the soothing sounds that make diners feel more relaxed while dining, Nami Restaurant delights your palate with traditional Vietnamese dishes, artfully blending the influences of Japanese, Korean, and Chinese cuisines. IDEAL CHOICE FOR OUTDOOR EVENTS AND WEDDINGS The sea has always been a source of inspiration for romance, elegance, and poetry. A party by the beach, pool, or grassy area with the sound of gentle waves is surely a top favorite choice. Come to Nami Beach Club to enjoy the beauty of a unique outdoor space in Da Nang and explore unprecedented experiences for beachside outdoor parties, music programs, conferences, weddings, and various other events. Da Nang Mikazuki Japanese Resorts & Spa Hotline: (+84) 236 3774 555 Website: https://mikazuki.com.vn/ Email: sales@mikazuki.com.vn Xuân Thiều Tourist Area, Nguyễn Tất Thành St., Hòa Hiệp Nam Ward, Liên Chiểu District, Da Nang City, Vietnam DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

At a height of 166m, Sky36 offers a spectacular panoramic view encompassing the entire city, the Han River, and the sea. The bar features a high-class design, a state-of-the-art sound and lighting system, along with performances by top dancers and DJs. The atmosphere at Sky36 exudes luxury and vibrancy, making it a must-visit check-in spot for trendy young people and tourists looking to experience a modern, colorful Da Nang at night.

loc_109.name: Crescent Cafe & Bar
loc_109.description: CRESCENT CAFE & BAR, where a variety of drinks and delicious snacks are always served. The most special experience is the floating tray, available from 10 AM to 6 PM daily, a popular activity among any visitor. CRESCENT CAFE & BAR AT DA NANG MIKAZUKI JAPANESE RESORTS & SPA – FLOATING BETWEEN HEAVEN AND ENJOYING THE VIEW OF DA NANG BAY FROM THE INFINITY POOL is the perfect choice for all family members. Da Nang Mikazuki Japanese Resorts & Spa features a luxurious resort space with countless amenities for its 342 standard rooms and suites. This Japanese-style resort and entertainment complex is located by Da Nang Bay and is only a 15-minute drive from Da Nang International Airport. With an ideal location to watch the sunrise and catch the sunset, the infinity pool on the 22nd floor is open from 6 AM to 9 PM, making it the perfect destination for guests to float between the sky and admire the vast beauty of Da Nang Bay. Along the pool are characteristic cabanas for guests to relax comfortably, along with amenities such as a bar, lounge area, children's pool, and Jacuzzi Onsen. In Japanese culture, soaking in hot springs (Onsen) is an essential relaxation activity to improve health and care for the skin. When visiting the infinity pool of Da Nang Mikazuki Japanese Resorts & Spa, guests should not forget to experience soaking in hot springs next to the infinity pool while enjoying the city view from above. Furthermore, during winter, the pool's water system will be switched to warm water, ranging from 30 to 32 degrees Celsius on days when the outdoor temperature drops below 25 degrees Celsius. Therefore, guests do not have to worry about the weather and can still comfortably enjoy high-class experiences here. With a beautiful view and suitable stage, this place is also an ideal venue for organizing events or luxurious parties. loc_109.long_description: Dừa Xanh Camping is an eco-tourism camping site located by the Cu Đê River, in the Hòa Bắc commune, Hòa Vang district. It features a peaceful natural landscape with lush green coconut trees casting their shadows on the gentle river, completely separated from the noisy city. Dừa Xanh offers all-inclusive camping services with comfortable tents, outdoor BBQ parties, and exciting activities like SUP paddling and river swimming. This is an ideal location for families and groups of young friends looking to experience "healing" travel, immerse themselves in nature, and enjoy moments of simple relaxation.

loc_110.name: CIELA SKYBAR AND DINING
loc_110.description: EXPERIENCE THE CHARM OF LATIN SPIRIT AT CIELA SKYBAR AND DINING AT VOCO MA BELLE DANANG, AN IHG HOTEL voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel, a new lifestyle hotel, has launched the Ciela Skybar and Dining restaurant and bar on the rooftop, serving the first authentic South American cuisine in Da Nang. Ciela Skybar and Dining is located on the highest floor of the hotel, offering panoramic views of My Khe beach, Da Nang. September 2024 (Da Nang, Vietnam): With a commitment to enhancing the customer experience, voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel, has launched Ciela Skybar and Dining, the first bar serving South American cuisine in Da Nang, which promises to be a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts. Situated on the 26th floor of the hotel, with sweeping views of the long coastline and vibrant city, this is an attractive destination that brings the lively spirit of South America to Da Nang. In Spanish, Ciela means "sky" or "paradise," reflecting the vast and enchanting beauty of the sky and nature. As a dual-purpose venue, during the day, Ciela Skybar and Dining is a stylish poolside bar serving enticing drinks and a variety of light snacks such as salads, fresh sandwiches, tacos, gourmet pizzas, and hamburgers. Here, guests can enjoy simple lunches or light snacks while relaxing in the infinity pool. As the sun sets, Ciela transforms from a bar into a trendy South American restaurant serving guests a luxurious dinner. This is where visitors can gaze at the picturesque My Khe beach and the sparkling city lights while sipping on creatively crafted cocktails. Inspired by the "voco style," the combination of premium spirits and unique ingredients has created enticing cocktails such as: Above the Clouds (Bacardi white rum, pineapple ginseng tea, matcha, and egg white) and Tito Blossom (Roku gin, yuzu jam, and perilla). Happening daily from 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM, the golden hour Happy Hour offers guests attractive "buy one get one free" deals on select beers, wines, cocktails, and mocktails – a highlight that visitors should not miss. From 7:30 PM to 10:30 PM, the Ciela space becomes even more vibrant with live performances from famous DJs. Guests can experience a unique culinary journey, including creative cocktails and cuisine inspired by South America. A meeting point for stylish guests, Ciela offers unique South American flavors inspired by the fusion of Latin American cultures, a region renowned for its rich cuisine and long-standing cultural traditions. Additionally, Nikkei cuisine – an intriguing blend of Japanese and Peruvian dishes – is one of the impressive styles that captivate diners. Signature dishes at Ciela include: Mr Lima (ceviche, leche de tigre, chili, sweet potato, and corn) and Octopus (smoked grilled octopus, potato fondant, chorizo sausage, romesco sauce, and red chimichurri sauce). Not just a restaurant and bar with a modern Latin flair, Ciela Skybar and Dining also features a private dining area on the 27th floor, making it an ideal venue for events and meetings. The hotel's professional staff can arrange flexible spaces to suit various event sizes, from special dinners and youthful cocktail parties to lively gatherings. The stunning scenery here is sure to please every guest. "Ciela is not just a dining restaurant; it is also an experiential space that embodies a lively, optimistic, and inspiring spirit. Here, we create a vibrant and friendly atmosphere where guests can celebrate special occasions and create unforgettable memories. From light meals served during the day to sunset drinks with unique Latin-inspired themes, along with breathtaking views, all contribute to an exciting 'voco style'," said Mr. Daniel Solombrino, General Manager of voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel. voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel – the first voco brand hotel of IHG Hotels & Resorts in Vietnam, is a resort destination where free-spirited travelers can feel the endless energy of Vietnam's Central Coast. Located on Vo Nguyen Giap street and just steps away from the beach, surrounded by iconic attractions, this 27-story lifestyle hotel offers modern accommodations, top-notch amenities, and a unique rooftop experience. IHG One Rewards members will receive a 20% discount and 100 bonus points for every 10 USD (approximately 247,000 VND) spent with IHG One Rewards Dining Privileges when dining at Ciela Skybar and Dining. About voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel: Attractive, stylish, and comfortable, voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel is located in a prime location on Vo Nguyen Giap street, just steps away from My Khe Beach in Da Nang City. The hotel is an excellent accommodation choice for free-spirited travelers who appreciate the vibrant beauty of Vietnam's Central Coast and the opportunity to explore the destination. Guests will experience modern rooms with bright colors, including family rooms with distinctive bunk bed designs. voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel also features a swimming pool, a fitness center, and a serene spa area on the 24th floor with ocean views for guests to enjoy relaxing moments, along with an all-day dining restaurant and a rooftop bar with a distinctive South American style. The hotel also offers three meeting and event spaces suitable for meeting and leisure needs. For more information and reservations, please visit here and follow voco Ma Belle, an IHG Hotel on Facebook and Instagram. About voco hotels: voco hotels combine the prestige of a renowned brand with the warmth and charm of an independent hotel, providing guests with a reliable premium experience. The term 'voco' comes from Latin, meaning 'to invite,' reflecting attentiveness, closeness, and allure. voco-branded hotels blend memorable moments with high-end interiors, from relaxing amenities to spacious and comfortable beds. Guests will always receive a warm welcome and can check in quickly, relax in comfortable accommodations, and enjoy vibrant restaurants and bars that offer numerous opportunities for connection and interaction. For more information and to book a room, please visit www.vocohotels.com or connect with us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. About IHG Hotels & Resorts: IHG Hotels & Resorts is an international hotel management company with a mission of Hospitality for Good. With 18 hotel brands and IHG One Rewards, one of the world's largest hotel loyalty programs, IHG has over 6,000 hotels operating in more than 100 countries, with approximately 1,800 hotels in development. IHG Hotels & Resorts brands are divided into four groups: Luxury & Lifestyle: Six Senses Hotels Resorts Spas, Regent Hotels & Resorts, InterContinental Hotels & Resorts, Vignette Collection, Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants, Hotel Indigo; Premium: voco hotels, HUALUXE Hotels & Resorts, Crowne Plaza Hotels & Resorts, EVEN Hotels; Essentials: Holiday Inn Hotels & Resorts, Holiday Inn Express, avid hotels; Suites: Atwell Suites, Staybridge Suites, Holiday Inn Club Vacations, Candlewood Suites; Exclusive Partners: Iberostar Beachfront Resorts. InterContinental Hotels Group PLC is the parent company of the Group, established and registered in the UK and Wales. It is estimated that approximately 345,000 employees work at IHG hotels and corporate offices worldwide. DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_110.long_description: Túy Loan Village Communal House, located in Hòa Phong Commune, Hòa Vang District, is a national historical and cultural relic, representing the beauty of a prosperous riverside village. The communal house, over 100 years old, honors the early settlers who contributed to the reclamation of this land, featuring traditional wooden architecture and exquisite wood carvings. Every year, during the beginning of spring (the 9th-10th day of the first lunar month), the Túy Loan Village Festival takes place vibrantly with solemn ritual ceremonies and folk games such as boat racing and rice paper making contests. The communal house is situated in a peaceful space with banyan trees, water wharves, and the communal yard, evoking the roots of Vietnamese culture. Visitors can also enjoy the famous Mỳ Quảng and Túy Loan rice paper here.

loc_111.long_description: An Phú Farm is a lush organic farm located in Hòa Phú commune, Hòa Vang district, making it an ideal destination for agricultural tourism and experiential education. The farm is well-planned with areas for growing clean vegetables, fruits, and raising livestock using natural, chemical-free methods. This is a place where families often bring their children to learn how to be young farmers, harvest produce themselves, and gain a deeper understanding of the value of clean food. The atmosphere at An Phú Farm is very fresh and quiet, perfect for weekend picnics and enjoying rustic dishes made from homegrown ingredients.

loc_112.name: Dừa Xanh Camping
loc_112.description: With a poetic and picturesque landscape among the straight coconut trees swaying in the wind, with their fronds spreading out like beautiful umbrellas, Dừa Xanh Camping is nestled amidst hills next to a peaceful and serene river, surrounded by fresh and cool nature. Dừa Xanh Camping, located in Phò Nam village, Hòa Bắc commune, Hòa Vang district, Da Nang city, is likened to a painting of a coconut garden. This site is situated near the foot of the Phò Nam suspension bridge that crosses the tranquil Cu Đê river, connecting the two villages of Nam Yên and Phò Nam. At Dừa Xanh Camping, locals and tourists can enjoy: a spacious and airy area filled with green coconut shade, many check-in corners; a large swimming pool; tents, campfires; outdoor BBQ dinner; preparation tools…. and especially the experience of the bamboo jumping game. Although it has just started operating, the tourist area has attracted many locals and visitors. For more details, please contact: Dừa Xanh Camping – Phò Nam village, Hòa Bắc commune, Da Nang | Hotline: 0906446658 TTXTDL

loc_112.long_description: Bana Rita Farm is located at the foot of Ba Na Mountain, in Hoa Phu commune, and is a unique eco-tourism area combined with a fruit garden. The highlight of the farm is the lush green grapefruit garden and various types of fruits throughout the seasons, creating a refreshing green landscape. This place offers gentle recreational activities such as grass sliding, cycling, fishing, and overnight camping in nature. Bana Rita Farm provides a relaxing atmosphere, separate from the hustle and bustle of the city, making it an interesting stop on the way to the Ba Na Hills tourist area. Visitors here can enjoy fresh fruits right from the garden.

loc_113.name: Tuy Loan Village Communal House
loc_113.description: The Túy Loan Village Communal House is a structure over 500 years old, the most impressive and historically significant site in Da Nang city. It is a place of spiritual worship, holding immense historical value in terms of architecture, with valuable historical artifacts, and it preserves 25 royal decrees granted by the Nguyễn dynasty. In addition to its unique architectural features, the communal house has a stele dating back to the first year of Thành Thái (1889) and many horizontal and vertical panels that are over 100 years old. Not only does the Túy Loan Village Communal House showcase distinctive architecture, but it also marks significant events in the golden history of resistance against foreign invaders. In 1945, the people of Túy Loan used the communal house and church as headquarters to oppose the colonial regime, joining forces with An Phước to seize power from the French and Japanese. The communal house also served as a base for our troops and people during the years of resistance against foreign invaders. The Túy Loan Village Festival takes place over two days, on the 9th and 10th of the first lunar month, featuring both ritual and festive activities. The festival includes traditional activities such as the procession of royal decrees, worship ceremonies, bài chòi singing, folk games, boat racing, and singing contests on the river, as well as performances of Phước Lộc Thọ; showcasing traditional products like Túy Loan rice paper, various local cakes, and safe vegetables from Túy Loan; and competitions related to traditional crafts such as rice paper making, rice paper grilling, and bánh tét wrapping. An equally captivating aspect that attracts a large audience is the human chess (living chess)…. DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_113.long_description: Mân Quang Communal House is located in Hòa Quý Ward, Ngũ Hành Sơn District, and is an ancient cultural historical relic associated with the land reclamation and village establishment process of the people of ancient Đà Nẵng. The communal house worships the village's guardian spirit and the ancestors, playing an important role in the spiritual life of the local community. The architecture of the communal house features traditional elements with yin-yang tiled roofs, sturdy lim wood columns, and majestic dragon and phoenix decorative motifs. Despite experiencing many historical ups and downs and wars, Mân Quang Communal House has been preserved and restored by the people, serving as a venue for annual traditional village festivals.

loc_114.name: An Phú Farm
loc_114.description: An Phú Farm covers more than 18,000m2 and was originally a livestock farm focused on clean agricultural production to supply products for its namesake store chain. Address: Hoàng Văn Thái Street, Hòa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam. Hotline: 093 566 64 45. Email: anphufarm.organicfinefood@gmail.com. After being included in the pilot list by the Hòa Vang District People's Committee to support the development of tourism services combined with clean agricultural development, An Phú Farm has invested in additional areas for check-in, resting, dining, accommodation, and services for visiting vegetable gardens, learning to be farmers, and taking care of livestock. An Phú Farm is a model approved by the Hòa Vang District People's Committee to participate in the pilot project for exploiting tourism services combined with agricultural and aquaculture development in the district according to Resolution No. 82/NQ-HĐND dated December 17, 2021, of the city council and Decision No. 487/QĐ-UBND dated February 15, 2022, of the city’s People's Committee. Participation in this pilot model helps optimize land resources based on core agricultural activities, creates jobs for local labor, and contributes to the socio-economic development of Hòa Vang District in particular and Da Nang City in general. An Phú Farm has a total investment area of 18,183 m2. It produces organic vegetables, fruits, and other products under the "one commune one product" (OCOP) program, while also providing experiential services, entertainment, and other services. loc_114.long_description: The eco-tourism area Làng Mê is located by the picturesque Cu Đê River in Hòa Bắc commune, Hòa Vang district, and is a "hot" destination for young people who love camping. It boasts a stunning landscape with lush green grass stretching out, a serene river, and surrounding mountains. Làng Mê offers Mongolian-style glamping tents with full amenities, combined with activities like SUP paddling, campfires, and outdoor BBQ parties. The atmosphere here is incredibly romantic and "chill," especially during sunset by the river.

loc_115.name: Bana Rita Farm
loc_115.description: After a long day at work, if you want to explore the wild nature and chill & cheer "to the max" with your family or friends in Da Nang, then head straight to BANA RITA GLAMPING FARM. Just 17km (28 minutes by motorbike or car) from Da Nang Airport, you will reach Hoang Van Thai Street leading up to Ba Na - Suoi Mo, a beautiful route located in the Northwest of Da Nang City. BANA RITA FARM is a completely new camping experience at the foot of Ba Na Mountain, a very special area where the rooster's crow awakens the dawn for the three communes of Hoa Phu, Hoa Ninh, and Hoa Nhon in Hoa Vang District, Da Nang City. You can cast your net and fish in the Cao Son Stream that embraces the 5-hectare farm garden. You can pick tea leaves from the farm, gather firewood to boil water, and brew a cup of green tea to welcome the dawn peeking behind Hon Nang Mountain, admiring the dew drops resting on the green grass. Immerse yourself in the cool breeze of the mountains, watching Hon Nang glow in the darkness, you will feel like you are lost in a magical space very different from the city. The elegant and pure Nàng RITA, like a gem, is located on the Ba Na Suoi Mo tourist route, surrounded by the Cao Son Stream and sheltered by Hon Nang Mountain. This beautiful land at the foot of Ba Na Mountain is called BANA RITA. Go. Go to recharge and fill yourself with positive energy, ready for the busy days ahead in the city! Bana Rita Farm | Chill & Cheer Hotline: 0905 815 889 / 0915 858 489 Email: banaritafarm@gmail.com

loc_115.long_description: Homestay Nam Yên is located in Nam Yên village, Hoa Bac commune, and is a community tourism model that allows visitors to experience the authentic life of the local mountain people. The homestays here are often built simply, close to nature, utilizing the available gardens and river landscapes. Staying at Nam Yên, guests will be warmly welcomed by the hosts and can enjoy local dishes such as grilled fish, free-range chicken, and wild vegetables. This is a great opportunity to learn about the local culture, stroll and admire the peaceful countryside scenery, and enjoy the rare fresh air.

loc_116.name: Mân Quang Temple
loc_116.description: Mân Quang Communal House is currently located in Mân Quang II neighborhood, Hòa Quý ward, Ngũ Hành Sơn district, Da Nang city. 1. Name: Mân Quang Communal House. 2. Location and directions: Mân Quang Communal House is currently located in Mân Quang II neighborhood, Hòa Quý ward, Ngũ Hành Sơn district, Da Nang city. It is about 6km southwest of the Ngũ Hành Sơn scenic area. 3. Type of monument: Mân Quang Communal House is a historical monument. 4. Description of the monument: Mân Quang Communal House was destroyed by invaders in 1972. The villagers of Mân Quang worked together to rebuild a new communal house to worship the deity and the ancestors, as well as those who contributed to the homeland and country. The house was inaugurated on December 21, 2003, using modern materials and reinforced concrete structure, but in the old style. The house measures 12.34m in length and 8.15m in width on a site of 696m. It is built facing northwest, consisting of a main hall with 3 compartments and 2 wings, and a rear altar. In front of the house are two large stone pillars, each topped with a lion statue. On either side are smaller pillars, each featuring a wine gourd. Next is a screen wall 2m high and 2.5m wide. The front of the screen wall is adorned with two cranes standing on a turtle. The inner side features a dragon horse, all made from ceramic pieces. On either side of the communal house are two small shrines, the right shrine worships a general from the Nguyễn clan, and the left shrine worships a general from the Võ clan. According to legend, these are the two generals who defeated the sea monster that troubled the lives of the local residents. The steps leading up to the front hall have two round columns decorated with two coiling dragons. The two columns at the ends of the eaves are square and have couplets inscribed on them. Previously, the old communal house had four green stone columns inscribed with four couplets. Currently, the house still retains two eaves columns made of green stone. Inside the house, the rear altar worships the village's tutelary god. The left and right sides are dedicated to the ancestors. The roof of the communal house is tiled, and the rear altar has its own roof. The ridge is decorated with the motif of "two dragons worshiping the sun." The ends of the roof are adorned with two phoenixes. In the center above the eaves is inscribed "Mân Quang Communal House." On either side are two turtles. All these decorative items are made from ceramic pieces. The eaves are fitted with a row of small blue-glazed plates. At both ends of the steps are two large lion statues. The courtyard of the communal house has been paved with cement. A fence has also been built around the house. The house is situated in the middle of a field, making it very airy on all four sides. 6. Artifacts in the monument: The communal house has been burned and plowed multiple times, so the worship items and royal decrees have been lost. Currently, the house retains 3 royal decrees from the Đinh, Lê, and Trần clans dating back to the second year of Khải Định (1917). 7. Forms of cultural activities, folk traditions, and festivals: Every year, the villagers hold a prayer ceremony for peace on the 10th day of the 3rd lunar month. All offerings for the ceremonies are contributed by the villagers. 8. Historical, scientific, artistic, and cultural value: Although the communal house was destroyed during the war and many artifacts were lost, the clans still retain 3 royal decrees for the ancestors. Additionally, the clans have preserved a funeral poem. A special feature of Mân Quang Communal House is that it includes the name of the Hero of the People's Armed Forces Trần Minh Thiệt, who was a major general and deputy chief of staff of Military Region V, in the funeral poem. This reflects the villagers' deep gratitude and remembrance for those who contributed to the homeland, regardless of the era they lived in. The newly built communal house also has an inscription about the journey of the ancestors to this land, which has been translated into Vietnamese. The reconstruction of the new communal house in 2003 also demonstrates profound gratitude towards the predecessors, despite the economic difficulties faced by the villagers of Mân Quang. This is also a beautiful tradition that all residents of the village are obliged to continue and pass on to future generations. DA NANG MUSEUM OF CULTURAL HERITAGE MANAGEMENT BOARD
