loc_116.long_description: Nam Yên Valley Grape Garden is a unique high-tech agricultural model in Hoa Bac, offering an experience that feels like being in Ninh Thuan right in Da Nang. The garden grows imported grape varieties such as Black Pearl and Pink Lady, producing heavy, sweet, and visually appealing bunches of grapes. Visitors can tour the grape care process, personally cut ripe bunches of grapes to take home as gifts, and take photos under the cool green grapevines. The presence of the grape garden has added an interesting highlight to the ecological tourism map of Hoa Vang, attracting a large number of visitors.

loc_117.name: Me Village
loc_117.description: Mê Village is located about 20 km from the center of Da Nang, in Nam Yen hamlet, Hoa Bac commune. With the advantage of a fresh environmental landscape, a peaceful view of Cu De River, and majestic mountains, Mê Village is an ideal destination for visitors seeking relaxation, picnics, and outdoor activities with family, friends, companies, or organizations. Visitors to Mê Village can truly immerse themselves in the cool green space of nature and the fresh atmosphere. Mê Village is separated from residential areas, so it is quiet, free from traffic noise and pollution. Guests can completely relax at Mê Village any day of the week. Enjoying the green, tranquil, and serene environment is a hallmark of Mê Village. The tents accommodate 4-5 people, with two layers to protect against rain, wind, and insects. They are fully equipped with clean blankets and pillows to ensure the most comfortable experience for guests. In front of the tents, there is a large area of land with green grass for organizing parties, birthdays, and gatherings. At night, everyone staying at the village can gather around the campfire. At Mê Village, the restaurant and café always offer signature drinks from Hoa Bac such as sugarcane juice, guava juice, and watermelon, and there are outdoor BBQ parties at night. Mê Village collaborates with local families and farmers, providing visitors the opportunity for real-life experiences. Guests can participate in interesting activities such as visiting sugarcane, beans, and watermelons. Moreover, after participating, visitors can purchase unique gifts such as sugarcane, sugarcane juice, clean vegetables, local fruits, sweet potatoes, corn, and free-range chicken of guaranteed quality directly from the gardens to give to loved ones or friends. Additionally, the village offers camping accommodation services, a children's swimming pool, a stage for organizing group activities, and meets the needs for dining, refreshments, and relaxation in a quiet space. It also provides agricultural products for guests to take home as gifts if desired. DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_117.long_description: Yên Retreat is the most pioneering and famous camping site in Hòa Bắc, located by the Cu Đê River, often likened to a "miniature European paradise" in the heart of Da Nang. It captivates visitors with its dreamy, peaceful beauty, featuring white tents set up on a green lawn, facing the gently flowing river. Yên Retreat offers a complete luxury camping service, including sleeping tents, dining, and recreational activities, allowing guests to enjoy their vacation without the hassle of preparation. This is the ideal place to "escape" with friends or loved ones, where you can stargaze at night and wake up to the sound of chirping birds.

loc_118.name: Nam Yen Homestay
loc_118.description: Nam Yen Homestay, run by Do Thi Huyen Tram, is a community learning center that organizes workshops and training classes on community tourism, establishing extensive connections with the community to develop products, and has been particularly successful with experiential education products for students from elementary levels to those in institutes, schools, and training centers both domestically and internationally, focusing on the values of nature, ecological tourism, and the culture of the Co Tu people. Nam Yen Homestay primarily provides services for those visiting and studying in Hoa Bac, attracting many localities and schools from the Central Highlands and southern provinces to learn from its experiences. Hoa Bac is located about 40 km northwest of the city center, in Hoa Bac commune, Hoa Vang district, Da Nang, situated between the Bạch Mã National Park and Ba Na – Nui Chua nature reserve, formed by mountain ranges with an average height of about 200 meters above sea level. This area boasts diverse primary forests, beautiful rivers, streams, and waterfalls, almost untouched by modernity. Based on its advantageous terrain, climate, and rich resources, several ecological and community tourism areas have been developed here, providing opportunities for visitors to explore, learn about, and experience the local scenery and culture. DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_118.long_description: Vũng Bọt is a pristine natural picnic spot located upstream of the Bắc River (the main branch of the Cu Đê River), in Tà Lang - Giàn Bí village, Hòa Bắc commune. Here, you can find natural stone pools stacked on top of each other and clear, cool water holes, surrounded by dense primary forest. Vũng Bọt has not been heavily impacted by tourism services, so it retains its original, wild beauty, making it suitable for groups of young people who enjoy exploring, trekking, and swimming in streams. The road to Vũng Bọt can be quite difficult to navigate, but it is compensated by the majestic natural scenery and absolutely cool atmosphere.

loc_119.name: Nam Yen Valley Vineyard
loc_119.description: Nam Yen Valley Grape Garden, also known as YEN VALLEY, is located in Nam Yen Valley and is a pilot model for developing agriculture, forestry, and aquaculture combined with tourism services in Hoa Vang District, as per Resolution 82/NQ-HĐND dated December 17, 2021, by the Da Nang City People's Council, which was approved by the Hoa Vang District People's Committee in Document No. 862/UBND-VHTT dated April 14, 2023. Nam Yen Valley Grape Garden offers a refreshing experience with vibrant colors, where visitors can pick ripe grapes nourished by the alluvial soil of Cu De River, take photos for check-ins, keep souvenirs, and enjoy products made from grapes such as dried grapes, grape syrup wine, and other organic products. Hoa Bac is located about 40 km northwest of the city center, and Hoa Bac Commune belongs to Hoa Vang District, Da Nang, situated between the nature reserves of Bach Ma National Park and Ba Na – Nui Chua, formed by mountain ranges with an average elevation of about 200 meters above sea level. This area boasts diverse primary forests, beautiful rivers, streams, and waterfalls, almost untouched by human development. Based on its advantages in topography, climate, and rich resources, several ecological and community tourism areas have been established here, providing opportunities for visitors to explore, learn about, and experience the local scenery and culture. loc_119.long_description: The Gươl House is a traditional communal house, regarded as the soul and cultural symbol of the Cơ Tu ethnic group living in Hòa Bắc (Tà Lang village, Giàn Bí). The Gươl House is built in the central position of the village, featuring a unique stilt house architecture with a tall conical thatched roof, decorated with wooden sculptures of animals and distinctive geometric patterns. This is the place where communal activities, festivals, village discussions, and the reception of esteemed guests take place. While visiting the Gươl House, tourists will hear the village elder tell stories, watch gong performances, and enjoy the captivating Tung tung da dá dance of the Cơ Tu people.

loc_120.name: Yên Retreat
loc_120.description:
Yên Retreat is an emerging eco-tourism destination in Da Nang, located about 35km from Da Nang city in Hoa Bac commune, Hoa Vang district. It takes about 40 minutes to get there by motorbike or car. The route is relatively simple and easy to navigate. 

INTRODUCING YÊN RETREAT 

How long has it been since you breathed in fresh air by a river or stream? How long has it been since you had the chance to sit together with friends, sharing stories amidst the cool nature? How long has it been since you took the time to reflect on life or simply sat by the tranquil river, watching the delicate wildflowers sway in the breeze, letting your soul wander with the mountains and rivers? If there comes a day when the urban hustle makes you feel suffocated, luxurious conveniences feel too ordinary, or city life wears you out… then perhaps you can take a little time to… return to Yên. 

SERVICES AT YÊN RETREAT 

Services at Yên Retreat include: coffee, dining and BBQ without overnight stay (400,000 VND), event organization, overnight camping (600,000 VND), and customized services (company tours, wedding photography, event organization, birthday parties, picnic programs…). Guests can contact Mr. Vũ directly at (0935 888 293) or email: yenretreat@gmail.com. 

According to https://yenretreat.com/

loc_120.long_description: Homestay Alăng Như is one of the first homestays of the Cơ Tu ethnic group in Giàn Bí village, Hòa Bắc commune. The owner is Alăng Như, a dedicated Cơ Tu woman committed to preserving culture and developing community tourism. Here, guests can stay in a traditional stilt house, experience weaving brocade, basketry, and cooking local dishes such as cơm lam and grilled meat in bamboo. The homestay provides a warm, family-like atmosphere, connecting guests with nature and the unique local culture. This is a highlight in the model of sustainable community tourism in Đà Nẵng.

loc_121.name: Vung Bot
loc_121.description: Vung Bot is the source of the Cu De River, where the two branches of the North River and the South River converge, originating from the majestic Truong Son mountain range. At Vung Bot, visitors can fish, catch shrimp, and bathe in the stream. Tourists will be safer when accompanied by local people who are knowledgeable about the stream. Hoa Bac is located about 40 km northwest of the city center, and Hoa Bac commune belongs to Hoa Vang district, Da Nang, situated between the Bạch Mã National Park and Ba Na – Nui Chua Nature Reserve, formed by mountain ranges with an average height of about 200 meters above sea level. This area boasts diverse primary forests, beautiful rivers, streams, and waterfalls, almost untouched by natural wilderness. Based on its advantages in terrain, climate, and rich resources, several ecological and community tourism areas have been established here, providing opportunities for visitors to explore, learn about, and experience the local scenery and culture.

loc_121.long_description: Hội Yên Parish Church is located by the Cu De River, in Hoa Bac commune, distinguished by its classic Gothic architectural beauty amidst the lush mountainous landscape. The church features an elegant gray color, with a tall bell tower casting its shadow over the river, creating an incredibly picturesque and peaceful scene. This is a place of worship for the local Catholic community, as well as a popular sightseeing and photography spot for many tourists visiting Hoa Bac. In the late afternoons, the sound of the church bells resonates through the mountains and forests, creating an indescribable sense of tranquility.

loc_122.name: Hòa Bắc Gươl House
loc_122.description:
In the area of Da Nang City, the Co Tu community primarily resides in the villages of Ta Lang, Gian Bi (Hoa Bac commune) and Phu Tuc (Hoa Phu commune). Among them, the two villages of Ta Lang and Gian Bi have more than 250 Co Tu households. The Gươl house in the two villages of Ta Lang and Gian Bi (Hoa Bac commune, Hoa Vang district) serves the needs of tourists to visit, enjoy various forms of traditional culture, and display the most important traditional Co Tu crafts during festivals and holidays. For the Co Tu people, the Gươl house is the communal house of the village, where it is not only a sacred living space but also considered the soul of the village. Here, one can clearly see the talents of folk artisans and the multi-dimensional cultural values of the Co Tu people. The Gươl is a place to worship the folk deities, ancestors, and forefathers of the Co Tu. The Gươl house preserves common treasures and wealth, serves as a meeting place, for rituals, performances of various art forms, and folk games. According to Elder Alăng Mỹ (64 years old, residing in Ta Lang village, Hoa Bac commune), the Co Tu people believe that the Gươl house is a sacred place where deities, ancestors, and forefathers reside. Inside the Gươl, people are not allowed to argue but must always unite, support, and love one another for the survival and development of their lineage. On the roof of the Gươl house, at both gable ends, there are statues of roosters, symbolizing the creature that awakens people each morning. The roof is thatched with palm leaves or nipa leaves. The Gươl house is built in the style of a stilt house, with one main pillar (father pillar) in the center and eight smaller pillars surrounding it, connected to form a sturdy system. The main pillar plays a very important role, symbolizing the backbone of the village elder. The more beautiful and taller the pillar, the more it represents the authority of the village elder and the strength of that village. Nowadays, the Co Tu have replaced wooden pillars with concrete pillars and painted them to look like wood. The Co Tu people believe that the tring bird is the messenger of the Rice God, guiding them to find new land for cultivation and establishing villages. Therefore, on the main pillar, there are carvings of a pair of tring birds and a rooster, representing beauty, the connection between humans and nature, and the desire for fertility and a happy life. The crossbeams are decorated with patterns, motifs, and images of daily life in the community such as: young men hunting, young women dancing tung tung da dá, gong performances, and rice pounding… which help embellish the interior of the house, showcasing the unique culture of the Co Tu people. Particularly, in the past, when the Co Tu went hunting in the forest, they would bring back animal skulls or buffalo skulls after the sacrifice ceremony to hang on the walls, pillars, and beams of the Gươl house. Inside the Gươl is a place to worship the deities according to the folk beliefs of the Co Tu, with hopes for favorable weather, bountiful harvests, and good fortune for the villagers. Also, right in the middle of the main pillar, the community carves the image of a mortar symmetrically on the top and bottom. This image symbolizes both abundance and fertility. Among them, the most important part is the mirror, which is attached symmetrically with two thin wooden panels carved with the image of a pair of tring birds and a rooster. This symbolizes the two arms of a Co Tu woman dancing the tung tung da dá, offering to the Rice God and the Sky God everything they have produced. The sculptures and the long-standing culture preserved in the community's house have made the Gươl house a familiar, close image and a source of pride for the Co Tu people. It helps future generations understand and inherit the material and spiritual cultural values of their ethnicity. 

THE MEANING OF THE “TUNG TUNG DA ZÁ” DANCE OF THE CO TU PEOPLE
The “Tung tung da zá” dance, also known as the (heavenly offering dance), has been closely linked to the spiritual life of the Co Tu for generations. No Co Tu person, whether in Quang Nam, Da Nang, or distant Thua Thien Hue, is unfamiliar with this dance. The movements in the Tung tung da zá dance mimic the daily labor and activities of the Co Tu people such as rice harvesting, fishing, hunting, and various festivals. The “Tung tung da zá” dance is often performed during community gatherings, at festivals, buffalo stabbing ceremonies, new rice celebrations, village establishment, Gươl house construction, and friendship ceremonies between villages, as a way for the Co Tu to connect with the universe, ancestors, and deities, expressing their reverence and gratitude towards those who cleared the land and established villages. “Tung tung” is the dance of men, symbolizing rising high, strength, stability, and valor, expressing the desire to conquer the universe and the wish for a better life. Meanwhile, “da zá” is the dance of women, symbolizing straightness and rhythm, embodying the spiritual aspiration of honoring the earth and sky, loyalty, and respect for hierarchy. In the vast space of the mountains and forests, along with the sounds of gongs and other traditional instruments, the “Tung tung da zá” dance serves as a prayer from the Co Tu to the deities and ancestors. Image copyright belongs to: Da Nang City Photography Club.

loc_122.long_description: The Hòa Bắc suspension bridge (Phò Nam bridge) connects the two banks of the Cu Đê River and is a familiar iconic image when mentioning this land. The bridge features a graceful cable-stayed design, arching over the emerald river, surrounded by rolling mountains shrouded in clouds. Standing on the bridge, visitors can gaze out and admire the picturesque beauty of Hòa Bắc, taking in the lush sugarcane fields and green corn plantations on either side of the bank. The bridge not only serves the local community but is also a trendy spot for photography, providing romantic cinematic-style photos.

loc_123.name: Alăng Như Homestay
loc_123.description: Officially operational since October 2019, Homestay Alăng Như is an initial highlight in the implementation of the project “Developing community tourism combined with preserving the culture of the Co Tu people in Tà Lang and Giàn Bí villages (Hòa Bắc commune),” contributing to the development of community tourism in Hòa Vang district. Through this, it introduces the culture of the Co Tu community in the two villages of Tà Lang and Giàn Bí to domestic and international tourists. Located about 35 km from the center of Da Nang city, Homestay Alăng Như is situated in Giàn Bí village (Hòa Bắc commune, Hòa Vang district) and is owned by Đinh Văn Như, a native of Giàn Bí village. The homestay is simply designed in the shape of a two-story stilt house; the first floor serves as a reception area, dining area, and common living space; the second floor features a large sleeping area with separate beds and curtains. The interior and exterior decoration uses locally available materials such as bamboo, wood, stone, and traditional items of the Co Tu people. Along with Homestay Alăng Như, a community tourism cooperative led by Như has been established. The cooperative has 7 main occupational groups operating right at the homestay, including: textile weaving, weaving, trekking, cuisine, gong performances, guiding, and cultural activities. Như stated: “All members of the cooperative are residents of the two villages of Tà Lang and Giàn Bí. Previously, they did not have stable jobs and only worked as hired laborers or in agriculture.” Eco-tourism exploration at the homestay should be scheduled 2-3 days in advance before the guests arrive to ensure thorough preparation. Guests can choose to experience a fixed tour itinerary or customize their experience according to their preferences. For the fixed tour, first, guests will be taken by the guiding group to visit the Co Tu village and learn about the history and culture of the local ethnic community. Next, guests will visit the traditional house of Giàn Bí village to experience textile weaving and then participate in weaving with artisans in the traditional house space of Tà Lang village. After a lunch break, guests will enjoy local specialties such as buffalo horn cakes, various wild vegetables, stream fish, and continue their experience with trekking and visiting other locations like Vũng Bọt stream and Khe Đương. In the evening, guests can join cultural activities, have a campfire with local residents, and enjoy a music party featuring traditional gong dances of the Co Tu people, creating an impressive night on the lush grass behind the homestay. Như mentioned: “In the near future, I plan to build a bathing area behind the homestay, along with constructing some huts in the grassy area of the homestay and planting fruit trees for guests to experience.”

loc_123.long_description: Hotel Royal Hoi An - MGallery is a luxurious 5-star hotel located by the Thu Bon River, bearing the prestigious MGallery brand of the Accor group. The hotel is designed based on the romantic story of Japanese merchant Sotaro Araki and Princess Ngoc Hoa of the Nguyen dynasty. The architecture here is a sophisticated blend of the elegant beauty of Japan and the charming Indochine style. The hotel features an infinity pool on the rooftop with panoramic views of the ancient town of Hoi An and the stylish The Deck bar. This is the perfect retreat for those who appreciate luxury, art, and cultural stories.

loc_124.name: Hội Yên Parish Church
loc_124.description: Hội Yên Parish Church belongs to the Hòa Vang Diocese – Đà Nẵng Diocese, with 130 households and 525 parishioners among a community of over 5,000 people in Hòa Bắc Commune, Hòa Vang District (Statistics from 2023). With its location considered advantageous, where "the mountain leans against the water," Hội Yên Parish Church embodies both the majestic strength of high mountains and the gentle serenity of the river. The church was built in the 1990s under challenging conditions. In 2018, the church was rebuilt with an attractive and harmonious architectural style. The design features high, wide arches that create a spacious atmosphere for the sanctuary. The choice of stone cladding for the church's exterior has created a unique feature with the prominent red tiled roof. True to its name, Hội Yên gathers all that is most peaceful in a rural area. Strolling around the church, one can feel the tranquility of the place with its grounds adorned with sacred statues. Parishioners pray together, children play joyfully, the church bells resonate, and doves hurriedly flap their wings to fly… these are the strangely peaceful images one encounters when visiting Hội Yên Parish Church. It is this extraordinary beauty and profound tranquility that have attracted a large number of visitors. Image copyright belongs to: Da Nang Photography Club and Danang FantastiCity.

loc_124.long_description: Wyndham Hoi An Royal Beachfront Resort & Villas is located at An Bang - Ha My beach, an international standard resort with modern and spacious design. The apartments and villas here all offer stunning sea views, with comfortable interiors that provide maximum relaxation. The resort features a large swimming pool right by the beach, restaurants serving a diverse range of Asian and European cuisine, and professional wellness spa services. The location of the resort is very convenient, close enough to explore the ancient town of Hoi An, yet secluded enough to enjoy the tranquility of the sea.

loc_125.name: Hoà Bắc suspension bridge
loc_125.description: The Hòa Bắc suspension bridge was started on January 15, 2001, and completed on September 2, 2002. The investor is the Department of Transport and Communications of Da Nang City. The Construction Corporation No. 5 supported the superstructure, the bridge was designed by Consulting Company 533, and the construction unit was Construction Enterprise 331. The bridge is 151.4 meters long, 7.5 meters wide, and has a load capacity of 8 tons. The total cost of building the bridge is approximately over 8 billion VND. The completion of the Hòa Bắc suspension bridge has fulfilled the dream of thousands of people living in Hòa Bắc commune along the banks of the Cu Đê River, connecting the center of the commune to the other side of the bridge, linking three hamlets: Lộc Mỹ, Nam Yên, and An Định. This is a beautiful sunset viewing spot from the west until the golden rays of the sun fade behind the mountain peaks. Hòa Bắc is about 40 km northwest of the city center, belonging to Hòa Vang district, Da Nang, situated between the Bạch Mã National Park and Bà Nà – Núi Chúa nature reserve, formed by mountain ranges with an average height of about 200 meters above sea level. This area boasts diverse primary forests, beautiful rivers, streams, and waterfalls, almost untouched by natural wilderness. Based on its advantages in terrain, climate, and rich resources, several ecological and community tourism areas have been established here, providing opportunities for visitors to explore, learn about, and experience the local scenery and culture. loc_125.long_description: Hoi An Memories Resort & Spa is located on Hoi An Memory Island, designed in the distinctive style of the ancient town with yellow walls and yin-yang roofs. The resort is part of a cultural-art complex, where guests can easily enjoy the live show "Hoi An Memories" right next door. The accommodations here feature a nostalgic beauty while still offering modern amenities, with views overlooking the picturesque Hoai River. Guests staying here can immerse themselves in a unique cultural and artistic atmosphere and enjoy high-end resort services in the heart of the heritage.

loc_126.name: Four Points by Sheraton Danang
loc_126.description: Four Points by Sheraton Danang is the first hotel under the Four Points by Sheraton brand in Vietnam, managed by the Marriott group, and officially opened on May 19, 2018.
loc_126.long_description: Four Points by Sheraton Danang is a 5-star hotel with 36 floors located right on the beachfront of My Khe, managed by Marriott International. The hotel impresses with its modern, dynamic design inspired by the ocean. All guest rooms feature private balconies with sweeping views of the blue sea and Son Tra Peninsula. The highlight of the hotel is the infinity pool on the upper floor and the Horizon bar with stunning panoramic views of the city. This is an ideal choice for business travelers and tourists looking to enjoy international-standard services right in the heart of the coastal tourist area.

loc_127.name: Sheraton Grand Danang Resort & Convention Center

loc_162.long_description: Mercure Bana Hills French Village offers a unique experience: "A Night in a Fairy Tale Castle." loc_172.description: The View – Yacht Restaurant has long been a familiar name to food enthusiasts in Da Nang. At The View, the dishes not only appeal to your taste buds, but all your senses will be stimulated by the distinctive elements present here.

loc_173.name: Hoang Tin Cuisine
loc_173.description: "Ẩm Thực Hoàng Tín is delicious in flavor and beautiful in presentation" is the praise that diners give to Ẩm Thực Hoàng Tín. Surely, you won't find a restaurant serving pork rice paper rolls with as many types of meat as Hoàng Tín. Serving all three types of meat: pork butt, pork belly, and the famous pork knuckle dish helps Hoàng Tín satisfy even the most discerning diners!
loc_173.long_description: Ẩm Thực Hoàng Tín is a famous address specializing in the specialty of Bánh tráng cuốn thịt heo - the "national soul" dish of Đà Nẵng. The special feature that makes Hoàng Tín's brand is the plate of two-layered pork belly that is either boiled or roasted to a crispy perfection, retaining its sweetness and tenderness. The fresh herbs served here are very delicious, with a variety of wild and aromatic greens. The restaurant has a spacious, clean atmosphere with a rustic yet polite style. In addition to the bánh tráng cuốn, the restaurant also serves many other delicious dishes such as Bún mắm nêm, Mì Quảng, and bánh bèo.
loc_173.address: 62A Nguyễn Văn Thoại, Bắc Mỹ Phú, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam

loc_174.name: Bánh Xèo Bà Dưỡng
loc_174.description: Bánh Xèo Bà Dưỡng is one of the most famous and long-standing bánh xèo restaurants in Da Nang. With over 20 years of experience, the restaurant serves crispy bánh xèo filled with generous shrimp and pork, accompanied by fresh herbs and a flavorful dipping sauce. The restaurant's space is simple and rustic but always crowded, especially during peak hours. This is a favorite destination for both locals and tourists wanting to enjoy the signature bánh xèo of Central Vietnam.
loc_174.long_description: Bánh Xèo Bà Dưỡng is located deep in a small alley on Hoàng Diệu Street but is always bustling with diners coming and going. This is the "legendary" bánh xèo restaurant of Da Nang with decades of history. The bánh xèo here has a crispy shell, generous fillings of shrimp and pork, and fresh bean sprouts. The soul of the dish lies in the thick, rich, and fragrant peanut dipping sauce (nước lèo), served alongside grilled nem lụi. Although the restaurant is always crowded, the service is very fast, providing a lively and memorable street food experience.
loc_174.address: 280/23 Hoàng Diệu, Bình Hiên, Hải Châu, Da Nang
advise: It's best to arrive early to avoid the crowds.
Order some nem lụi to enjoy as a side dish.
Prices range from 17,000 to 55,000 VND per serving.

loc_175.name: Mì Quảng Bà Mua
loc_175.description: Mì Quảng Bà Mua is a chain of famous mì quảng restaurants with over 27 years of experience, currently having 11 locations in Da Nang and Quang Nam. The restaurant serves authentic mì quảng with a rich broth, delicious chewy noodles, and a variety of toppings including shrimp, meat, quail eggs, and chicken. Notably, the crispy grilled rice paper and fresh herbs are essential highlights. The restaurant has a clean, airy space and offers quick service.
loc_175.long_description: Mì Quảng Bà Mua is a well-known chain of Mì Quảng restaurants with a wide presence throughout Da Nang. The Mì Quảng here is highly rated for its rich broth (nước nhưn), which is authentic to Quảng Nam. The menu is very diverse with many options such as chicken mì, shrimp and pork mì, beef mì, frog mì, and snakehead fish mì... The noodles are chewy and soft, served with crispy grilled rice paper and fresh greens (especially thinly sliced banana flower), creating an unforgettable flavor. Bà Mua is a reliable place for tourists to enjoy a hot, delicious bowl of Mì Quảng at any time of the day.
advise: You should order the mì quảng with shrimp and pork - a signature dish.
Add grilled rice paper to enjoy alongside.
There are many branches, so choose the nearest branch.

loc_176.name: Hải Sản Bé Mặn
loc_176.description: Hải Sản Bé Mặn is a famous seafood restaurant in Da Nang known for its fresh seafood and a variety of dishes made from shrimp, crab, blue crab, snails, fish, and more. The dishes are prepared in many ways: steamed, grilled, fried, stir-fried, etc. Notably, the beer-steamed crab and grilled lobster with cheese are specialties. The restaurant has a spacious and airy atmosphere with a view of the sea.
loc_176.long_description: Hải Sản Bé Mặn is located on Võ Nguyên Giáp Street, facing the sea, and is one of the most famous and crowded budget seafood restaurants in Da Nang. The restaurant operates on a "live selection" model, where diners can directly choose from various types of shrimp, crab, and snails swimming in tanks and request them to be cooked on the spot. The dishes at Bé Mặn are simply prepared but flavorful, preserving the natural sweetness of the seafood, especially the steamed chip chip with lemongrass or the stir-fried crab with tamarind. The atmosphere at the restaurant is always lively, filled with the sounds of cheers, reflecting the free-spirited drinking culture of the coastal people.
loc_176.address: Vo Nguyen Giap Street, Phuoc My, Son Tra, Da Nang
advise: You should ask for the prices before ordering.
Make a reservation in advance for the weekend.
Choose fresh seafood for the best taste.

loc_177.name: Madame Lân
loc_177.description: Madame Lân is a high-end restaurant specializing in contemporary Vietnamese cuisine, blending traditional flavors with modern cooking techniques. The restaurant features a luxurious and sophisticated space with a design that reflects Indochinese style. The diverse menu includes beautifully presented dishes made with premium ingredients. This is an ideal choice for special meals or important business meetings.
loc_177.long_description: Madame Lân restaurant is located on Bạch Đằng Street, impressing with its architecture that mimics the ancient tiled houses of Hoi An along the Han River. The restaurant has a spacious, airy atmosphere while still being very cozy and luxurious. Madame Lân is likened to a "miniature culinary museum" with a menu that gathers the essence of cuisine from the three regions: North, Central, and South. The dishes here are beautifully presented, with delicate flavors, ranging from light snacks like bánh xèo and nem lụi to high-end seafood dishes. This is a popular venue for business meetings or family dining.

loc_178.description: Trình Cà Phê, a famous local brand, has officially opened its kiosk at Bạch Đằng pedestrian street. As the first kiosk located right next to the Dragon Bridge, Trình Cà Phê impresses young people with its unique design, a glowing house.
loc_178.long_description: Trình Cà Phê is a popular "local" coffee chain among the youth of Da Nang, thanks to its rustic and cozy retro design style. The café is famous for its garden space shaded by green trees, low wooden tables and chairs, and nostalgic decor. The "best-seller" that has made Trình famous is the rich and fragrant Avocado Coffee, which visitors must try. The atmosphere at Trình always provides a relaxed and peaceful feeling, as if you are sitting in your own backyard.
loc_178.address: Bạch Đằng, Phước Ninh, Hải Châu, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam

loc_179.name: Trình Cà Phê - 25 Phạm Hồng Thái
loc_179.description: A new green sprout of Trình Cà Phê at 25 Phạm Hồng Thái, located near the Chicken Church, is open overnight until 1:30 AM, waiting for you to visit. This will be a cozy, simple, and cheerful stop. The café has a spacious, rustic, green space with a contemporary touch.
loc_179.long_description: Trình Cà Phê branch at 25 Phạm Hồng Thái is located in a bustling central area but still retains a distinct tranquility. The café utilizes the space of an old house, renovated with rough brick walls, tiled roofs, and beautiful climbing plants. This is an ideal spot to escape the midday sun or gather with friends in the evening. In addition to Avocado Coffee, the café also offers delicious fruit teas to cool down. The staff at Trình are always friendly and enthusiastic, creating a joyful and comfortable atmosphere for customers.
loc_179.address: 25 Phạm Hồng Thái, Hải Châu, Da Nang 55000, Vietnam
advise: It is advisable to hire a local guide to gain a better understanding of the history and culture.
Bring water and sunscreen when visiting.

loc_180.name: Cá Nóc Café
loc_180.description: Cá Nóc Café: Not just a coffee shop – but a home. When you want to find a place that gives you the feeling of being in your own home, Cá Nóc Café deserves to be on your checklist.
loc_180.long_description: Cá Nóc Café is hidden in a small alley on Nguyễn Hoàng Street, likened to a "secret garden" in the heart of the city. The café features a rustic design, using a lot of wood materials and planting many green trees, creating a cool space completely separated from the noisy traffic outside. Cá Nóc has a gentle vintage style, making it a popular spot for young people to read, work, or have heartfelt conversations. The drinks here are meticulously crafted, reasonably priced, and often accompanied by soothing acoustic music.
loc_180.address: 150/5 Nguyễn Hoàng Street, Phước Ninh, Thanh Khê, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam
loc_180.opening_hours: Every day from 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM Thank you for the post shared by Tui Đi Cà Phê (Fb)
advise: It is advisable to wear polite and comfortable clothing when visiting.
It is advisable to visit in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and crowds.

loc_181.name: Old Brick Oven Coffee Hoi An
loc_181.description: Cà phê Lò Gạch Cũ Hội An is located in Duy Xuyen district, just 5km from Hội An, with the old brick kiln situated right in the middle of the rice fields. Since last year, I have often come across photos of young people from Đà Nẵng and Hội An checking in at an old brick kiln in Quảng Nam. The photos are very cute and unique, making me want to save them immediately for my trip to Đà Nẵng – Hội An.
loc_181.long_description: Cà phê Lò Gạch Cũ is located amidst the vast rice fields in Duy Xuyen district (about 5km from Hội An) and has become a popular check-in spot on social media recently. The highlight of the café is the old abandoned brick kiln standing tall in the sky, connected by a beautifully winding bamboo bridge. Notably, there is a spiral staircase leading to the top of the brick kiln, which is dubbed the "stairway to heaven." Visitors coming here during the rice harvest season or at sunset will be able to admire the picturesque peaceful countryside scenery. The café serves various types of juices and clean coffee sourced from the on-site farmstay.
loc_181.address: Vinh Nam Village Stadium, Duy Xuyen, Quang Nam, Vietnam
advise: It is advisable to wear neat and comfortable clothing when visiting.
Check the weather before you go for the best experience.
It is advisable to hire a local guide to gain a better understanding of the history and culture.

loc_182.name: Trình Cà Phê - Nguyễn Hữu Thọ
loc_182.description: Under the distinctive fish scale tiled roof of traditional Vietnamese architecture and the rustic wooden walls, Trình Cà Phê at 111 Nguyễn Hữu Thọ embodies a very unique spirit – warm, sincere, yet radiating a deep sense of pride. That spirit is akin to the flavor of specialty Vietnamese coffee roasted fresh on-site, filling the corner of the street with its rich aroma.
loc_182.long_description: Trình Cà Phê at 34/4 Nguyễn Hữu Thọ (or the nearby Lê Đình Dương branch) continues to maintain the signature garden style of the chain. This branch often has a larger space, with a small Koi pond and many outdoor seating areas under the shade of trees. The café attracts a large number of students and working professionals who come to enjoy morning coffee. The rich coffee flavor, refreshing green space, and gentle Trịnh music are the factors that keep customers coming back to Trình.
loc_182.address: 111 Nguyễn Hữu Thọ, Hòa Thuận Nam, Hải Châu, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam
advise: It is advisable to hire a local guide to gain a better understanding of the history and culture.
Bring water and sunscreen when visiting.

loc_183.name: Trình Chợ Hàn
loc_183.description: "Trình Chợ Hàn – The sailboat setting out to sea" spreads joy and sends a warm greeting to people near and far coming here to the market.
loc_183.long_description: Trình Chợ Hàn is a new member of the Trình Cà Phê family, located right in the bustling Hàn market area, catering to the needs of tourists looking for a place to rest after shopping. The café maintains a rustic, nostalgic style but is blended with modern elements to suit the dynamic pace of the city center. Here, you can enjoy a famous Avocado Coffee while watching the busy flow of people passing by. This is an interesting stop to experience the intersection of the simplicity of street coffee and the vibrancy of tourism in Da Nang.
loc_183.address: Kiosk number 01, at the entrance of Hàn Market on Bạch Đằng Street. Opening hours: 7:30 AM – 7:30 PM. Located right in the city center, Hàn Market is one of the oldest and busiest markets in Đà Nẵng.
advise: Bring water and sunscreen when visiting.
It is advisable to visit in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and crowds.

loc_184.name: Starbucks Vincom Ngô Quyền
loc_184.description: Starbucks Vincom Ngô Quyền, Da Nang opened on September 9, 2018. With a history of over 50 years of formation and development, Starbucks is currently the most valuable beverage brand in the world.
loc_184.long_description: Starbucks Vincom is located on the ground floor of Vincom Plaza Ngô Quyền (Sơn Trà district). With the advantage of being in a bustling shopping area, it is an ideal stop for families and groups of friends after enjoying activities, watching movies, or shopping. The café features an open space design, directly connecting to the shopping mall's atrium and a spacious outdoor area. The menu here is always updated with a full range of seasonal drinks and the latest merchandise collections from Starbucks.
loc_184.address: VinCom Center Shopping Mall, 910A Ngô Quyền Lot L1, 11 Ng. Quyền, An Hải, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam
advise: Check the weather before you go for the best experience.
It is best to visit in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and crowds.
Bring water and sunscreen when visiting.

loc_185.name: Starbucks Bà Nà Hills
loc_185.description: Starbucks Bà Nà Hills, Da Nang opened on April 27, 2019. With a history of over 50 years of formation and development, Starbucks is currently the highest valued beverage brand in the world.
loc_185.long_description: Starbucks Bà Nà Hills is one of the most unique Starbucks locations, situated in the charming French Village at the top of Mount Chúa. The café is designed harmoniously with the surrounding Gothic architecture, providing a feeling of enjoying coffee in an authentic Parisian street corner. Amidst the chilly weather and the drifting fog of Bà Nà, a hot cup of coffee from the mermaid brand will warm the hearts of visitors. This is a "luxurious" check-in spot that cannot be missed when visiting Bà Nà.
loc_185.address: 1st Floor, Morin Hotel, French Village, Bà Nà Hills Tourist Area, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam
advise: Check the weather before you go for the best experience.
It is advisable to visit in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and crowds.

loc_186.name: Starbucks Nesta Hotel
loc_186.description: Starbucks Nesta Hotel, Da Nang opened on July 14, 2023. With a history of over 50 years of establishment and development, Starbucks is currently the most valuable beverage brand in the world.
loc_186.long_description: Starbucks Nesta Hotel is located on the ground floor of the Nesta Hotel (268 Võ Nguyên Giáp), opposite the beautiful My Khe beach. The café features a space filled with natural light thanks to large glass windows overlooking the sea and lush green palm trees. The interior design here is modern and youthful, fitting the beach resort atmosphere. Guests can purchase take-away coffee to stroll along the beach or sit back and enjoy the air conditioning while watching the bustling seaside streets.
loc_186.address: Nesta Hotel, 268 Vo Nguyen Giap, Bac My Phu, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam
advise: It's best to visit in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and crowds.
Bring water and sunscreen when sightseeing.

loc_187.name: Starbucks Trần Hưng Đạo
loc_187.description: Starbucks Trần Hưng Đạo, Da Nang opened on November 4, 2023. With a history of over 50 years of formation and development, Starbucks is currently the most valuable beverage brand in the world.
loc_187.long_description: Starbucks Trần Hưng Đạo is located on the East bank of the Han River, near the Love Bridge and the Carp Turning into a Dragon statue. The café features a striking, modern design and is an ideal spot to enjoy the night view of the Han River from the East bank. This location is very convenient for tourists to take a stroll and stop by to rest. The café has a spacious and quieter atmosphere compared to the Bạch Đằng bank, making it suitable for those looking for a place to work or read a book with a refreshing Frappuccino.
loc_187.address: 218 Trần Hưng Đạo Street, An Hải, Sơn Trà, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam
